PROJECT : MAA BHARTI NURSING COLLEGE, GAURAVPATH, KUSHALGARH
PLAN : nurse
JOB NO.: 1 REF. NO.:
DATE: 11/06/25 TIME: 09:45:17
Building Version: 1.640 STRUDS Version: 4.0.0

Foundation Design Detail Report :


(Design by Limit State Method as per IS 456 : 2000)

Standard Conventions:
Individual Footing

Design of FG1
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 197.03 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 131.36 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 13.14 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 144.49 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 216.74 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.43 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 3.70 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.65 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 5.55 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 144.49 / 250.00 = 0.578 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0033 m
= 0.003 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0282 m
= 0.028 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 0.839 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 0.689 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (144.49/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0033/0.839 )
= 0.592 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (144.49/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0282/0.689 )
= 0.720 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.125 x 1.275 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 1.434 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 100.73 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.4241 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 13.7681 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 115.93 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 85.54 kN/m²
UpMaxw(116.12 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL174.18128.61116.1285.74

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 151.10 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.1361 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 20.6521 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 173.89 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 128.31 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 128.61 + (1.125 - 0.412) x ((174.18 - 128.61)/1.125)
= 157.47 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (157.47+ 174.18)/2
= 68.40 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (157.47 + 2 x 174.18)
               / (3 x (157.47 + 174.18))
= 0.210 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 68.40 x 0.210 x 1.275
= 16.57 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 128.61 + (1.275 - 0.412) x ((174.18 - 128.61)/1.275)
= 159.44 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (159.44+ 174.18)/2
= 68.81 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (159.44 + 2 x 174.18) / (3 x (159.44 + 174.18))
= 0.209 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 68.81 x 0.209 x 1.125
= 16.01 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (197.03 / 1.434) x (1.434 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 99.72 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 99.72 / 1.589
= 62.77 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.275 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 777.14 kN-m > 16.57 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.125 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 656.84 kN-m > 16.01 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.275 x 0.470
= 0.599 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000098 m²
= 98 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01635 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.599/100
= 0.000719 m²
= 719 mm²

Provide #10 - 10 nos.(785 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.275 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(10 - 1)
= 0.129 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.125 x 0.460
= 0.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000097 m²
= 97 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01871 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.517/100
= 0.000621 m²
= 621 mm²

Provide #10 - 8 nos.(628 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.125 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(8 - 1)
= 0.145 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= -0.058 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= -0.048 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(1.434 m²)
= 1.434 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(1.434/0.135) = 3.260 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 197.03/0.135
= 1459.50 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 215.86 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.08 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 62.80 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 215.86 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.39 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 55.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.125 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
In Y direction= (1.275 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.125 x 1.275 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 10 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 8 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG2
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 196.69 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 131.12 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 13.11 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 144.24 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 216.36 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.48 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 3.12 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.72 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 4.69 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 144.24 / 250.00 = 0.577 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0037 m
= 0.004 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0238 m
= 0.024 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 0.838 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 0.688 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (144.24/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0037/0.838 )
= 0.592 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (144.24/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0238/0.688 )
= 0.697 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.125 x 1.275 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 1.434 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 100.56 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.5736 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 11.6155 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 113.75 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 87.37 kN/m²
UpMaxw(113.93 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL170.89131.33113.9387.55

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 150.84 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.3604 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 17.4233 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 170.62 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 131.05 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 131.33 + (1.125 - 0.412) x ((170.89 - 131.33)/1.125)
= 156.38 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (156.38+ 170.89)/2
= 67.50 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (156.38 + 2 x 170.89)
               / (3 x (156.38 + 170.89))
= 0.209 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 67.50 x 0.209 x 1.275
= 16.56 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 131.33 + (1.275 - 0.412) x ((170.89 - 131.33)/1.275)
= 158.09 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (158.09+ 170.89)/2
= 67.85 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (158.09 + 2 x 170.89) / (3 x (158.09 + 170.89))
= 0.209 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 67.85 x 0.209 x 1.125
= 15.74 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (196.69 / 1.434) x (1.434 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 99.55 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 99.55 / 1.589
= 62.66 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.275 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 777.14 kN-m > 16.56 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.125 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 656.84 kN-m > 15.74 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.275 x 0.470
= 0.599 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000098 m²
= 98 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01634 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.599/100
= 0.000719 m²
= 719 mm²

Provide #10 - 10 nos.(785 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.275 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(10 - 1)
= 0.129 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.125 x 0.460
= 0.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000095 m²
= 95 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01840 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.517/100
= 0.000621 m²
= 621 mm²

Provide #10 - 8 nos.(628 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.125 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(8 - 1)
= 0.145 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= -0.058 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= -0.048 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(1.434 m²)
= 1.434 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(1.434/0.135) = 3.260 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 196.69/0.135
= 1456.94 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 215.51 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.86 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 62.80 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 215.51 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.40 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 55.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.125 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
In Y direction= (1.275 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.125 x 1.275 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 10 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 8 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG3
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 99.80 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 66.54 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 6.65 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 73.19 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 109.78 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 3.96 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.62 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 5.95 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.93 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 73.19 / 250.00 = 0.293 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0596 m
= 0.060 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0093 m
= 0.009 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 0.621 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 0.471 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (73.19/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0596/0.621 )
= 0.461 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (73.19/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0093/0.471 )
= 0.327 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.125 x 1.275 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 1.434 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 51.03 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 13.0057 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 2.2979 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 66.33 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 35.72 kN/m²
UpMaxw(66.91 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL100.3754.4666.9136.31

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 76.54 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 19.5085 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 3.4468 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 99.49 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 53.58 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 54.46 + (1.125 - 0.412) x ((100.37 - 54.46)/1.125)
= 83.54 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (83.54+ 100.37)/2
= 37.93 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (83.54 + 2 x 100.37)
               / (3 x (83.54 + 100.37))
= 0.213 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 37.93 x 0.213 x 1.275
= 9.90 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 54.46 + (1.275 - 0.412) x ((100.37 - 54.46)/1.275)
= 85.52 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (85.52+ 100.37)/2
= 38.34 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (85.52 + 2 x 100.37) / (3 x (85.52 + 100.37))
= 0.212 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 38.34 x 0.212 x 1.125
= 7.58 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (99.80 / 1.434) x (1.434 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 50.51 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 50.51 / 1.589
= 31.80 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.275 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 777.14 kN-m > 9.90 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.125 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 656.84 kN-m > 7.58 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.275 x 0.470
= 0.599 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000058 m²
= 58 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.00976 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.599/100
= 0.000719 m²
= 719 mm²

Provide #10 - 10 nos.(785 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.275 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(10 - 1)
= 0.129 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.125 x 0.460
= 0.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000046 m²
= 46 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.00885 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.517/100
= 0.000621 m²
= 621 mm²

Provide #10 - 8 nos.(628 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.125 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(8 - 1)
= 0.145 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= -0.058 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= -0.048 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(1.434 m²)
= 1.434 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(1.434/0.135) = 3.260 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 99.80/0.135
= 739.29 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 118.63 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.30 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 62.80 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 118.63 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.43 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 55.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.125 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
In Y direction= (1.275 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.125 x 1.275 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 10 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 8 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG4
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 221.55 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 147.70 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 14.77 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 162.47 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 243.71 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.78 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.99 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 1.18 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 1.48 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 162.47 / 250.00 = 0.650 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0053 m
= 0.005 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0067 m
= 0.007 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 0.885 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 0.735 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (162.47/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0053/0.885 )
= 0.673 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (162.47/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0067/0.735 )
= 0.685 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.125 x 1.275 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 1.434 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 113.27 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.5707 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 3.6630 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 119.50 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 107.04 kN/m²
UpMaxw(119.59 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL179.38160.68119.59107.12

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 169.90 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.8560 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 5.4945 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 179.26 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 160.55 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 160.68 + (1.125 - 0.412) x ((179.38 - 160.68)/1.125)
= 172.52 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (172.52+ 179.38)/2
= 72.58 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (172.52 + 2 x 179.38)
               / (3 x (172.52 + 179.38))
= 0.208 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 72.58 x 0.208 x 1.275
= 18.75 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 160.68 + (1.275 - 0.412) x ((179.38 - 160.68)/1.275)
= 173.33 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (173.33+ 179.38)/2
= 72.75 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (173.33 + 2 x 179.38) / (3 x (173.33 + 179.38))
= 0.207 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 72.75 x 0.207 x 1.125
= 16.67 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (221.55 / 1.434) x (1.434 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 112.13 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 112.13 / 1.589
= 70.59 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.275 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 777.14 kN-m > 18.75 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.125 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 656.84 kN-m > 16.67 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.275 x 0.470
= 0.599 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000111 m²
= 111 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01852 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.599/100
= 0.000719 m²
= 719 mm²

Provide #10 - 10 nos.(785 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.275 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(10 - 1)
= 0.129 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.125 x 0.460
= 0.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000101 m²
= 101 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01949 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.517/100
= 0.000621 m²
= 621 mm²

Provide #10 - 8 nos.(628 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.125 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(8 - 1)
= 0.145 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= -0.058 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= -0.048 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(1.434 m²)
= 1.434 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(1.434/0.135) = 3.260 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 221.55/0.135
= 1641.12 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 240.38 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.51 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 62.80 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 240.38 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.31 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 55.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.125 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
In Y direction= (1.275 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.125 x 1.275 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 10 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 8 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG5
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 317.54 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 211.69 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 21.17 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 232.86 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 349.29 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 6.63 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.54 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 9.95 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 2.30 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 232.86 / 250.00 = 0.931 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0313 m
= 0.031 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0073 m
= 0.007 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 1.043 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 0.893 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (232.86/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0313/1.043 )
= 1.099 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (232.86/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0073/0.893 )
= 0.977 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.125 x 1.275 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 1.434 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 162.34 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 21.7556 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 5.7123 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 189.81 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 134.87 kN/m²
UpMaxw(190.58 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL285.86203.46190.58135.64

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 243.51 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 32.6335 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 8.5685 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 284.72 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 202.31 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 203.46 + (1.125 - 0.412) x ((285.86 - 203.46)/1.125)
= 255.65 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (255.65+ 285.86)/2
= 111.69 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (255.65 + 2 x 285.86)
               / (3 x (255.65 + 285.86))
= 0.210 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 111.69 x 0.210 x 1.275
= 29.09 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 203.46 + (1.275 - 0.412) x ((285.86 - 203.46)/1.275)
= 259.20 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (259.20+ 285.86)/2
= 112.42 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (259.20 + 2 x 285.86) / (3 x (259.20 + 285.86))
= 0.210 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 112.42 x 0.210 x 1.125
= 23.95 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (317.54 / 1.434) x (1.434 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 160.71 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 160.71 / 1.589
= 101.17 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.275 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 777.14 kN-m > 29.09 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.125 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 656.84 kN-m > 23.95 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.275 x 0.470
= 0.599 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000173 m²
= 173 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.02879 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.599/100
= 0.000719 m²
= 719 mm²

Provide #10 - 10 nos.(785 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.275 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(10 - 1)
= 0.129 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.125 x 0.460
= 0.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000145 m²
= 145 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.02804 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.517/100
= 0.000621 m²
= 621 mm²

Provide #10 - 8 nos.(628 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.125 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(8 - 1)
= 0.145 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= -0.058 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= -0.048 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(1.434 m²)
= 1.434 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(1.434/0.135) = 3.260 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 317.54/0.135
= 2352.12 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 336.36 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.83 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 62.80 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 336.36 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 3.98 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 55.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.125 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
In Y direction= (1.275 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.125 x 1.275 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 10 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 8 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG6
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 311.80 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 207.87 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 20.79 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 228.66 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 342.98 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 5.69 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.00 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 8.54 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 1.50 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 228.66 / 250.00 = 0.915 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0274 m
= 0.027 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0048 m
= 0.005 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 1.034 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 0.884 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (228.66/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0274/1.034 )
= 1.060 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (228.66/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0048/0.884 )
= 0.945 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.125 x 1.275 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 1.434 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 159.41 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 18.6695 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 3.7236 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 181.81 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 137.02 kN/m²
UpMaxw(182.24 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL273.36206.18182.24137.45

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 239.12 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 28.0043 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 5.5855 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 272.71 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 205.53 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 206.18 + (1.125 - 0.412) x ((273.36 - 206.18)/1.125)
= 248.73 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (248.73+ 273.36)/2
= 107.68 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (248.73 + 2 x 273.36)
               / (3 x (248.73 + 273.36))
= 0.209 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 107.68 x 0.209 x 1.275
= 28.23 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 206.18 + (1.275 - 0.412) x ((273.36 - 206.18)/1.275)
= 251.63 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (251.63+ 273.36)/2
= 108.28 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (251.63 + 2 x 273.36) / (3 x (251.63 + 273.36))
= 0.209 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 108.28 x 0.209 x 1.125
= 23.31 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (311.80 / 1.434) x (1.434 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 157.81 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 157.81 / 1.589
= 99.34 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.275 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 777.14 kN-m > 28.23 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.125 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 656.84 kN-m > 23.31 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.275 x 0.470
= 0.599 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000167 m²
= 167 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.02794 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.599/100
= 0.000719 m²
= 719 mm²

Provide #10 - 10 nos.(785 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.275 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(10 - 1)
= 0.129 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.125 x 0.460
= 0.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000141 m²
= 141 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.02728 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.517/100
= 0.000621 m²
= 621 mm²

Provide #10 - 8 nos.(628 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.125 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(8 - 1)
= 0.145 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= -0.058 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= -0.048 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(1.434 m²)
= 1.434 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(1.434/0.135) = 3.260 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 311.80/0.135
= 2309.66 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 330.63 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.63 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 62.80 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 330.63 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 3.43 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 55.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.125 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
In Y direction= (1.275 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.125 x 1.275 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 10 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 8 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG7
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 212.08 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 141.39 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 14.14 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 155.53 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 233.29 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.74 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.47 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 1.10 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.70 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 155.53 / 250.00 = 0.622 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0052 m
= 0.005 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0033 m
= 0.003 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 0.867 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 0.717 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (155.53/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0052/0.867 )
= 0.644 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (155.53/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0033/0.717 )
= 0.639 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.125 x 1.275 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 1.434 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 108.43 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.4123 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.7302 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 112.57 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 104.28 kN/m²
UpMaxw(112.61 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL168.91156.49112.61104.32

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 162.64 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.6185 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 2.5954 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 168.86 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 156.43 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 156.49 + (1.125 - 0.412) x ((168.91 - 156.49)/1.125)
= 164.36 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (164.36+ 168.91)/2
= 68.74 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (164.36 + 2 x 168.91)
               / (3 x (164.36 + 168.91))
= 0.207 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 68.74 x 0.207 x 1.275
= 17.94 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 156.49 + (1.275 - 0.412) x ((168.91 - 156.49)/1.275)
= 164.89 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (164.89+ 168.91)/2
= 68.85 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (164.89 + 2 x 168.91) / (3 x (164.89 + 168.91))
= 0.207 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 68.85 x 0.207 x 1.125
= 15.76 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (212.08 / 1.434) x (1.434 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 107.34 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 107.34 / 1.589
= 67.57 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.275 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 777.14 kN-m > 17.94 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.125 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 656.84 kN-m > 15.76 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.275 x 0.470
= 0.599 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000106 m²
= 106 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01771 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.599/100
= 0.000719 m²
= 719 mm²

Provide #10 - 10 nos.(785 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.275 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(10 - 1)
= 0.129 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.125 x 0.460
= 0.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000095 m²
= 95 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01842 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.517/100
= 0.000621 m²
= 621 mm²

Provide #10 - 8 nos.(628 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.125 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(8 - 1)
= 0.145 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= -0.058 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= -0.048 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(1.434 m²)
= 1.434 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(1.434/0.135) = 3.260 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 212.08/0.135
= 1570.97 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 230.91 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.32 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 62.80 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 230.91 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.30 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 55.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.125 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
In Y direction= (1.275 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.125 x 1.275 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 10 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 8 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG8
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 115.81 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 77.21 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 7.72 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 84.93 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 127.39 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 8.19 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.20 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 12.28 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.31 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 84.93 / 250.00 = 0.340 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.1061 m
= 0.106 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0026 m
= 0.003 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 0.663 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 0.513 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (84.93/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.1061/0.663 )
= 0.666 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (84.93/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0026/0.513 )
= 0.350 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.125 x 1.275 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 1.434 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 59.21 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 26.8656 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.7606 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 86.84 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 31.58 kN/m²
UpMaxw(87.18 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL130.7747.8987.1831.93

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 88.81 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 40.2984 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.1410 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 130.25 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 47.37 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 47.89 + (1.125 - 0.412) x ((130.77 - 47.89)/1.125)
= 100.38 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (100.38+ 130.77)/2
= 47.68 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (100.38 + 2 x 130.77)
               / (3 x (100.38 + 130.77))
= 0.215 m
