Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 47.68 x 0.215 x 1.275
= 12.94 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2
= 0.412 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 47.89 + (1.275 - 0.412) x ((130.77 - 47.89)/1.275)
= 103.96 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.412 x (103.96+ 130.77)/2
= 48.41 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.412 x (103.96 + 2 x 130.77) / (3 x (103.96 + 130.77))
= 0.214 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 48.41 x 0.214 x 1.125
= 8.59 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (115.81 / 1.434) x (1.434 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 58.61 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 58.61 / 1.589
= 36.90 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.275 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 777.14 kN-m > 12.94 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.125 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 656.84 kN-m > 8.59 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.275 x 0.470
= 0.599 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000076 m²
= 76 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01276 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.599/100
= 0.000719 m²
= 719 mm²

Provide #10 - 10 nos.(785 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.275 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(10 - 1)
= 0.129 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.125 x 0.460
= 0.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000052 m²
= 52 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.01002 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.517/100
= 0.000621 m²
= 621 mm²

Provide #10 - 8 nos.(628 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.125 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(8 - 1)
= 0.145 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.125 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= -0.058 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.275 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= -0.048 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(1.434 m²)
= 1.434 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(1.434/0.135) = 3.260 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 115.81/0.135
= 857.86 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 134.64 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.06 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 62.80 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 18.83 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 134.64 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 4.80 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 55.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.125 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
In Y direction= (1.275 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050 + 0.120
= 482.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.125 x 1.275 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 10 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 8 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG9
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 983.05 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 655.36 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 65.54 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 720.90 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1081.35 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 3.70 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 3.79 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 5.55 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 5.68 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 720.90 / 250.00 = 2.884 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0056 m
= 0.006 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0058 m
= 0.006 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 1.775 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 1.625 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (720.90/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0056/1.775 )
= 2.939 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (720.90/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0058/1.625 )
= 2.945 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.675 x 1.825 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 3.057 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 235.83 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.9801 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 4.4399 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 244.25 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 227.41 kN/m²
UpMaxw(244.32 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL366.49341.23244.32227.48

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 353.74 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 5.9702 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 6.6598 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 366.37 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 341.11 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.675 - 0.300)/2
= 0.688 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 341.23 + (1.675 - 0.688) x ((366.49 - 341.23)/1.675)
= 356.12 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.688 x (356.12+ 366.49)/2
= 248.40 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.688 x (356.12 + 2 x 366.49)
               / (3 x (356.12 + 366.49))
= 0.345 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 248.40 x 0.345 x 1.825
= 154.44 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.825 - 0.450)/2
= 0.688 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 341.23 + (1.825 - 0.688) x ((366.49 - 341.23)/1.825)
= 356.97 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.688 x (356.97+ 366.49)/2
= 248.69 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.688 x (356.97 + 2 x 366.49) / (3 x (356.97 + 366.49))
= 0.345 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 248.69 x 0.345 x 1.675
= 142.00 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (983.05 / 3.057) x (3.057 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 755.23 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 755.23 / 1.589
= 475.41 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.825 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 1112.38 kN-m > 154.44 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.675 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 977.97 kN-m > 142.00 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.825 x 0.470
= 0.858 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000932 m²
= 932 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10860 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.858/100
= 0.001029 m²
= 1029 mm²

Provide #10 - 14 nos.(1100 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.825 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(14 - 1)
= 0.132 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.675 x 0.460
= 0.770 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000876 m²
= 876 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11371 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.770/100
= 0.000925 m²
= 925 mm²

Provide #10 - 12 nos.(942 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.675 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(12 - 1)
= 0.142 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.675 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= 0.218 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 341.23 + (1.675 - 0.218) x ((366.49 - 341.23)/1.675)
= 363.21 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.218 x 1.825) x 364.85
= 142.71 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.470 x 1.825
= 0.858 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001100 x 100)/0.858
= 0.12819
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 142.71 / 0.858
= 166.38 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.825 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= 0.227 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 341.23 + (1.825 - 0.227) x ((366.49 - 341.23)/1.825)
= 363.34 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.227 x 1.675) x 364.91
= 136.79 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.460 x 1.675
= 0.770 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.000942 x 100)/0.770
= 0.12232
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 136.79 / 0.770
= 177.53 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(3.057 m²)
= 3.057 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(3.057/0.135) = 4.759 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 983.05/0.135
= 7281.82 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 40.12 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1023.17 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 4.04 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 89.90 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 40.12 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1023.17 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 5.02 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 82.51 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.675 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 637.500 mm
In Y direction= (1.825 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 637.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.675 x 1.825 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 14 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 12 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG10
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1639.13 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1092.76 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 109.28 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1202.03 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1803.05 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 21.97 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.66 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 32.96 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.99 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1202.03 / 250.00 = 4.808 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0201 m
= 0.020 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0006 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.269 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.119 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1202.03/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0201/2.269 )
= 5.064 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1202.03/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0006/2.119 )
= 4.816 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.200 x 2.350 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.170 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 232.50 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 10.8502 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.3497 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 243.70 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 221.30 kN/m²
UpMaxw(243.72 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL365.58331.98243.72221.32

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 348.75 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 16.2753 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.5245 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 365.55 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 331.95 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.200 - 0.300)/2
= 0.950 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 331.98 + (2.200 - 0.950) x ((365.58 - 331.98)/2.200)
= 351.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.950 x (351.07+ 365.58)/2
= 340.41 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.950 x (351.07 + 2 x 365.58)
               / (3 x (351.07 + 365.58))
= 0.478 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 340.41 x 0.478 x 2.350
= 382.12 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.350 - 0.450)/2
= 0.950 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 331.98 + (2.350 - 0.950) x ((365.58 - 331.98)/2.350)
= 351.99 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.950 x (351.99+ 365.58)/2
= 340.85 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.950 x (351.99 + 2 x 365.58) / (3 x (351.99 + 365.58))
= 0.478 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 340.85 x 0.478 x 2.200
= 346.60 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.619 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.607 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.619 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.619 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.619 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.619)
= 1.138 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.619)
= 1.323 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.461 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1639.13 / 5.170) x (5.170 - (0.919 x 1.069))
= 1327.66 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1327.66 / 2.461
= 539.45 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.350 x 0.619 x 0.619
= 2492.56 kN-m > 382.12 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.200 x 0.607 x 0.607
= 2258.79 kN-m > 346.60 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.350 x 0.619
= 1.455 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001755 m²
= 1755 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.12062 %

Provide #12 - 17 nos.(1923 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.350 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(17 - 1)
= 0.140 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.200 x 0.607
= 1.335 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001623 m²
= 1623 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.12156 %

Provide #12 - 15 nos.(1696 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.200 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(15 - 1)
= 0.149 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.200 - 0.300)/2 - 0.619
= 0.331 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 331.98 + (2.200 - 0.331) x ((365.58 - 331.98)/2.200)
= 360.52 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.331 x 2.350) x 363.05
= 270.80 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.619 x 2.350
= 1.455 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001923 x 100)/1.455
= 0.13217
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 270.80 / 1.455
= 185.86 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.350 - 0.450)/2 - 0.607
= 0.343 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 331.98 + (2.350 - 0.343) x ((365.58 - 331.98)/2.350)
= 360.67 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.343 x 2.200) x 363.12
= 271.28 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.607 x 2.200
= 1.335 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001696 x 100)/1.335
= 0.12704
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 271.28 / 1.335
= 202.15 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(5.170 m²)
= 5.170 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.170/0.135) = 6.188 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1639.13/0.135
= 12141.73 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 87.24 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1726.38 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.41 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 142.41 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 87.24 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1726.38 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 25.56 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 133.32 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.200 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 900.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.350 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 900.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(619.000 / 607.000) + 300.000
= 907.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(619.000 / 607.000)
= 607 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.200 x 2.350 x 0.675 m
Provide #12 - 17 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 15 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG11
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 854.17 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 569.45 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 56.95 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 626.40 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 939.59 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 5.03 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.68 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 7.54 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 2.52 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 626.40 / 250.00 = 2.506 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0088 m
= 0.009 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0030 m
= 0.003 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 1.660 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 1.510 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (626.40/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0088/1.660 )
= 2.586 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (626.40/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0030/1.510 )
= 2.535 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.550 x 1.700 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 2.635 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 237.72 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 6.7337 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 2.4704 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.93 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 228.52 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.00 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.49342.88247.00228.59

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 356.58 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 10.1006 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 3.7056 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.39 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 342.78 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.550 - 0.300)/2
= 0.625 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 342.88 + (1.550 - 0.625) x ((370.49 - 342.88)/1.550)
= 359.36 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.625 x (359.36+ 370.49)/2
= 228.08 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.625 x (359.36 + 2 x 370.49)
               / (3 x (359.36 + 370.49))
= 0.314 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 228.08 x 0.314 x 1.700
= 120.85 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (1.700 - 0.450)/2
= 0.625 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 342.88 + (1.700 - 0.625) x ((370.49 - 342.88)/1.700)
= 360.34 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.625 x (360.34+ 370.49)/2
= 228.39 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.625 x (360.34 + 2 x 370.49) / (3 x (360.34 + 370.49))
= 0.314 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 228.39 x 0.314 x 1.550
= 108.80 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.470 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.460 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.470 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.470 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.470 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.470)
= 0.724 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.470 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.470)
= 0.865 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.589 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (854.17 / 2.635) x (2.635 - (0.770 x 0.920))
= 624.54 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 624.54 / 1.589
= 393.14 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 1.700 x 0.470 x 0.470
= 1036.19 kN-m > 120.85 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.550 x 0.460 x 0.460
= 904.99 kN-m > 108.80 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 1.700 x 0.470
= 0.799 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000726 m²
= 726 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09089 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.799/100
= 0.000959 m²
= 959 mm²

Provide #10 - 13 nos.(1021 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.700 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(13 - 1)
= 0.133 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.550 x 0.460
= 0.713 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.000668 m²
= 668 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09374 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 0.713/100
= 0.000856 m²
= 856 mm²

Provide #10 - 11 nos.(864 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.550 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(11 - 1)
= 0.144 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.550 - 0.300)/2 - 0.470
= 0.155 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 342.88 + (1.550 - 0.155) x ((370.49 - 342.88)/1.550)
= 367.73 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.155 x 1.700) x 369.11
= 94.84 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.470 x 1.700
= 0.799 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001021 x 100)/0.799
= 0.12779
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 94.84 / 0.799
= 118.70 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (1.700 - 0.450)/2 - 0.460
= 0.165 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 342.88 + (1.700 - 0.165) x ((370.49 - 342.88)/1.700)
= 367.81 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.165 x 1.550) x 369.15
= 93.53 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.460 x 1.550
= 0.713 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.000864 x 100)/0.713
= 0.12117
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 93.53 / 0.713
= 131.18 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(2.635 m²)
= 2.635 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(2.635/0.135) = 4.418 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 854.17/0.135
= 6327.22 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 34.58 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 888.76 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.31 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 83.74 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 34.58 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 888.76 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 5.78 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 76.35 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.550 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 575.000 mm
In Y direction= (1.700 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 575.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(470.000 / 460.000) + 300.000
= 760.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(470.000 / 460.000)
= 460 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.550 x 1.700 x 0.525 m
Provide #10 - 13 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 11 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG12
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1564.72 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1043.15 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 104.31 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1147.46 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1721.19 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 6.59 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 13.21 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 9.88 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 19.82 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1147.46 / 250.00 = 4.590 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0063 m
= 0.006 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0127 m
= 0.013 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.219 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.069 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1147.46/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0063/2.219 )
= 4.668 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1147.46/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0127/2.069 )
= 4.758 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.125 x 2.275 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 4.834 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 237.35 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.5940 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 7.7161 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.66 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 226.04 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.78 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.17339.24248.78226.16

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 356.03 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 5.3910 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 11.5742 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.00 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 339.07 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.125 - 0.300)/2
= 0.913 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 339.24 + (2.125 - 0.913) x ((373.17 - 339.24)/2.125)
= 358.60 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.913 x (358.60+ 373.17)/2
= 333.87 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.913 x (358.60 + 2 x 373.17)
               / (3 x (358.60 + 373.17))
= 0.459 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 333.87 x 0.459 x 2.275
= 340.86 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.275 - 0.450)/2
= 0.913 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 339.24 + (2.275 - 0.913) x ((373.17 - 339.24)/2.275)
= 359.56 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.913 x (359.56+ 373.17)/2
= 334.31 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.913 x (359.56 + 2 x 373.17) / (3 x (359.56 + 373.17))
= 0.459 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 334.31 x 0.459 x 2.125
= 322.48 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.620 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.610 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.620 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.620 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.620 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.620)
= 1.141 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.620)
= 1.327 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.468 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1564.72 / 4.834) x (4.834 - (0.920 x 1.070))
= 1246.10 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1246.10 / 2.468
= 504.99 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.275 x 0.620 x 0.620
= 2413.01 kN-m > 340.86 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.125 x 0.610 x 0.610
= 2181.79 kN-m > 322.48 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.275 x 0.620
= 1.411 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001559 m²
= 1559 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11054 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.411/100
= 0.001693 m²
= 1693 mm²

Provide #10 - 22 nos.(1728 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.275 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.103 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.125 x 0.610
= 1.296 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001501 m²
= 1501 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11580 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.296/100
= 0.001555 m²
= 1556 mm²

Provide #10 - 21 nos.(1649 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.125 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.101 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.125 - 0.300)/2 - 0.620
= 0.292 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 339.24 + (2.125 - 0.292) x ((373.17 - 339.24)/2.125)
= 368.50 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.292 x 2.275) x 370.84
= 243.56 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.620 x 2.275
= 1.411 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001728 x 100)/1.411
= 0.12250
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 243.56 / 1.411
= 172.68 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.275 - 0.450)/2 - 0.610
= 0.303 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 339.24 + (2.275 - 0.303) x ((373.17 - 339.24)/2.275)
= 368.66 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.303 x 2.125) x 370.92
= 231.87 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.610 x 2.125
= 1.296 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001649 x 100)/1.296
= 0.12724
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 231.87 / 1.296
= 178.87 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(4.834 m²)
= 4.834 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(4.834/0.135) = 5.984 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1564.72/0.135
= 11590.52 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 81.58 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1646.30 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 15.15 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 137.86 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 81.58 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1646.30 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 7.44 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 128.77 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.125 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 862.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.275 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 862.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(620.000 / 610.000) + 300.000
= 910.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(620.000 / 610.000)
= 610 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.125 x 2.275 x 0.675 m
Provide #10 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 21 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG13
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1503.07 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1002.05 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 100.21 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1102.26 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1653.38 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 4.50 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 12.63 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 6.74 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 18.94 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1102.26 / 250.00 = 4.409 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0045 m
= 0.004 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0126 m
= 0.013 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.176 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.026 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1102.26/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0045/2.176 )
= 4.464 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1102.26/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0126/2.026 )
= 4.574 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.075 x 2.225 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 4.617 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 238.74 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.6257 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 7.9100 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.28 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 228.21 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.37 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.05342.44249.37228.30

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 358.12 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.9386 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 11.8650 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.92 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 342.31 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.075 - 0.300)/2
= 0.888 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 342.44 + (2.075 - 0.888) x ((374.05 - 342.44)/2.075)
= 360.53 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.888 x (360.53+ 374.05)/2
= 325.97 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.888 x (360.53 + 2 x 374.05)
               / (3 x (360.53 + 374.05))
= 0.446 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 325.97 x 0.446 x 2.225
= 316.27 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.225 - 0.450)/2
= 0.887 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 342.44 + (2.225 - 0.887) x ((374.05 - 342.44)/2.225)
= 361.44 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.887 x (361.44+ 374.05)/2
= 326.38 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.887 x (361.44 + 2 x 374.05) / (3 x (361.44 + 374.05))
= 0.446 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 326.38 x 0.446 x 2.075
= 299.77 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.620 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.610 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.620 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.620 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.620 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.620)
= 1.141 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.620)
= 1.327 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.468 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1503.07 / 4.617) x (4.617 - (0.920 x 1.070))
= 1182.59 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1182.59 / 2.468
= 479.25 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.225 x 0.620 x 0.620
= 2359.98 kN-m > 316.27 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.075 x 0.610 x 0.610
= 2130.45 kN-m > 299.77 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.225 x 0.620
= 1.379 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001445 m²
= 1445 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10475 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.379/100
= 0.001655 m²
= 1655 mm²

Provide #10 - 22 nos.(1728 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.225 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.101 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.075 x 0.610
= 1.266 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001394 m²
= 1394 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11010 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.266/100
= 0.001519 m²
= 1519 mm²

Provide #10 - 20 nos.(1571 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.075 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.103 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.075 - 0.300)/2 - 0.620
= 0.268 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 342.44 + (2.075 - 0.268) x ((374.05 - 342.44)/2.075)
= 369.98 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.268 x 2.225) x 372.01
= 219.30 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.620 x 2.225
= 1.379 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001728 x 100)/1.379
= 0.12525
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 219.30 / 1.379
= 158.97 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.225 - 0.450)/2 - 0.610
= 0.277 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 342.44 + (2.225 - 0.277) x ((374.05 - 342.44)/2.225)
= 370.11 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.277 x 2.075) x 372.08
= 208.19 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.610 x 2.075
= 1.266 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001571 x 100)/1.266
= 0.12410
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 208.19 / 1.266
= 164.48 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(4.617 m²)
= 4.617 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(4.617/0.135) = 5.848 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1503.07/0.135
= 11133.89 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 77.91 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1580.98 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 14.84 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 134.83 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 77.91 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1580.98 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 5.29 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 125.74 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.075 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 837.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.225 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 837.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Diameter of Column bar d2 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd2' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(620.000 / 610.000) + 300.000
= 910.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Diameter of Column bar 'd2' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd2' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(620.000 / 610.000)
= 610 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.075 x 2.225 x 0.675 m
Provide #10 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG14
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1379.84 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 919.90 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 91.99 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1011.88 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1517.83 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 6.05 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 2.64 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 9.07 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 3.96 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1011.88 / 250.00 = 4.048 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0066 m
= 0.007 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0029 m
= 0.003 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.088 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 1.938 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1011.88/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0066/2.088 )
= 4.124 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1011.88/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0029/1.938 )
= 4.083 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.975 x 2.125 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 4.197 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 241.10 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 4.0698 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.9104 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.08 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 235.12 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.12 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.68352.73247.12235.16

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 361.66 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 6.1047 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 2.8655 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.63 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 352.69 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.975 - 0.300)/2
= 0.837 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.73 + (1.975 - 0.837) x ((370.68 - 352.73)/1.975)
= 363.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.837 x (363.07+ 370.68)/2
= 307.25 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.837 x (363.07 + 2 x 370.68)
               / (3 x (363.07 + 370.68))
= 0.420 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 307.25 x 0.420 x 2.125
= 272.79 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.125 - 0.450)/2
= 0.837 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 352.73 + (2.125 - 0.837) x ((370.68 - 352.73)/2.125)
= 363.60 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.837 x (363.60+ 370.68)/2
= 307.48 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.837 x (363.60 + 2 x 370.68) / (3 x (363.60 + 370.68))
= 0.420 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 307.48 x 0.420 x 1.975
= 251.96 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.469 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.457 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.469 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.469 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.469 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.469 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.469)
= 0.721 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.469 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.469)
= 0.862 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.583 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1379.84 / 4.197) x (4.197 - (0.769 x 0.919))
= 1147.49 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1147.49 / 1.583
= 724.73 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.125 x 0.469 x 0.469
= 1295.24 kN-m > 272.79 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.975 x 0.457 x 0.457
= 1153.13 kN-m > 251.96 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.125 x 0.469
= 0.997 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001670 m²
= 1670 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.16755 %

Provide #12 - 16 nos.(1810 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.125 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(16 - 1)
= 0.134 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.975 x 0.457
= 0.903 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001586 m²
= 1586 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.17567 %

Provide #12 - 15 nos.(1696 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.975 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(15 - 1)
= 0.133 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.975 - 0.300)/2 - 0.469
= 0.369 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.73 + (1.975 - 0.369) x ((370.68 - 352.73)/1.975)
= 367.33 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.369 x 2.125) x 369.00
= 284.25 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.469 x 2.125
= 0.997 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001810 x 100)/0.997
= 0.18157
Permissible shear stress = 312.47 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 284.25 / 0.997
= 284.61 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(312.47 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.125 - 0.450)/2 - 0.457
= 0.381 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.73 + (2.125 - 0.381) x ((370.68 - 352.73)/2.125)
= 367.46 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.381 x 1.975) x 369.07
= 273.38 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.457 x 1.975
= 0.903 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001696 x 100)/0.903
= 0.18796
Permissible shear stress = 316.62 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 273.38 / 0.903
= 300.91 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(316.62 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(4.197 m²)
= 4.197 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(4.197/0.135) = 5.576 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1379.84/0.135
= 10221.06 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 55.08 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1434.93 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.67 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 104.67 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 55.08 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1434.93 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 6.99 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 97.28 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.975 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 787.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.125 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 787.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(469.000 / 457.000) + 300.000
= 757.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(469.000 / 457.000)
= 457 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.975 x 2.125 x 0.525 m
Provide #12 - 16 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 15 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG15
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2208.46 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1472.31 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 147.23 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1619.54 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2429.31 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 24.71 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 2.40 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 37.06 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 3.59 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1619.54 / 250.00 = 6.478 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0168 m
= 0.017 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0016 m
= 0.002 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.621 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.471 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1619.54/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0168/2.621 )
= 6.727 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1619.54/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0016/2.471 )
= 6.504 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.525 x 2.675 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.754 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 239.78 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 8.2051 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.8431 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.82 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 230.73 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.85 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.28346.14248.85230.76

Bending Moment Calculations :
