              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 359.66 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 12.3077 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.2647 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.24 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 346.09 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.525 - 0.300)/2
= 1.113 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 346.14 + (2.525 - 1.113) x ((373.28 - 346.14)/2.525)
= 361.32 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.113 x (361.32+ 373.28)/2
= 408.62 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.113 x (361.32 + 2 x 373.28)
               / (3 x (361.32 + 373.28))
= 0.559 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 408.62 x 0.559 x 2.675
= 609.76 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.675 - 0.450)/2
= 1.112 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 346.14 + (2.675 - 1.112) x ((373.28 - 346.14)/2.675)
= 361.99 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.112 x (361.99+ 373.28)/2
= 408.99 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.112 x (361.99 + 2 x 373.28) / (3 x (361.99 + 373.28))
= 0.559 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 408.99 x 0.559 x 2.525
= 563.42 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.969)
= 2.750 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.209 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2208.46 / 6.754) x (6.754 - (1.269 x 1.419))
= 1619.69 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1619.69 / 5.209
= 310.92 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.675 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 6944.83 kN-m > 609.76 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.525 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 6420.93 kN-m > 563.42 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.675 x 0.969
= 2.592 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001769 m²
= 1769 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06824 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.592/100
= 0.003110 m²
= 3110 mm²

Provide #12 - 28 nos.(3167 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.675 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(28 - 1)
= 0.095 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.525 x 0.957
= 2.416 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001655 m²
= 1655 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06849 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.416/100
= 0.002900 m²
= 2900 mm²

Provide #12 - 26 nos.(2941 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.525 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(26 - 1)
= 0.097 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.525 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.144 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 346.14 + (2.525 - 0.144) x ((373.28 - 346.14)/2.525)
= 371.74 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.144 x 2.675) x 372.51
= 137.55 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 2.675
= 2.592 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003167 x 100)/2.592
= 0.12217
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 137.55 / 2.592
= 53.01 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.675 - 0.450)/2 - 0.957
= 0.156 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 346.14 + (2.675 - 0.156) x ((373.28 - 346.14)/2.675)
= 371.70 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.156 x 2.525) x 372.49
= 142.96 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 2.525
= 2.416 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002941 x 100)/2.416
= 0.12169
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 142.96 / 2.416
= 58.98 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.020 m² > footing area(6.754 m²)
= 6.754 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.754/0.135) = 7.073 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2208.46/0.135
= 16358.97 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 173.08 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2381.54 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.39 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 220.24 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 173.08 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2381.54 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 29.20 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 207.89 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.525 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1062.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.675 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1062.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.525 x 2.675 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 28 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 26 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG16
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1819.48 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1212.99 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 121.30 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1334.29 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2001.43 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 24.76 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.33 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 37.14 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 1.99 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1334.29 / 250.00 = 5.337 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0204 m
= 0.020 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0011 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.386 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.236 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1334.29/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0204/2.386 )
= 5.611 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1334.29/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0011/2.236 )
= 5.353 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.300 x 2.450 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.635 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 236.79 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 10.7621 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.6156 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.16 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 225.41 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.19 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL372.29338.15248.19225.44

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 355.18 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 16.1431 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.9235 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 372.25 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 338.11 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.300 - 0.300)/2
= 1.000 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 338.15 + (2.300 - 1.000) x ((372.29 - 338.15)/2.300)
= 357.45 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.000 x (357.45+ 372.29)/2
= 364.87 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.000 x (357.45 + 2 x 372.29)
               / (3 x (357.45 + 372.29))
= 0.503 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 364.87 x 0.503 x 2.450
= 449.14 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.450 - 0.450)/2
= 1.000 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 338.15 + (2.450 - 1.000) x ((372.29 - 338.15)/2.450)
= 358.36 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.000 x (358.36+ 372.29)/2
= 365.32 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.000 x (358.36 + 2 x 372.29) / (3 x (358.36 + 372.29))
= 0.503 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 365.32 x 0.503 x 2.300
= 409.23 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1819.48 / 5.635) x (5.635 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1398.72 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1398.72 / 3.519
= 397.48 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.450 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4008.13 kN-m > 449.14 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.300 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3665.64 kN-m > 409.23 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.450 x 0.769
= 1.884 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001648 m²
= 1648 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08749 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.884/100
= 0.002261 m²
= 2261 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.450 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.117 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.300 x 0.757
= 1.741 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001526 m²
= 1526 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08763 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.741/100
= 0.002089 m²
= 2089 mm²

Provide #12 - 19 nos.(2149 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.300 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(19 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.300 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.231 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 338.15 + (2.300 - 0.231) x ((372.29 - 338.15)/2.300)
= 368.86 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.231 x 2.450) x 370.57
= 200.61 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.450
= 1.884 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.884
= 0.12606
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 200.61 / 1.884
= 106.34 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.450 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.243 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 338.15 + (2.450 - 0.243) x ((372.29 - 338.15)/2.450)
= 368.90 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.243 x 2.300) x 370.59
= 204.10 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.300
= 1.741 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002149 x 100)/1.741
= 0.12342
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 204.10 / 1.741
= 116.76 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(5.635 m²)
= 5.635 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.635/0.135) = 6.461 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1819.48/0.135
= 13477.67 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 116.22 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1935.71 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.93 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 173.27 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 116.22 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1935.71 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 29.37 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 162.66 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.300 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 950.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.450 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 950.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.300 x 2.450 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 19 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG17
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1620.97 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1080.64 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 108.06 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1188.71 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1783.06 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.37 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 11.88 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 2.06 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 17.82 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1188.71 / 250.00 = 4.755 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0013 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0110 m
= 0.011 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.257 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.107 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1188.71/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0013/2.257 )
= 4.771 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1188.71/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0110/2.107 )
= 4.904 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.150 x 2.300 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 4.945 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 240.39 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.7244 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.7032 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.81 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 232.96 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.83 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.75349.47247.83232.98

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 360.58 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.0866 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 10.0548 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.72 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 349.44 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.150 - 0.300)/2
= 0.925 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.47 + (2.150 - 0.925) x ((371.75 - 349.47)/2.150)
= 362.16 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.925 x (362.16+ 371.75)/2
= 339.44 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.925 x (362.16 + 2 x 371.75)
               / (3 x (362.16 + 371.75))
= 0.465 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 339.44 x 0.465 x 2.300
= 355.56 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.300 - 0.450)/2
= 0.925 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 349.47 + (2.300 - 0.925) x ((371.75 - 349.47)/2.300)
= 362.79 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.925 x (362.79+ 371.75)/2
= 339.72 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.925 x (362.79 + 2 x 371.75) / (3 x (362.79 + 371.75))
= 0.464 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 339.72 x 0.464 x 2.150
= 338.43 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.620 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.609 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.620 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.620 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.620 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.620)
= 1.141 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.620)
= 1.327 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.468 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1620.97 / 4.945) x (4.945 - (0.920 x 1.070))
= 1298.28 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1298.28 / 2.468
= 526.13 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.300 x 0.620 x 0.620
= 2439.53 kN-m > 355.56 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.150 x 0.609 x 0.609
= 2207.46 kN-m > 338.43 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.300 x 0.620
= 1.426 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001628 m²
= 1628 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11415 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.426/100
= 0.001711 m²
= 1711 mm²

Provide #10 - 22 nos.(1728 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.300 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.104 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.150 x 0.609
= 1.309 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001579 m²
= 1579 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.12063 %

Provide #12 - 15 nos.(1696 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.150 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(15 - 1)
= 0.146 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.150 - 0.300)/2 - 0.620
= 0.305 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.47 + (2.150 - 0.305) x ((371.75 - 349.47)/2.150)
= 368.59 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.305 x 2.300) x 370.17
= 259.00 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.620 x 2.300
= 1.426 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001728 x 100)/1.426
= 0.12117
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 259.00 / 1.426
= 181.63 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.300 - 0.450)/2 - 0.609
= 0.316 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.47 + (2.300 - 0.316) x ((371.75 - 349.47)/2.300)
= 368.69 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.316 x 2.150) x 370.22
= 244.84 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.609 x 2.150
= 1.309 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001696 x 100)/1.309
= 0.12957
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 244.84 / 1.309
= 186.68 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(4.945 m²)
= 4.945 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(4.945/0.135) = 6.052 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1620.97/0.135
= 12007.15 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 83.45 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1704.41 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 13.45 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 139.38 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 83.45 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1704.41 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.90 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 130.29 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.150 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 875.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.300 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 875.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(620.000 / 609.000) + 300.000
= 909.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(620.000 / 609.000)
= 609 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.150 x 2.300 x 0.675 m
Provide #10 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 15 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG18
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2203.72 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1469.15 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 146.91 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1616.06 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2424.09 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 6.91 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 7.08 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 10.37 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 10.62 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1616.06 / 250.00 = 6.464 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0047 m
= 0.005 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0048 m
= 0.005 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.619 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.469 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1616.06/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0047/2.619 )
= 6.534 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1616.06/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0048/2.469 )
= 6.540 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.500 x 2.650 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.625 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 243.93 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.3618 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 2.5651 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.86 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 239.01 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.89 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.33358.55248.89239.03

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 365.90 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.5427 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 3.8476 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.29 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 358.51 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.500 - 0.300)/2
= 1.100 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 358.55 + (2.500 - 1.100) x ((373.33 - 358.55)/2.500)
= 366.82 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.100 x (366.82+ 373.33)/2
= 407.08 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.100 x (366.82 + 2 x 373.33)
               / (3 x (366.82 + 373.33))
= 0.552 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 407.08 x 0.552 x 2.650
= 590.64 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.650 - 0.450)/2
= 1.100 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 358.55 + (2.650 - 1.100) x ((373.33 - 358.55)/2.650)
= 367.19 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.100 x (367.19+ 373.33)/2
= 407.29 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.100 x (367.19 + 2 x 373.33) / (3 x (367.19 + 373.33))
= 0.552 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 407.29 x 0.552 x 2.500
= 557.63 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2203.72 / 6.625) x (6.625 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1770.26 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1770.26 / 3.519
= 503.06 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.650 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4335.32 kN-m > 590.64 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.500 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3984.39 kN-m > 557.63 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.650 x 0.769
= 2.038 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002177 m²
= 2177 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10681 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.038/100
= 0.002445 m²
= 2445 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.650 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.500 x 0.757
= 1.892 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002089 m²
= 2089 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11039 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.892/100
= 0.002271 m²
= 2271 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.500 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.500 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.331 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 358.55 + (2.500 - 0.331) x ((373.33 - 358.55)/2.500)
= 371.37 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.331 x 2.650) x 372.35
= 322.90 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.650
= 2.038 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/2.038
= 0.12210
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 322.90 / 2.038
= 158.25 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.650 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.343 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 358.55 + (2.650 - 0.343) x ((373.33 - 358.55)/2.650)
= 371.41 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.343 x 2.500) x 372.37
= 313.64 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.500
= 1.892 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.892
= 0.12550
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 313.64 / 1.892
= 165.07 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.625 m²)
= 6.625 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.625/0.135) = 7.005 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2203.72/0.135
= 16323.83 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 136.64 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2340.36 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 8.55 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 187.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 136.64 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2340.36 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 8.02 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 176.81 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.500 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1050.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.650 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1050.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.500 x 2.650 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG19
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2853.12 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1902.08 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 190.21 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2092.29 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3138.44 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 4.89 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 13.79 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 7.34 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 20.69 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2092.29 / 250.00 = 8.369 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0026 m
= 0.003 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0073 m
= 0.007 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.969 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.819 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2092.29/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0026/2.969 )
= 8.413 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2092.29/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0073/2.819 )
= 8.498 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.850 x 3.000 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.550 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 244.71 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.1449 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 3.3957 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.25 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 240.17 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.27 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.90360.28249.27240.19

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 367.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.7173 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 5.0936 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.88 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 360.26 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.850 - 0.300)/2
= 1.275 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.28 + (2.850 - 1.275) x ((373.90 - 360.28)/2.850)
= 367.81 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.275 x (367.81+ 373.90)/2
= 472.84 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.275 x (367.81 + 2 x 373.90)
               / (3 x (367.81 + 373.90))
= 0.639 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 472.84 x 0.639 x 3.000
= 898.01 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.000 - 0.450)/2
= 1.275 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 360.28 + (3.000 - 1.275) x ((373.90 - 360.28)/3.000)
= 368.11 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.275 x (368.11+ 373.90)/2
= 473.04 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.275 x (368.11 + 2 x 373.90) / (3 x (368.11 + 373.90))
= 0.639 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 473.04 x 0.639 x 2.850
= 858.78 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2853.12 / 8.550) x (8.550 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2007.13 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2007.13 / 7.772
= 258.24 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.000 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12320.69 kN-m > 898.01 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.850 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11513.57 kN-m > 858.78 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.000 x 1.219
= 3.657 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002066 m²
= 2066 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05648 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.657/100
= 0.004388 m²
= 4388 mm²

Provide #12 - 39 nos.(4411 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.000 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(39 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.850 x 1.207
= 3.440 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001996 m²
= 1996 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05801 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.440/100
= 0.004128 m²
= 4128 mm²

Provide #12 - 37 nos.(4185 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.850 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(37 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.850 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.056 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.28 + (2.850 - 0.056) x ((373.90 - 360.28)/2.850)
= 373.64 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.056 x 3.000) x 373.77
= 61.39 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.000
= 3.657 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004411 x 100)/3.657
= 0.12061
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 61.39 / 3.657
= 16.77 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.000 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.068 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.28 + (3.000 - 0.068) x ((373.90 - 360.28)/3.000)
= 373.59 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.068 x 2.850) x 373.75
= 68.31 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.850
= 3.440 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004185 x 100)/3.440
= 0.12165
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 68.31 / 3.440
= 19.81 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.550 m²)
= 8.550 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.550/0.135) = 7.958 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2853.12/0.135
= 21134.25 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2853.12 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 2846795.000 m²
= 2846794973184.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 272.53 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3125.66 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 15.86 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 281.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 272.53 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3125.66 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 5.55 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 267.35 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.850 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1225.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.000 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1225.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.850 x 3.000 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 39 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 37 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG20
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2044.35 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1362.90 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 136.29 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1499.19 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2248.79 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.32 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 16.89 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.48 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 25.34 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1499.19 / 250.00 = 5.997 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0002 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0124 m
= 0.012 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.525 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.375 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1499.19/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0002/2.525 )
= 6.000 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1499.19/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0124/2.375 )
= 6.185 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.425 x 2.575 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.244 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 240.09 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.1187 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.6927 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.90 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 233.28 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.90 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.35349.92246.90233.28

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 360.13 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.1780 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 10.0391 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.35 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 349.91 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.425 - 0.300)/2
= 1.063 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.92 + (2.425 - 1.063) x ((370.35 - 349.92)/2.425)
= 361.40 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.063 x (361.40+ 370.35)/2
= 388.74 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.063 x (361.40 + 2 x 370.35)
               / (3 x (361.40 + 370.35))
= 0.533 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 388.74 x 0.533 x 2.575
= 523.62 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.575 - 0.450)/2
= 1.063 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 349.92 + (2.575 - 1.063) x ((370.35 - 349.92)/2.575)
= 361.92 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.063 x (361.92+ 370.35)/2
= 389.02 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.063 x (361.92 + 2 x 370.35) / (3 x (361.92 + 370.35))
= 0.533 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 389.02 x 0.533 x 2.425
= 502.91 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2044.35 / 6.244) x (6.244 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1617.73 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1617.73 / 3.519
= 459.72 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.575 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4212.63 kN-m > 523.62 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.425 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3864.85 kN-m > 502.91 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.575 x 0.769
= 1.980 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001926 m²
= 1926 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09725 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.980/100
= 0.002376 m²
= 2376 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.575 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.117 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.425 x 0.757
= 1.836 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001881 m²
= 1881 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10246 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.836/100
= 0.002203 m²
= 2203 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.425 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.425 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.293 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.92 + (2.425 - 0.293) x ((370.35 - 349.92)/2.425)
= 367.88 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.293 x 2.575) x 369.12
= 277.89 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.575
= 1.980 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/1.980
= 0.12565
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 277.89 / 1.980
= 140.16 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.575 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.306 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.92 + (2.575 - 0.306) x ((370.35 - 349.92)/2.575)
= 367.93 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.306 x 2.425) x 369.14
= 264.29 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.425
= 1.836 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.836
= 0.12322
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 264.29 / 1.836
= 143.40 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.244 m²)
= 6.244 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.244/0.135) = 6.801 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2044.35/0.135
= 15143.36 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 128.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2173.14 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 19.74 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 182.11 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 128.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2173.14 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.41 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 171.50 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.425 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1012.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.575 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1012.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.425 x 2.575 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG21
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1390.20 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 926.80 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 92.68 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1019.48 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1529.22 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.75 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 5.50 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 4.12 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 8.26 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1019.48 / 250.00 = 4.078 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0030 m
= 0.003 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0059 m
= 0.006 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.096 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 1.946 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1019.48/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0030/2.096 )
= 4.113 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1019.48/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0059/1.946 )
= 4.153 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.975 x 2.125 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 4.197 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 242.91 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.8485 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 3.9844 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.75 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 237.08 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.78 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.17355.67248.78237.11

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 364.37 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.7728 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 5.9766 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.12 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 355.62 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.975 - 0.300)/2
= 0.837 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 355.67 + (1.975 - 0.837) x ((373.17 - 355.67)/1.975)
= 365.74 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.837 x (365.74+ 373.17)/2
= 309.42 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.837 x (365.74 + 2 x 373.17)
               / (3 x (365.74 + 373.17))
= 0.420 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 309.42 x 0.420 x 2.125
= 273.03 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.125 - 0.450)/2
= 0.837 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 355.67 + (2.125 - 0.837) x ((373.17 - 355.67)/2.125)
= 366.27 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.837 x (366.27+ 373.17)/2
= 309.64 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.837 x (366.27 + 2 x 373.17) / (3 x (366.27 + 373.17))
= 0.420 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 309.64 x 0.420 x 1.975
= 255.43 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.469 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.457 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.469 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.469 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.469 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.469 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.469)
= 0.721 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.469 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.469)
= 0.862 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.583 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1390.20 / 4.197) x (4.197 - (0.769 x 0.919))
= 1156.10 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1156.10 / 1.583
= 730.16 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.125 x 0.469 x 0.469
= 1295.24 kN-m > 273.03 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.975 x 0.457 x 0.457
= 1153.13 kN-m > 255.43 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.125 x 0.469
= 0.997 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001671 m²
= 1671 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.16770 %

Provide #12 - 16 nos.(1810 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.125 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(16 - 1)
= 0.134 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.975 x 0.457
= 0.903 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001608 m²
= 1608 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.17819 %

Provide #12 - 15 nos.(1696 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.975 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(15 - 1)
= 0.133 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.975 - 0.300)/2 - 0.469
= 0.369 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 355.67 + (1.975 - 0.369) x ((373.17 - 355.67)/1.975)
= 369.90 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.369 x 2.125) x 371.53
= 288.35 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.469 x 2.125
= 0.997 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001810 x 100)/0.997
= 0.18157
Permissible shear stress = 312.47 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 288.35 / 0.997
= 288.71 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(312.47 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.125 - 0.450)/2 - 0.457
= 0.381 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 355.67 + (2.125 - 0.381) x ((373.17 - 355.67)/2.125)
= 370.03 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.381 x 1.975) x 371.60
= 273.36 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.457 x 1.975
= 0.903 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001696 x 100)/0.903
= 0.18796
Permissible shear stress = 316.62 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 273.36 / 0.903
= 300.89 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(316.62 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(4.197 m²)
= 4.197 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(4.197/0.135) = 5.576 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1390.20/0.135
= 10297.75 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 55.08 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1445.28 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 6.17 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 104.67 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 55.08 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1445.28 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.49 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 97.28 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.975 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 787.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.125 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 787.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(469.000 / 457.000) + 300.000
= 757.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(469.000 / 457.000)
= 457 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.975 x 2.125 x 0.525 m
Provide #12 - 16 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 15 nos along the width of footing.
