(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG22
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2759.80 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1839.87 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 183.99 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2023.85 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3035.78 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 8.46 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.09 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 12.70 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 1.64 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2023.85 / 250.00 = 8.095 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0046 m
= 0.005 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0006 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.921 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.771 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2023.85/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0046/2.921 )
= 8.172 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2023.85/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0006/2.771 )
= 8.106 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.800 x 2.950 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.260 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 245.02 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.0842 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.2832 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.39 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 242.65 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.39 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.08363.98247.39242.65

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 367.53 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.1263 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.4247 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.08 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 363.98 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.800 - 0.300)/2
= 1.250 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.98 + (2.800 - 1.250) x ((371.08 - 363.98)/2.800)
= 367.91 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.250 x (367.91+ 371.08)/2
= 461.87 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.250 x (367.91 + 2 x 371.08)
               / (3 x (367.91 + 371.08))
= 0.626 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 461.87 x 0.626 x 2.950
= 852.10 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.950 - 0.450)/2
= 1.250 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 363.98 + (2.950 - 1.250) x ((371.08 - 363.98)/2.950)
= 368.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.250 x (368.07+ 371.08)/2
= 461.97 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.250 x (368.07 + 2 x 371.08) / (3 x (368.07 + 371.08))
= 0.626 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 461.97 x 0.626 x 2.800
= 804.63 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.969)
= 2.750 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.209 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2759.80 / 8.260) x (8.260 - (1.269 x 1.419))
= 2158.15 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2158.15 / 5.209
= 414.29 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.950 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 7658.78 kN-m > 852.10 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.800 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 7120.24 kN-m > 804.63 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.950 x 0.969
= 2.859 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002481 m²
= 2481 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08681 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.859/100
= 0.003430 m²
= 3430 mm²

Provide #12 - 31 nos.(3506 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.950 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(31 - 1)
= 0.095 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.800 x 0.957
= 2.680 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002374 m²
= 2374 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08858 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.680/100
= 0.003216 m²
= 3216 mm²

Provide #12 - 29 nos.(3280 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.800 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(29 - 1)
= 0.096 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.800 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.98 + (2.800 - 0.281) x ((371.08 - 363.98)/2.800)
= 370.37 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.950) x 370.73
= 303.89 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 2.950
= 2.859 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003506 x 100)/2.859
= 0.12265
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 303.89 / 2.859
= 106.20 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.950 - 0.450)/2 - 0.957
= 0.293 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.98 + (2.950 - 0.293) x ((371.08 - 363.98)/2.950)
= 370.38 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.293 x 2.800) x 370.73
= 300.72 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 2.800
= 2.680 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003280 x 100)/2.680
= 0.12240
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 300.72 / 2.680
= 111.88 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.020 m² > footing area(8.260 m²)
= 8.260 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.260/0.135) = 7.822 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2759.80/0.135
= 20442.96 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.128 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2759.80 - 2306.30)/361050.00
= 2753412.500 m²
= 2753412464640.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 211.66 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2971.46 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.05 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 242.88 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 211.66 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2971.46 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 10.00 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 230.53 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.800 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1200.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.950 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1200.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.800 x 2.950 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 31 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 29 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG23
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2859.01 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1906.01 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 190.60 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2096.61 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3144.91 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.27 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.59 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.40 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 2.38 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2096.61 / 250.00 = 8.386 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0001 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0008 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.972 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.822 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2096.61/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0001/2.972 )
= 8.389 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2096.61/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0008/2.822 )
= 8.401 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.825 x 2.975 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.404 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 249.47 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.0642 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.4010 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.93 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 249.00 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.93 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.90373.50249.93249.00

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 374.20 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.0963 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.6015 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 374.90 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 373.50 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.825 - 0.300)/2
= 1.263 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 373.50 + (2.825 - 1.263) x ((374.90 - 373.50)/2.825)
= 374.27 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.263 x (374.27+ 374.90)/2
= 472.91 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.263 x (374.27 + 2 x 374.90)
               / (3 x (374.27 + 374.90))
= 0.631 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 472.91 x 0.631 x 2.975
= 887.36 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.975 - 0.450)/2
= 1.262 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 373.50 + (2.975 - 1.262) x ((374.90 - 373.50)/2.975)
= 374.31 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.262 x (374.31+ 374.90)/2
= 472.93 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.262 x (374.31 + 2 x 374.90) / (3 x (374.31 + 374.90))
= 0.631 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 472.93 x 0.631 x 2.825
= 843.44 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2859.01 / 8.404) x (8.404 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 1996.58 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1996.58 / 7.772
= 256.88 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.975 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12218.02 kN-m > 887.36 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.825 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11412.57 kN-m > 843.44 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.975 x 1.219
= 3.627 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002041 m²
= 2041 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05628 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.627/100
= 0.004352 m²
= 4352 mm²

Provide #12 - 39 nos.(4411 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.975 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(39 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.825 x 1.207
= 3.410 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001960 m²
= 1960 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05748 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.410/100
= 0.004092 m²
= 4092 mm²

Provide #12 - 37 nos.(4185 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.825 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(37 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.825 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.044 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 373.50 + (2.825 - 0.044) x ((374.90 - 373.50)/2.825)
= 374.88 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.044 x 2.975) x 374.89
= 47.39 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 2.975
= 3.627 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004411 x 100)/3.627
= 0.12163
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 47.39 / 3.627
= 13.06 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.975 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.055 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 373.50 + (2.975 - 0.055) x ((374.90 - 373.50)/2.975)
= 374.87 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.055 x 2.825) x 374.88
= 55.51 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.825
= 3.410 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004185 x 100)/3.410
= 0.12272
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 55.51 / 3.410
= 16.24 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.404 m²)
= 8.404 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.404/0.135) = 7.890 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2859.01/0.135
= 21177.87 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2859.01 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 2852682.500 m²
= 2852682465280.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 267.89 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3126.90 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.65 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 279.08 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 267.89 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3126.90 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.32 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 265.01 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.825 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1212.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.975 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1212.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.825 x 2.975 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 39 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 37 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG24
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3348.72 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2232.48 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 223.25 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2455.73 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3683.60 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 16.92 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.40 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 25.38 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 2.11 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2455.73 / 250.00 = 9.823 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0076 m
= 0.008 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0006 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.210 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.060 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2455.73/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0076/3.210 )
= 9.962 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2455.73/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0006/3.060 )
= 9.835 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.100 x 3.250 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 10.075 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 243.75 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.1002 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.2697 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.11 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 240.38 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.12 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.68360.57247.12240.38

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 365.62 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 4.6502 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.4046 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.67 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 360.56 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.100 - 0.300)/2
= 1.400 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.57 + (3.100 - 1.400) x ((370.68 - 360.57)/3.100)
= 366.11 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.400 x (366.11+ 370.68)/2
= 515.75 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.400 x (366.11 + 2 x 370.68)
               / (3 x (366.11 + 370.68))
= 0.701 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 515.75 x 0.701 x 3.250
= 1174.84 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.250 - 0.450)/2
= 1.400 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 360.57 + (3.250 - 1.400) x ((370.68 - 360.57)/3.250)
= 366.32 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.400 x (366.32+ 370.68)/2
= 515.90 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.400 x (366.32 + 2 x 370.68) / (3 x (366.32 + 370.68))
= 0.701 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 515.90 x 0.701 x 3.100
= 1111.62 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3348.72 / 10.075) x (10.075 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2506.07 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2506.07 / 7.772
= 322.43 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.250 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 13347.42 kN-m > 1174.84 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.100 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 12523.53 kN-m > 1111.62 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.250 x 1.219
= 3.962 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002709 m²
= 2709 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06838 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.962/100
= 0.004754 m²
= 4754 mm²

Provide #12 - 43 nos.(4863 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.250 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(43 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.100 x 1.207
= 3.742 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002589 m²
= 2589 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06920 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.742/100
= 0.004490 m²
= 4490 mm²

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.100 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.077 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.100 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.181 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.57 + (3.100 - 0.181) x ((370.68 - 360.57)/3.100)
= 370.09 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.181 x 3.250) x 370.38
= 214.11 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.250
= 3.962 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004863 x 100)/3.962
= 0.12275
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 214.11 / 3.962
= 54.00 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.250 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.193 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.57 + (3.250 - 0.193) x ((370.68 - 360.57)/3.250)
= 370.08 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.193 x 3.100) x 370.38
= 217.93 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 3.100
= 3.742 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.742
= 0.12090
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 217.93 / 3.742
= 58.10 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(10.075 m²)
= 10.075 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(10.075/0.135) = 8.639 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3348.72/0.135
= 24805.37 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.125 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3348.72 - 2256.28)/361050.00
= 3342475.000 m²
= 3342474936320.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 321.14 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3669.86 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.45 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 304.88 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 321.14 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3669.86 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 19.55 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 290.81 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.100 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1350.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.250 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1350.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.100 x 3.250 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 43 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG25
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2366.40 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1577.60 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 157.76 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1735.36 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2603.04 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 10.99 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 3.38 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 16.48 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 5.07 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1735.36 / 250.00 = 6.941 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0070 m
= 0.007 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0021 m
= 0.002 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.711 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.561 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1735.36/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0070/2.711 )
= 7.048 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1735.36/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0021/2.561 )
= 6.976 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.600 x 2.750 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 7.150 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 242.71 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.3533 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.0913 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.15 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 238.26 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.17 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.75357.42247.17238.28

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 364.06 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 5.0300 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.6369 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.73 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 357.39 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.600 - 0.300)/2
= 1.150 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 357.42 + (2.600 - 1.150) x ((370.75 - 357.42)/2.600)
= 364.85 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.150 x (364.85+ 370.75)/2
= 422.97 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.150 x (364.85 + 2 x 370.75)
               / (3 x (364.85 + 370.75))
= 0.577 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 422.97 x 0.577 x 2.750
= 668.47 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.750 - 0.450)/2
= 1.150 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 357.42 + (2.750 - 1.150) x ((370.75 - 357.42)/2.750)
= 365.17 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.150 x (365.17+ 370.75)/2
= 423.16 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.150 x (365.17 + 2 x 370.75) / (3 x (365.17 + 370.75))
= 0.576 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 423.16 x 0.576 x 2.600
= 627.94 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.969)
= 2.750 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.209 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2366.40 / 7.150) x (7.150 - (1.269 x 1.419))
= 1770.43 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1770.43 / 5.209
= 339.86 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.750 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 7139.54 kN-m > 668.47 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.600 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 6611.65 kN-m > 627.94 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.750 x 0.969
= 2.665 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001941 m²
= 1941 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07284 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.665/100
= 0.003198 m²
= 3198 mm²

Provide #12 - 29 nos.(3280 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.750 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(29 - 1)
= 0.094 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.600 x 0.957
= 2.488 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001847 m²
= 1847 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07422 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.488/100
= 0.002986 m²
= 2986 mm²

Provide #12 - 27 nos.(3054 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.600 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(27 - 1)
= 0.096 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.600 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.181 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 357.42 + (2.600 - 0.181) x ((370.75 - 357.42)/2.600)
= 369.82 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.181 x 2.750) x 370.29
= 180.96 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 2.750
= 2.665 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003280 x 100)/2.665
= 0.12308
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 180.96 / 2.665
= 67.84 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.750 - 0.450)/2 - 0.957
= 0.193 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 357.42 + (2.750 - 0.193) x ((370.75 - 357.42)/2.750)
= 369.81 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.193 x 2.600) x 370.28
= 182.16 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 2.600
= 2.488 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003054 x 100)/2.488
= 0.12272
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 182.16 / 2.488
= 72.98 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.020 m² > footing area(7.150 m²)
= 7.150 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(7.150/0.135) = 7.278 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2366.40/0.135
= 17528.87 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 183.22 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2549.62 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 4.09 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 226.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 183.22 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2549.62 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 12.39 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 214.07 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.600 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1100.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.750 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1100.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.600 x 2.750 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 29 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 27 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG26
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1904.43 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1269.62 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 126.96 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1396.58 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2094.87 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 14.01 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.44 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 21.01 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.65 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1396.58 / 250.00 = 5.586 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0110 m
= 0.011 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0003 m
= 0.000 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.440 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.290 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1396.58/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0110/2.440 )
= 5.738 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1396.58/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0003/2.290 )
= 5.591 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.325 x 2.475 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.754 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 242.70 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 5.9003 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.1955 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.80 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 236.60 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.80 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.20354.91248.80236.61

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 364.05 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 8.8505 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.2933 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.19 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 354.91 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.325 - 0.300)/2
= 1.013 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 354.91 + (2.325 - 1.013) x ((373.20 - 354.91)/2.325)
= 365.24 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.013 x (365.24+ 373.20)/2
= 373.83 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.013 x (365.24 + 2 x 373.20)
               / (3 x (365.24 + 373.20))
= 0.508 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 373.83 x 0.508 x 2.475
= 469.81 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.475 - 0.450)/2
= 1.012 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 354.91 + (2.475 - 1.012) x ((373.20 - 354.91)/2.475)
= 365.72 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.012 x (365.72+ 373.20)/2
= 374.08 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.012 x (365.72 + 2 x 373.20) / (3 x (365.72 + 373.20))
= 0.508 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 374.08 x 0.508 x 2.325
= 434.11 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.619 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.607 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.619 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.619 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.619 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.619)
= 1.138 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.619)
= 1.323 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.461 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1904.43 / 5.754) x (5.754 - (0.919 x 1.069))
= 1579.30 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1579.30 / 2.461
= 641.69 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.475 x 0.619 x 0.619
= 2625.14 kN-m > 469.81 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.325 x 0.607 x 0.607
= 2387.13 kN-m > 434.11 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.475 x 0.619
= 1.532 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002167 m²
= 2167 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.14143 %

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.475 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.124 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.325 x 0.607
= 1.411 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002043 m²
= 2043 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.14477 %

Provide #12 - 19 nos.(2149 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.325 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(19 - 1)
= 0.123 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.325 - 0.300)/2 - 0.619
= 0.394 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 354.91 + (2.325 - 0.394) x ((373.20 - 354.91)/2.325)
= 370.10 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.394 x 2.475) x 371.65
= 353.89 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.619 x 2.475
= 1.532 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.532
= 0.14764
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 353.89 / 1.532
= 230.62 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.475 - 0.450)/2 - 0.607
= 0.405 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 354.91 + (2.475 - 0.405) x ((373.20 - 354.91)/2.475)
= 370.20 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.405 x 2.325) x 371.70
= 347.62 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.607 x 2.325
= 1.411 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002149 x 100)/1.411
= 0.15226
Permissible shear stress = 288.79 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 347.62 / 1.411
= 245.10 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(288.79 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(5.754 m²)
= 5.754 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.754/0.135) = 6.529 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1904.43/0.135
= 14106.89 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 97.11 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2001.54 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.35 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 149.98 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 97.11 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2001.54 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 16.45 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 140.89 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.325 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 962.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.475 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 962.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(619.000 / 607.000) + 300.000
= 907.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(619.000 / 607.000)
= 607 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.325 x 2.475 x 0.675 m
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 19 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG27
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2582.77 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1721.85 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 172.18 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1894.03 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2841.05 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.50 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 7.19 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 2.24 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 10.79 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1894.03 / 250.00 = 7.576 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0009 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0042 m
= 0.004 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.828 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.678 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1894.03/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0009/2.828 )
= 7.590 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1894.03/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0042/2.678 )
= 7.647 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.700 x 2.850 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 7.695 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 246.14 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.4091 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 2.0767 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.62 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 243.65 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.63 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL372.94365.48248.63243.66

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 369.21 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.6136 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 3.1150 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 372.94 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 365.48 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.700 - 0.300)/2
= 1.200 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 365.48 + (2.700 - 1.200) x ((372.94 - 365.48)/2.700)
= 369.63 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.200 x (369.63+ 372.94)/2
= 445.54 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.200 x (369.63 + 2 x 372.94)
               / (3 x (369.63 + 372.94))
= 0.601 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 445.54 x 0.601 x 2.850
= 758.50 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.850 - 0.450)/2
= 1.200 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 365.48 + (2.850 - 1.200) x ((372.94 - 365.48)/2.850)
= 369.80 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.200 x (369.80+ 372.94)/2
= 445.65 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.200 x (369.80 + 2 x 372.94) / (3 x (369.80 + 372.94))
= 0.601 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 445.65 x 0.601 x 2.700
= 722.09 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.969)
= 2.750 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.209 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2582.77 / 7.695) x (7.695 - (1.269 x 1.419))
= 1978.38 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1978.38 / 5.209
= 379.77 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.850 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 7399.16 kN-m > 758.50 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.700 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 6865.95 kN-m > 722.09 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.850 x 0.969
= 2.762 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002206 m²
= 2206 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07987 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.762/100
= 0.003314 m²
= 3314 mm²

Provide #12 - 30 nos.(3393 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.850 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(30 - 1)
= 0.094 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.700 x 0.957
= 2.584 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002127 m²
= 2127 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08233 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.584/100
= 0.003101 m²
= 3101 mm²

Provide #12 - 28 nos.(3167 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.700 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(28 - 1)
= 0.096 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.700 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.231 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 365.48 + (2.700 - 0.231) x ((372.94 - 365.48)/2.700)
= 372.30 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.231 x 2.850) x 372.62
= 243.88 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 2.850
= 2.762 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003393 x 100)/2.762
= 0.12286
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 243.88 / 2.762
= 88.22 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.850 - 0.450)/2 - 0.957
= 0.243 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 365.48 + (2.850 - 0.243) x ((372.94 - 365.48)/2.850)
= 372.31 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.243 x 2.700) x 372.62
= 239.61 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 2.700
= 2.584 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003167 x 100)/2.584
= 0.12256
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 239.61 / 2.584
= 92.44 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.020 m² > footing area(7.695 m²)
= 7.695 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(7.695/0.135) = 7.550 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2582.77/0.135
= 19131.64 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.128 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2582.77 - 2306.30)/361050.00
= 2576384.250 m²
= 2576384262144.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 197.18 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2779.96 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 8.21 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 234.65 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 197.18 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2779.96 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.68 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 222.30 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.700 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1150.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.850 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1150.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.700 x 2.850 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 30 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 28 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG28
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1858.99 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1239.33 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 123.93 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1363.26 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2044.89 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.82 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 13.99 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 2.73 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 20.99 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1363.26 / 250.00 = 5.453 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0015 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0113 m
= 0.011 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.411 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.261 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1363.26/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0015/2.411 )
= 5.473 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1363.26/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0113/2.261 )
= 5.616 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.300 x 2.450 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.635 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 241.93 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.7916 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.4789 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.20 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 234.66 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.22 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.83352.02249.22234.68

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 362.89 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.1875 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 9.7183 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.80 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 351.98 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.300 - 0.300)/2
= 1.000 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.02 + (2.300 - 1.000) x ((373.83 - 352.02)/2.300)
= 364.34 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.000 x (364.34+ 373.83)/2
= 369.09 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.000 x (364.34 + 2 x 373.83)
               / (3 x (364.34 + 373.83))
= 0.502 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 369.09 x 0.502 x 2.450
= 445.57 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.450 - 0.450)/2
= 1.000 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 352.02 + (2.450 - 1.000) x ((373.83 - 352.02)/2.450)
= 364.93 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.000 x (364.93+ 373.83)/2
= 369.38 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.000 x (364.93 + 2 x 373.83) / (3 x (364.93 + 373.83))
= 0.502 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 369.38 x 0.502 x 2.300
= 425.46 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.619 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.607 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.619 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.619 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.619 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.619)
= 1.138 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.619)
= 1.323 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.461 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1858.99 / 5.635) x (5.635 - (0.919 x 1.069))
= 1534.89 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1534.89 / 2.461
= 623.65 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.450 x 0.619 x 0.619
= 2598.63 kN-m > 445.57 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.300 x 0.607 x 0.607
= 2361.47 kN-m > 425.46 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.450 x 0.619
= 1.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002052 m²
= 2052 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.13533 %

Provide #12 - 19 nos.(2149 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.450 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(19 - 1)
= 0.130 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.300 x 0.607
= 1.396 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002002 m²
= 2002 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.14339 %

Provide #12 - 19 nos.(2149 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.300 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(19 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.300 - 0.300)/2 - 0.619
= 0.381 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.02 + (2.300 - 0.381) x ((373.83 - 352.02)/2.300)
= 370.21 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.381 x 2.450) x 372.02
= 345.40 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.619 x 2.450
= 1.517 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002149 x 100)/1.517
= 0.14169
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 345.40 / 1.517
= 227.39 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.450 - 0.450)/2 - 0.607
= 0.393 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.02 + (2.450 - 0.393) x ((373.83 - 352.02)/2.450)
= 370.33 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.393 x 2.300) x 372.08
= 326.41 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.607 x 2.300
= 1.396 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002149 x 100)/1.396
= 0.15392
Permissible shear stress = 290.18 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 326.41 / 1.396
= 232.65 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(290.18 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(5.635 m²)
= 5.635 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.635/0.135) = 6.461 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1858.99/0.135
= 13770.29 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 95.09 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1954.08 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 16.37 kN
