Soil resistance,(S) = 148.47 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 95.09 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1954.08 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.07 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 139.38 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.300 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 950.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.450 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 950.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(619.000 / 607.000) + 300.000
= 907.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(619.000 / 607.000)
= 607 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.300 x 2.450 x 0.675 m
Provide #12 - 19 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 19 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG29
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1480.17 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 986.78 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 98.68 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1085.46 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1628.19 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.54 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 8.83 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.81 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 13.24 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1085.46 / 250.00 = 4.342 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0005 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0089 m
= 0.009 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.160 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.010 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1085.46/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0005/2.160 )
= 4.348 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1085.46/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0089/2.010 )
= 4.458 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.050 x 2.200 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 4.510 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 240.68 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.3255 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 5.7300 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.73 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 234.62 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.74 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.11351.95246.74234.63

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 361.02 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.4883 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 8.5949 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.10 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 351.93 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.050 - 0.300)/2
= 0.875 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 351.95 + (2.050 - 0.875) x ((370.11 - 351.95)/2.050)
= 362.36 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.875 x (362.36+ 370.11)/2
= 320.46 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.875 x (362.36 + 2 x 370.11)
               / (3 x (362.36 + 370.11))
= 0.439 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 320.46 x 0.439 x 2.200
= 304.34 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.200 - 0.450)/2
= 0.875 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 351.95 + (2.200 - 0.875) x ((370.11 - 351.95)/2.200)
= 362.89 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.875 x (362.89+ 370.11)/2
= 320.69 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.875 x (362.89 + 2 x 370.11) / (3 x (362.89 + 370.11))
= 0.439 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 320.69 x 0.439 x 2.050
= 288.27 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.620 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.610 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.620 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.620 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.620 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.620)
= 1.141 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.620)
= 1.327 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.468 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1480.17 / 4.510) x (4.510 - (0.920 x 1.070))
= 1157.09 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1157.09 / 2.468
= 468.92 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.200 x 0.620 x 0.620
= 2333.46 kN-m > 304.34 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.050 x 0.610 x 0.610
= 2104.79 kN-m > 288.27 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.200 x 0.620
= 1.364 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001390 m²
= 1390 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10188 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.364/100
= 0.001637 m²
= 1637 mm²

Provide #10 - 21 nos.(1649 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.200 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.105 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.050 x 0.610
= 1.250 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001339 m²
= 1339 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10710 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.250/100
= 0.001501 m²
= 1501 mm²

Provide #10 - 20 nos.(1571 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.050 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.102 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.050 - 0.300)/2 - 0.620
= 0.255 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 351.95 + (2.050 - 0.255) x ((370.11 - 351.95)/2.050)
= 367.85 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.255 x 2.200) x 368.98
= 206.75 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.620 x 2.200
= 1.364 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001649 x 100)/1.364
= 0.12092
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 206.75 / 1.364
= 151.58 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.200 - 0.450)/2 - 0.610
= 0.265 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 351.95 + (2.200 - 0.265) x ((370.11 - 351.95)/2.200)
= 367.92 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.265 x 2.050) x 369.02
= 196.36 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.610 x 2.050
= 1.250 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001571 x 100)/1.250
= 0.12561
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 196.36 / 1.250
= 157.02 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(4.510 m²)
= 4.510 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(4.510/0.135) = 5.780 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1480.17/0.135
= 10964.24 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 76.11 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1556.28 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 10.04 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 133.32 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 76.11 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1556.28 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.37 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 124.23 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.050 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 825.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.200 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 825.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Diameter of Column bar d2 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd2' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(620.000 / 610.000) + 300.000
= 910.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Diameter of Column bar 'd2' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd2' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(620.000 / 610.000)
= 610 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.050 x 2.200 x 0.675 m
Provide #10 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG30
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3512.54 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2341.70 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 234.17 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2575.86 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3863.80 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 5.99 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 4.52 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 8.99 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 6.79 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2575.86 / 250.00 = 10.303 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0026 m
= 0.003 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0019 m
= 0.002 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.286 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.136 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2575.86/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0026/3.286 )
= 10.352 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2575.86/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0019/3.136 )
= 10.342 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.150 x 3.300 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 10.395 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 247.80 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.0481 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.8289 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.68 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 245.92 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.68 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.52368.89249.68245.92

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 371.70 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.5721 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.2434 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 374.51 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 368.88 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.150 - 0.300)/2
= 1.425 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 368.89 + (3.150 - 1.425) x ((374.52 - 368.89)/3.150)
= 371.97 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.425 x (371.97+ 374.52)/2
= 531.87 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.425 x (371.97 + 2 x 374.52)
               / (3 x (371.97 + 374.52))
= 0.713 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 531.87 x 0.713 x 3.300
= 1249.06 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.300 - 0.450)/2
= 1.425 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 368.89 + (3.300 - 1.425) x ((374.52 - 368.89)/3.300)
= 372.09 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.425 x (372.09+ 374.52)/2
= 531.96 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.425 x (372.09 + 2 x 374.52) / (3 x (372.09 + 374.52))
= 0.713 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 531.96 x 0.713 x 3.150
= 1191.61 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.650 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.594 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.582 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.594 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.594 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.594 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.594 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.594)
= 6.038 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.594 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.594)
= 6.516 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 12.554 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3512.54 / 10.395) x (10.395 - (1.894 x 2.044))
= 2204.39 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2204.39 / 12.554
= 175.59 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.650 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.300 x 1.594 x 1.594
= 23164.85 kN-m > 1249.06 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.150 x 1.582 x 1.582
= 21835.51 kN-m > 1191.61 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.300 x 1.594
= 5.260 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002190 m²
= 2190 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.04164 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 5.260/100
= 0.006312 m²
= 6312 mm²

Provide #12 - 56 nos.(6333 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.300 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(56 - 1)
= 0.058 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.150 x 1.582
= 4.983 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002106 m²
= 2106 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.04226 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 4.983/100
= 0.005980 m²
= 5980 mm²

Provide #12 - 53 nos.(5994 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.150 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(53 - 1)
= 0.058 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.150 - 0.300)/2 - 1.594
= -0.169 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.300 - 0.450)/2 - 1.582
= -0.157 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.650)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.650))
= 48.645 m² > footing area(10.395 m²)
= 10.395 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(10.395/0.135) = 8.775 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3512.54/0.135
= 26018.83 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.125 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3512.54 - 2249.04)/361050.00
= 3506313.250 m²
= 3506313363456.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 428.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3941.34 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 5.06 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 345.49 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 428.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3941.34 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 7.10 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 329.78 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.150 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1375.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.300 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1375.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 40 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (40 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1880 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1594.000 / 1582.000) + 300.000
= 1882.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 40 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (40 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1504 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1594.000 / 1582.000)
= 1582 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.150 x 3.300 x 1.650 m
Provide #12 - 56 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 53 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG31
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2856.10 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1904.07 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 190.41 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2094.47 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3141.71 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.91 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 2.70 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 4.36 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 4.05 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2094.47 / 250.00 = 8.378 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0015 m
= 0.002 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0014 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.970 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.820 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2094.47/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0015/2.970 )
= 8.404 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2094.47/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0014/2.820 )
= 8.403 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.850 x 3.000 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.550 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 244.97 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.6798 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.6642 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.31 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 243.62 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.31 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.47365.44246.31243.63

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 367.45 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.0198 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.9963 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.47 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 365.44 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.850 - 0.300)/2
= 1.275 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 365.44 + (2.850 - 1.275) x ((369.47 - 365.44)/2.850)
= 367.67 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.275 x (367.67+ 369.47)/2
= 469.93 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.275 x (367.67 + 2 x 369.47)
               / (3 x (367.67 + 369.47))
= 0.638 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 469.93 x 0.638 x 3.000
= 897.75 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.000 - 0.450)/2
= 1.275 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 365.44 + (3.000 - 1.275) x ((369.47 - 365.44)/3.000)
= 367.76 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.275 x (367.76+ 369.47)/2
= 469.98 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.275 x (367.76 + 2 x 369.47) / (3 x (367.76 + 369.47))
= 0.638 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 469.98 x 0.638 x 2.850
= 852.86 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2856.10 / 8.550) x (8.550 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2009.22 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2009.22 / 7.772
= 258.51 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.000 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12320.69 kN-m > 897.75 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.850 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11513.57 kN-m > 852.86 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.000 x 1.219
= 3.657 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002065 m²
= 2065 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05647 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.657/100
= 0.004388 m²
= 4388 mm²

Provide #12 - 39 nos.(4411 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.000 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(39 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.850 x 1.207
= 3.440 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001982 m²
= 1982 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05761 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.440/100
= 0.004128 m²
= 4128 mm²

Provide #12 - 37 nos.(4185 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.850 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(37 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.850 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.056 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 365.44 + (2.850 - 0.056) x ((369.47 - 365.44)/2.850)
= 369.39 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.056 x 3.000) x 369.43
= 60.79 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.000
= 3.657 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004411 x 100)/3.657
= 0.12061
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 60.79 / 3.657
= 16.61 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.000 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.068 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 365.44 + (3.000 - 0.068) x ((369.47 - 365.44)/3.000)
= 369.38 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.068 x 2.850) x 369.42
= 68.26 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.850
= 3.440 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004185 x 100)/3.440
= 0.12165
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 68.26 / 3.440
= 19.79 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.550 m²)
= 8.550 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.550/0.135) = 7.958 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2856.10/0.135
= 21156.31 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2856.10 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 2849772.500 m²
= 2849772404736.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 272.53 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3128.63 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 3.01 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 281.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 272.53 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3128.63 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 3.35 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 267.35 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.850 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1225.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.000 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1225.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.850 x 3.000 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 39 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 37 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG32
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1807.30 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1204.87 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 120.49 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1325.36 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1988.04 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.77 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 12.90 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 1.15 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 19.35 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1325.36 / 250.00 = 5.301 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0006 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0107 m
= 0.011 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.379 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.229 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1325.36/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0006/2.379 )
= 5.310 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1325.36/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0107/2.229 )
= 5.454 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.275 x 2.425 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.517 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 240.24 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.3433 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.1683 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.75 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 233.73 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.76 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.14350.60246.76233.73

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 360.36 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.5150 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 9.2524 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.12 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 350.59 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.275 - 0.300)/2
= 0.988 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 350.60 + (2.275 - 0.988) x ((370.14 - 350.60)/2.275)
= 361.66 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.988 x (361.66+ 370.14)/2
= 361.32 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.988 x (361.66 + 2 x 370.14)
               / (3 x (361.66 + 370.14))
= 0.496 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 361.32 x 0.496 x 2.425
= 426.51 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.425 - 0.450)/2
= 0.987 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 350.60 + (2.425 - 0.987) x ((370.14 - 350.60)/2.425)
= 362.18 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.987 x (362.18+ 370.14)/2
= 361.58 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.987 x (362.18 + 2 x 370.14) / (3 x (362.18 + 370.14))
= 0.496 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 361.58 x 0.496 x 2.275
= 407.20 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.619 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.607 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.619 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.619 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.619 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.619)
= 1.138 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.619)
= 1.323 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.461 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1807.30 / 5.517) x (5.517 - (0.919 x 1.069))
= 1485.47 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1485.47 / 2.461
= 603.57 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.425 x 0.619 x 0.619
= 2572.11 kN-m > 426.51 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.275 x 0.607 x 0.607
= 2335.80 kN-m > 407.20 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.425 x 0.619
= 1.501 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001963 m²
= 1963 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.13075 %

Provide #12 - 19 nos.(2149 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.425 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(19 - 1)
= 0.128 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.275 x 0.607
= 1.381 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001914 m²
= 1914 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.13860 %

Provide #12 - 18 nos.(2036 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.275 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(18 - 1)
= 0.127 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.275 - 0.300)/2 - 0.619
= 0.369 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 350.60 + (2.275 - 0.369) x ((370.14 - 350.60)/2.275)
= 366.97 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.369 x 2.425) x 368.55
= 328.06 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.619 x 2.425
= 1.501 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002149 x 100)/1.501
= 0.14315
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 328.06 / 1.501
= 218.20 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.425 - 0.450)/2 - 0.607
= 0.380 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 350.60 + (2.425 - 0.380) x ((370.14 - 350.60)/2.425)
= 367.07 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.380 x 2.275) x 368.60
= 309.85 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.607 x 2.275
= 1.381 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002036 x 100)/1.381
= 0.14742
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 309.85 / 1.381
= 223.28 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(5.517 m²)
= 5.517 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.517/0.135) = 6.393 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1807.30/0.135
= 13387.44 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 93.10 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1900.40 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 15.08 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 146.95 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 93.10 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1900.40 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.98 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 137.86 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.275 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 937.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.425 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 937.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(619.000 / 607.000) + 300.000
= 907.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(619.000 / 607.000)
= 607 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.275 x 2.425 x 0.675 m
Provide #12 - 19 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 18 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG33
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1952.82 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1301.88 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 130.19 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1432.07 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2148.10 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.35 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 14.34 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.52 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 21.51 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1432.07 / 250.00 = 5.728 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0003 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0110 m
= 0.011 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.470 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.320 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1432.07/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0003/2.470 )
= 5.732 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1432.07/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0110/2.320 )
= 5.892 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.375 x 2.525 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.997 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 238.80 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.1383 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.0418 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 244.98 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 232.62 kN/m²
UpMaxw(244.99 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL367.48348.94244.99232.63

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 358.20 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.2075 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 9.0627 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 367.47 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 348.93 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 348.94 + (2.375 - 1.038) x ((367.48 - 348.94)/2.375)
= 359.38 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (359.38+ 367.48)/2
= 377.06 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (359.38 + 2 x 367.48)
               / (3 x (359.38 + 367.48))
= 0.521 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 377.06 x 0.521 x 2.525
= 486.99 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 348.94 + (2.525 - 1.038) x ((367.48 - 348.94)/2.525)
= 359.86 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (359.86+ 367.48)/2
= 377.31 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (359.86 + 2 x 367.48) / (3 x (359.86 + 367.48))
= 0.521 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 377.31 x 0.521 x 2.375
= 466.28 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1952.82 / 5.997) x (5.997 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1528.48 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1528.48 / 3.519
= 434.36 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.525 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4130.83 kN-m > 486.99 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.375 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3785.17 kN-m > 466.28 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.525 x 0.769
= 1.942 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001789 m²
= 1789 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09214 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.942/100
= 0.002330 m²
= 2330 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.525 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.375 x 0.757
= 1.798 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001742 m²
= 1742 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09689 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.798/100
= 0.002157 m²
= 2157 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.375 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.269 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 348.94 + (2.375 - 0.269) x ((367.48 - 348.94)/2.375)
= 365.38 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.269 x 2.525) x 366.43
= 247.38 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.525
= 1.942 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.942
= 0.12232
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 247.38 / 1.942
= 127.23 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 348.94 + (2.525 - 0.281) x ((367.48 - 348.94)/2.525)
= 365.42 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.375) x 366.45
= 236.20 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.375
= 1.798 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.798
= 0.12581
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 236.20 / 1.798
= 130.86 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(5.997 m²)
= 5.997 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.997/0.135) = 6.665 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1952.82/0.135
= 14465.34 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2076.51 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 16.59 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 178.58 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2076.51 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.35 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 167.97 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.375 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.525 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.375 x 2.525 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG34
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.600 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 4203.35 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2802.23 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 280.22 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 3082.46 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 4623.68 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.44 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 2.29 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 2.16 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 3.44 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 3082.46 / 250.00 = 12.330 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0005 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0008 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.665 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.365 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (3082.46/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0005/3.665 )
= 12.340 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (3082.46/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0008/3.365 )
= 12.348 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.375 x 3.675 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 12.403 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 248.52 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.1898 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.3284 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.04 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 248.00 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.04 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.56372.01249.04248.00

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 372.78 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.2847 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.4926 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.56 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 372.01 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.375 - 0.300)/2
= 1.538 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 372.01 + (3.375 - 1.538) x ((373.56 - 372.01)/3.375)
= 372.85 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.538 x (372.85+ 373.56)/2
= 573.81 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.538 x (372.85 + 2 x 373.56)
               / (3 x (372.85 + 373.56))
= 0.769 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 573.81 x 0.769 x 3.675
= 1620.11 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.675 - 0.600)/2
= 1.537 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 372.01 + (3.675 - 1.537) x ((373.56 - 372.01)/3.675)
= 372.91 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.537 x (372.91+ 373.56)/2
= 573.85 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.537 x (372.91 + 2 x 373.56) / (3 x (372.91 + 373.56))
= 0.769 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 573.85 x 0.769 x 3.375
= 1488.49 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.600 + 1.219)
= 4.435 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 8.138 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (4203.35 / 12.403) x (12.403 - (1.519 x 1.819))
= 3266.96 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 3266.96 / 8.138
= 401.44 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.600 = 0.500
ks = 0.5 + 0.500 = 1.000 = 1.000
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.675 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 15092.85 kN-m > 1620.11 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.375 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 13634.49 kN-m > 1488.49 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.675 x 1.219
= 4.480 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.003748 m²
= 3748 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08366 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 4.480/100
= 0.005376 m²
= 5376 mm²

Provide #12 - 48 nos.(5429 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.675 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(48 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.375 x 1.207
= 4.074 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.003479 m²
= 3479 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08540 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 4.074/100
= 0.004888 m²
= 4888 mm²

Provide #12 - 44 nos.(4976 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.375 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(44 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.375 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.319 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 372.01 + (3.375 - 0.319) x ((373.56 - 372.01)/3.375)
= 373.41 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.319 x 3.675) x 373.49
= 435.49 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.675
= 4.480 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.005429 x 100)/4.480
= 0.12118
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 435.49 / 4.480
= 97.13 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.675 - 0.600)/2 - 1.207
= 0.330 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 372.01 + (3.675 - 0.330) x ((373.56 - 372.01)/3.675)
= 373.42 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.330 x 3.375) x 373.49
= 412.33 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 3.375
= 4.074 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004976 x 100)/4.074
= 0.12216
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 412.33 / 4.074
= 100.97 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.600 + (4 x 1.275))
= 30.780 m² > footing area(12.403 m²)
= 12.403 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.180 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(12.403/0.180) = 8.301 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 4203.35/0.180
= 23351.93 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.169 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (4203.35 - 3037.33)/361050.00
= 4194935.000 m²
= 4194934980608.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 395.35 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 4598.70 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.64 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 344.74 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 395.35 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 4598.70 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.53 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 316.60 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.375 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1487.500 mm
In Y direction= (3.675 - 0.600) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1487.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.375 x 3.675 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 48 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 44 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG35
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3260.92 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2173.94 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 217.39 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2391.34 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3587.01 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 6.24 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 8.09 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 9.36 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 12.14 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2391.34 / 250.00 = 9.565 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0029 m
= 0.003 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0037 m
= 0.004 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.169 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.019 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2391.34/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0029/3.169 )
= 9.617 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2391.34/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0037/3.019 )
= 9.636 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.050 x 3.200 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 9.760 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 245.01 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.1991 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.6311 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.84 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 242.18 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.85 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.78363.29247.85242.19

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 367.52 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.7986 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 2.4466 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.77 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 363.28 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.050 - 0.300)/2
= 1.375 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.29 + (3.050 - 1.375) x ((371.78 - 363.29)/3.050)
= 367.95 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.375 x (367.95+ 371.78)/2
= 508.56 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.375 x (367.95 + 2 x 371.78)
               / (3 x (367.95 + 371.78))
= 0.689 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 508.56 x 0.689 x 3.200
= 1115.56 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.200 - 0.450)/2
= 1.375 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 363.29 + (3.200 - 1.375) x ((371.78 - 363.29)/3.200)
= 368.13 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.375 x (368.13+ 371.78)/2
= 508.69 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.375 x (368.13 + 2 x 371.78) / (3 x (368.13 + 371.78))
= 0.689 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 508.69 x 0.689 x 3.050
= 1064.67 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3260.92 / 9.760) x (9.760 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2413.88 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2413.88 / 7.772
= 310.57 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.200 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 13142.07 kN-m > 1115.56 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.050 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 12321.54 kN-m > 1064.67 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.200 x 1.219
= 3.901 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002571 m²
= 2571 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06591 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.901/100
= 0.004681 m²
= 4681 mm²

Provide #12 - 42 nos.(4750 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.200 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(42 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.050 x 1.207
= 3.681 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002479 m²
= 2479 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06734 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.681/100
= 0.004418 m²
= 4418 mm²

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.050 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.050 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.156 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
