= 363.29 + (3.050 - 0.156) x ((371.78 - 363.29)/3.050)
= 371.34 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.156 x 3.200) x 371.56
= 183.44 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.200
= 3.901 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004750 x 100)/3.901
= 0.12177
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 183.44 / 3.901
= 46.99 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.200 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.168 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.29 + (3.200 - 0.168) x ((371.78 - 363.29)/3.200)
= 371.33 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.168 x 3.050) x 371.56
= 185.81 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 3.050
= 3.681 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.681
= 0.12289
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 185.81 / 3.681
= 50.35 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(9.760 m²)
= 9.760 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(9.760/0.135) = 8.503 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3260.92/0.135
= 24154.93 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.125 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3260.92 - 2256.28)/361050.00
= 3254666.750 m²
= 3254666657792.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 311.10 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3572.02 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 9.35 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 300.19 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 311.10 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3572.02 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 7.20 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 286.11 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.050 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1325.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.200 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1325.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.050 x 3.200 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 42 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG36
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2980.01 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1986.67 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 198.67 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2185.34 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3278.01 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.24 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 5.13 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.36 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 7.70 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2185.34 / 250.00 = 8.741 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0001 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0026 m
= 0.003 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.033 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.883 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2185.34/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0001/3.033 )
= 8.743 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2185.34/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0026/2.883 )
= 8.788 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.900 x 3.050 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.845 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 247.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.0535 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.2007 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.32 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 245.82 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.33 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL372.49368.73248.33245.82

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 370.61 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.0802 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.8010 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 372.49 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 368.72 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.900 - 0.300)/2
= 1.300 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 368.73 + (2.900 - 1.300) x ((372.49 - 368.73)/2.900)
= 370.80 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.300 x (370.80+ 372.49)/2
= 483.14 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.300 x (370.80 + 2 x 372.49)
               / (3 x (370.80 + 372.49))
= 0.650 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 483.14 x 0.650 x 3.050
= 955.29 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.050 - 0.450)/2
= 1.300 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 368.73 + (3.050 - 1.300) x ((372.49 - 368.73)/3.050)
= 370.88 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.300 x (370.88+ 372.49)/2
= 483.19 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.300 x (370.88 + 2 x 372.49) / (3 x (370.88 + 372.49))
= 0.650 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 483.19 x 0.650 x 2.900
= 911.33 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2980.01 / 8.845) x (8.845 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2125.86 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2125.86 / 7.772
= 273.52 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.050 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12526.04 kN-m > 955.29 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.900 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11715.56 kN-m > 911.33 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.050 x 1.219
= 3.718 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002199 m²
= 2199 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05913 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.718/100
= 0.004462 m²
= 4462 mm²

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.050 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.900 x 1.207
= 3.500 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002119 m²
= 2119 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06053 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.500/100
= 0.004200 m²
= 4200 mm²

Provide #12 - 38 nos.(4298 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.900 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(38 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.900 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.081 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 368.73 + (2.900 - 0.081) x ((372.49 - 368.73)/2.900)
= 372.38 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.081 x 3.050) x 372.44
= 90.86 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.050
= 3.718 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.718
= 0.12168
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 90.86 / 3.718
= 24.42 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.050 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.093 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 368.73 + (3.050 - 0.093) x ((372.49 - 368.73)/3.050)
= 372.37 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.093 x 2.900) x 372.43
= 96.75 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.900
= 3.500 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004298 x 100)/3.500
= 0.12278
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 96.75 / 3.500
= 27.57 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.845 m²)
= 8.845 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.845/0.135) = 8.094 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2980.01/0.135
= 22074.14 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2980.01 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 2973680.000 m²
= 2973680009216.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 281.93 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3261.94 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 6.03 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 286.11 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 281.93 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3261.94 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.29 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 272.04 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.900 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1250.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.050 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1250.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.900 x 3.050 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 38 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG37
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2016.95 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1344.63 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 134.46 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1479.09 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2218.64 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.47 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 14.92 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.70 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 22.37 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1479.09 / 250.00 = 5.916 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0003 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0111 m
= 0.011 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.509 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.359 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1479.09/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0003/2.509 )
= 5.921 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1479.09/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0111/2.359 )
= 6.083 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.400 x 2.550 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.120 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 241.68 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.1796 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.0932 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.95 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 235.41 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.96 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.94353.12247.96235.41

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 362.52 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.2694 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 9.1398 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.93 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 353.11 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.400 - 0.300)/2
= 1.050 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 353.12 + (2.400 - 1.050) x ((371.94 - 353.12)/2.400)
= 363.71 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.050 x (363.71+ 371.94)/2
= 386.21 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.050 x (363.71 + 2 x 371.94)
               / (3 x (363.71 + 371.94))
= 0.527 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 386.21 x 0.527 x 2.550
= 509.86 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.550 - 0.450)/2
= 1.050 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 353.12 + (2.550 - 1.050) x ((371.94 - 353.12)/2.550)
= 364.19 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.050 x (364.19+ 371.94)/2
= 386.47 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.050 x (364.19 + 2 x 371.94) / (3 x (364.19 + 371.94))
= 0.527 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 386.47 x 0.527 x 2.400
= 488.39 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2016.95 / 6.120) x (6.120 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1587.48 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1587.48 / 3.519
= 451.13 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.550 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4171.73 kN-m > 509.86 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.400 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3825.01 kN-m > 488.39 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.550 x 0.769
= 1.961 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001874 m²
= 1874 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09559 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.961/100
= 0.002353 m²
= 2353 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.550 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.400 x 0.757
= 1.817 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001826 m²
= 1826 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10050 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.817/100
= 0.002180 m²
= 2180 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.400 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.120 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.400 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 353.12 + (2.400 - 0.281) x ((371.94 - 353.12)/2.400)
= 369.74 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.550) x 370.84
= 264.61 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.550
= 1.961 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.961
= 0.12112
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 264.61 / 1.961
= 134.76 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.550 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.293 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 353.12 + (2.550 - 0.293) x ((371.94 - 353.12)/2.550)
= 369.78 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.293 x 2.400) x 370.86
= 252.48 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.400
= 1.817 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.817
= 0.12450
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 252.48 / 1.817
= 138.42 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.120 m²)
= 6.120 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.120/0.135) = 6.733 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2016.95/0.135
= 14940.33 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 126.23 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2143.17 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 17.23 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 180.34 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 126.23 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2143.17 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.65 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 169.74 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.400 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1000.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.550 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1000.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.400 x 2.550 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG38
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2179.33 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1452.89 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 145.29 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1598.17 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2397.26 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.37 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 16.50 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 2.05 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 24.75 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1598.17 / 250.00 = 6.393 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0009 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0114 m
= 0.011 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.604 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.454 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1598.17/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0009/2.604 )
= 6.407 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1598.17/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0114/2.454 )
= 6.570 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.500 x 2.650 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.625 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 241.23 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.4668 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 5.9763 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.68 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 234.79 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.69 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.53352.20247.69234.80

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 361.85 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.7002 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 8.9645 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.52 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 352.19 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.500 - 0.300)/2
= 1.100 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.20 + (2.500 - 1.100) x ((371.53 - 352.20)/2.500)
= 363.03 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.100 x (363.03+ 371.53)/2
= 404.01 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.100 x (363.03 + 2 x 371.53)
               / (3 x (363.03 + 371.53))
= 0.552 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 404.01 x 0.552 x 2.650
= 580.93 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.650 - 0.450)/2
= 1.100 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 352.20 + (2.650 - 1.100) x ((371.53 - 352.20)/2.650)
= 363.51 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.100 x (363.51+ 371.53)/2
= 404.27 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.100 x (363.51 + 2 x 371.53) / (3 x (363.51 + 371.53))
= 0.552 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 404.27 x 0.552 x 2.500
= 557.11 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2179.33 / 6.625) x (6.625 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1750.66 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1750.66 / 3.519
= 497.50 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.650 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4335.32 kN-m > 580.93 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.500 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3984.39 kN-m > 557.11 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.650 x 0.769
= 2.038 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002140 m²
= 2140 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10501 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.038/100
= 0.002445 m²
= 2445 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.650 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.500 x 0.757
= 1.892 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002087 m²
= 2087 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11028 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.892/100
= 0.002271 m²
= 2271 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.500 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.500 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.331 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.20 + (2.500 - 0.331) x ((371.53 - 352.20)/2.500)
= 368.97 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.331 x 2.650) x 370.25
= 323.24 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.650
= 2.038 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/2.038
= 0.12210
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 323.24 / 2.038
= 158.41 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.650 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.343 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.20 + (2.650 - 0.343) x ((371.53 - 352.20)/2.650)
= 369.03 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.343 x 2.500) x 370.28
= 308.09 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.500
= 1.892 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.892
= 0.12550
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 308.09 / 1.892
= 162.15 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.625 m²)
= 6.625 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.625/0.135) = 7.005 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2179.33/0.135
= 16143.17 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 136.64 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2315.97 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 19.24 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 187.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 136.64 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2315.97 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.82 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 176.81 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.500 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1050.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.650 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1050.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.500 x 2.650 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG39
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3403.81 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2269.21 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 226.92 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2496.13 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3744.19 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 3.60 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 7.66 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 5.40 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 11.48 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2496.13 / 250.00 = 9.985 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0016 m
= 0.002 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0034 m
= 0.003 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.236 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.086 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2496.13/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0016/3.236 )
= 10.014 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2496.13/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0034/3.086 )
= 10.050 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.100 x 3.250 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 10.075 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 247.75 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.6594 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.4707 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.88 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 245.62 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.89 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.83368.44249.89245.63

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 371.63 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.9891 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 2.2060 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 374.83 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 368.44 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.100 - 0.300)/2
= 1.400 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 368.44 + (3.100 - 1.400) x ((374.83 - 368.44)/3.100)
= 371.95 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.400 x (371.95+ 374.83)/2
= 522.75 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.400 x (371.95 + 2 x 374.83)
               / (3 x (371.95 + 374.83))
= 0.701 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 522.75 x 0.701 x 3.250
= 1185.85 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.250 - 0.450)/2
= 1.400 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 368.44 + (3.250 - 1.400) x ((374.83 - 368.44)/3.250)
= 372.08 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.400 x (372.08+ 374.83)/2
= 522.84 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.400 x (372.08 + 2 x 374.83) / (3 x (372.08 + 374.83))
= 0.701 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 522.84 x 0.701 x 3.100
= 1133.79 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3403.81 / 10.075) x (10.075 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2547.30 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2547.30 / 7.772
= 327.74 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.250 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 13347.42 kN-m > 1185.85 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.100 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 12523.53 kN-m > 1133.79 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.250 x 1.219
= 3.962 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002735 m²
= 2735 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06903 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.962/100
= 0.004754 m²
= 4754 mm²

Provide #12 - 43 nos.(4863 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.250 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(43 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.100 x 1.207
= 3.742 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002642 m²
= 2642 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07060 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.742/100
= 0.004490 m²
= 4490 mm²

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.100 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.077 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.100 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.181 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 368.44 + (3.100 - 0.181) x ((374.83 - 368.44)/3.100)
= 374.46 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.181 x 3.250) x 374.65
= 218.62 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.250
= 3.962 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004863 x 100)/3.962
= 0.12275
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 218.62 / 3.962
= 55.14 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.250 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.193 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 368.44 + (3.250 - 0.193) x ((374.83 - 368.44)/3.250)
= 374.45 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.193 x 3.100) x 374.64
= 219.44 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 3.100
= 3.742 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.742
= 0.12090
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 219.44 / 3.742
= 58.50 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(10.075 m²)
= 10.075 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(10.075/0.135) = 8.639 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3403.81/0.135
= 25213.40 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.125 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3403.81 - 2256.28)/361050.00
= 3397559.750 m²
= 3397559779328.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 321.14 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3724.95 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 8.77 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 304.88 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 321.14 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3724.95 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 3.98 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 290.81 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.100 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1350.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.250 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1350.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.100 x 3.250 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 43 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG40
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2789.30 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1859.53 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 185.95 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2045.49 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3068.23 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 11.88 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.31 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 17.82 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.47 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2045.49 / 250.00 = 8.182 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0064 m
= 0.006 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0002 m
= 0.000 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.936 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.786 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2045.49/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0064/2.936 )
= 8.289 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2045.49/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0002/2.786 )
= 8.185 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.825 x 2.975 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.404 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 243.38 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.8503 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.0796 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.31 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 240.45 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.31 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.47360.68246.31240.45

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 365.08 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 4.2755 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.1194 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.47 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 360.68 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.825 - 0.300)/2
= 1.263 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.68 + (2.825 - 1.263) x ((369.47 - 360.68)/2.825)
= 365.54 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.263 x (365.54+ 369.47)/2
= 463.98 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.263 x (365.54 + 2 x 369.47)
               / (3 x (365.54 + 369.47))
= 0.632 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 463.98 x 0.632 x 2.975
= 872.69 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.975 - 0.450)/2
= 1.262 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 360.68 + (2.975 - 1.262) x ((369.47 - 360.68)/2.975)
= 365.74 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.262 x (365.74+ 369.47)/2
= 464.10 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.262 x (365.74 + 2 x 369.47) / (3 x (365.74 + 369.47))
= 0.632 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 464.10 x 0.632 x 2.825
= 822.12 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.969)
= 2.750 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.209 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2789.30 / 8.404) x (8.404 - (1.269 x 1.419))
= 2191.67 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2191.67 / 5.209
= 420.72 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.975 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 7723.69 kN-m > 872.69 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.825 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 7183.82 kN-m > 822.12 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.975 x 0.969
= 2.883 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002542 m²
= 2542 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08818 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.883/100
= 0.003459 m²
= 3459 mm²

Provide #12 - 31 nos.(3506 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.975 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(31 - 1)
= 0.095 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.825 x 0.957
= 2.704 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002426 m²
= 2426 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08972 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.704/100
= 0.003244 m²
= 3244 mm²

Provide #12 - 29 nos.(3280 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.825 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(29 - 1)
= 0.097 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.825 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.294 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.68 + (2.825 - 0.294) x ((369.47 - 360.68)/2.825)
= 368.56 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.294 x 2.975) x 369.01
= 317.78 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 2.975
= 2.883 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003506 x 100)/2.883
= 0.12162
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 317.78 / 2.883
= 110.12 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.975 - 0.450)/2 - 0.957
= 0.306 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.68 + (2.975 - 0.306) x ((369.47 - 360.68)/2.975)
= 368.57 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.306 x 2.825) x 369.02
= 315.26 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 2.825
= 2.704 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003280 x 100)/2.704
= 0.12132
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 315.26 / 2.704
= 116.25 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.020 m² > footing area(8.404 m²)
= 8.404 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.404/0.135) = 7.890 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2789.30/0.135
= 20661.48 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.128 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2789.30 - 2306.30)/361050.00
= 2782911.750 m²
= 2782911791104.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 215.36 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3004.66 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.50 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 244.94 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 215.36 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3004.66 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 13.34 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 232.59 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.825 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1212.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.975 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1212.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.825 x 2.975 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 31 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 29 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG41
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3144.61 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2096.41 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 209.64 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2306.05 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3459.07 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 21.25 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.02 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 31.87 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 1.53 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2306.05 / 250.00 = 9.224 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0101 m
= 0.010 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0005 m
= 0.000 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.113 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.963 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2306.05/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0101/3.113 )
= 9.404 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2306.05/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0005/2.963 )
= 9.233 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.000 x 3.150 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 9.450 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 244.03 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 4.2831 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.2152 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.52 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 239.53 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.53 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL372.79359.30248.53239.53

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 366.04 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 6.4246 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.3228 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 372.79 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 359.29 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.000 - 0.300)/2
= 1.350 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 359.30 + (3.000 - 1.350) x ((372.79 - 359.30)/3.000)
= 366.72 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.350 x (366.72+ 372.79)/2
= 499.17 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.350 x (366.72 + 2 x 372.79)
               / (3 x (366.72 + 372.79))
= 0.677 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 499.17 x 0.677 x 3.150
= 1063.60 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.150 - 0.450)/2
= 1.350 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 359.30 + (3.150 - 1.350) x ((372.79 - 359.30)/3.150)
= 367.01 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.350 x (367.01+ 372.79)/2
= 499.37 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.350 x (367.01 + 2 x 372.79) / (3 x (367.01 + 372.79))
= 0.677 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 499.37 x 0.677 x 3.000
= 1001.29 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3144.61 / 9.450) x (9.450 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2300.99 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2300.99 / 7.772
= 296.05 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.150 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12936.73 kN-m > 1063.60 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.000 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 12119.54 kN-m > 1001.29 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.150 x 1.219
= 3.840 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002450 m²
= 2450 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06381 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.840/100
= 0.004608 m²
= 4608 mm²

Provide #12 - 41 nos.(4637 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.150 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(41 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.000 x 1.207
= 3.621 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002330 m²
= 2330 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06434 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.621/100
= 0.004345 m²
= 4345 mm²

Provide #12 - 39 nos.(4411 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.000 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(39 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.000 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.131 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 359.30 + (3.000 - 0.131) x ((372.79 - 359.30)/3.000)
= 372.20 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.131 x 3.150) x 372.50
= 150.02 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.150
= 3.840 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004637 x 100)/3.840
= 0.12076
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 150.02 / 3.840
= 39.04 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.150 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.143 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 359.30 + (3.150 - 0.143) x ((372.79 - 359.30)/3.150)
= 372.18 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.143 x 3.000) x 372.49
= 156.32 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 3.000
= 3.621 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004411 x 100)/3.621
= 0.12181
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 156.32 / 3.621
= 43.06 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(9.450 m²)
= 9.450 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(9.450/0.135) = 8.367 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3144.61/0.135
= 23293.43 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.125 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3144.61 - 2256.28)/361050.00
= 3138364.250 m²
= 3138364375040.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 301.22 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3445.83 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.03 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 295.50 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 301.22 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3445.83 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 23.73 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 281.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.000 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1300.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.150 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1300.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.000 x 3.150 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 41 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 39 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG42
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2321.06 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1547.37 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 154.74 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1702.11 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2553.17 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.53 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.06 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 3.80 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 1.60 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1702.11 / 250.00 = 6.808 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0016 m
= 0.002 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0007 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.685 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.535 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1702.11/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0016/2.685 )
= 6.833 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1702.11/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0007/2.535 )
= 6.820 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.550 x 2.700 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.885 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 247.22 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.8166 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.3639 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.40 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 246.04 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.40 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL372.60369.06248.40246.04

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 370.83 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.2249 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.5459 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 372.60 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 369.06 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.550 - 0.300)/2
= 1.125 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 369.06 + (2.550 - 1.125) x ((372.60 - 369.06)/2.550)
= 371.04 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.125 x (371.04+ 372.60)/2
= 418.30 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.125 x (371.04 + 2 x 372.60)
               / (3 x (371.04 + 372.60))
= 0.563 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 418.30 x 0.563 x 2.700
= 635.08 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.700 - 0.450)/2
= 1.125 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 369.06 + (2.700 - 1.125) x ((372.60 - 369.06)/2.700)
= 371.13 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.125 x (371.13+ 372.60)/2
= 418.35 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.125 x (371.13 + 2 x 372.60) / (3 x (371.13 + 372.60))
= 0.563 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 418.35 x 0.563 x 2.550
= 599.03 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
