to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2321.06 / 6.885) x (6.885 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1881.76 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1881.76 / 3.519
= 534.75 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.700 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4417.12 kN-m > 635.08 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.550 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 4064.07 kN-m > 599.03 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.700 x 0.769
= 2.076 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002343 m²
= 2343 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11286 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.076/100
= 0.002492 m²
= 2492 mm²

Provide #12 - 23 nos.(2601 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.700 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(23 - 1)
= 0.118 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.550 x 0.757
= 1.930 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002247 m²
= 2247 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11641 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.930/100
= 0.002316 m²
= 2316 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.550 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.550 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.356 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 369.06 + (2.550 - 0.356) x ((372.60 - 369.06)/2.550)
= 372.11 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.356 x 2.700) x 372.36
= 355.89 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.700
= 2.076 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002601 x 100)/2.076
= 0.12528
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 355.89 / 2.076
= 171.18 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.700 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.368 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 369.06 + (2.700 - 0.368) x ((372.60 - 369.06)/2.700)
= 372.12 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.368 x 2.550) x 372.36
= 346.14 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.550
= 1.930 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.930
= 0.12304
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 346.14 / 1.930
= 178.60 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.885 m²)
= 6.885 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.885/0.135) = 7.141 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2321.06/0.135
= 17193.04 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 142.00 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2463.06 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.07 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 190.95 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 142.00 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2463.06 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.82 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 180.34 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.550 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1075.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.700 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1075.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.550 x 2.700 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 23 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG43
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3000.73 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2000.49 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 200.05 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2200.54 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3300.81 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.01 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 7.23 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.02 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 10.84 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2200.54 / 250.00 = 8.802 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0000 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0036 m
= 0.004 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.043 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.893 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2200.54/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0000/3.043 )
= 8.802 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2200.54/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0036/2.893 )
= 8.868 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.925 x 3.075 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.994 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 244.66 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.0030 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.6485 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.31 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 243.01 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.31 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.46364.51246.31243.01

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 366.99 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.0045 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 2.4727 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.46 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 364.51 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.925 - 0.300)/2
= 1.313 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.51 + (2.925 - 1.313) x ((369.46 - 364.51)/2.925)
= 367.24 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.313 x (367.24+ 369.46)/2
= 483.46 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.313 x (367.24 + 2 x 369.46)
               / (3 x (367.24 + 369.46))
= 0.657 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 483.46 x 0.657 x 3.075
= 972.00 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.075 - 0.450)/2
= 1.313 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 364.51 + (3.075 - 1.313) x ((369.46 - 364.51)/3.075)
= 367.35 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.313 x (367.35+ 369.46)/2
= 483.53 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.313 x (367.35 + 2 x 369.46) / (3 x (367.35 + 369.46))
= 0.657 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 483.53 x 0.657 x 2.925
= 929.04 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3000.73 / 8.994) x (8.994 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2154.93 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2154.93 / 7.772
= 277.26 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.075 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12628.71 kN-m > 972.00 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.925 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11816.56 kN-m > 929.04 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.075 x 1.219
= 3.748 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002237 m²
= 2237 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05969 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.748/100
= 0.004498 m²
= 4498 mm²

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.075 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.925 x 1.207
= 3.530 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002160 m²
= 2160 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06119 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.530/100
= 0.004237 m²
= 4237 mm²

Provide #12 - 38 nos.(4298 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.925 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(38 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.925 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.093 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.51 + (2.925 - 0.093) x ((369.46 - 364.51)/2.925)
= 369.30 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.093 x 3.075) x 369.38
= 105.07 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.075
= 3.748 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.748
= 0.12069
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 105.07 / 3.748
= 28.01 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.075 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.106 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.51 + (3.075 - 0.106) x ((369.46 - 364.51)/3.075)
= 369.29 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.106 x 2.925) x 369.38
= 110.03 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.925
= 3.530 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004298 x 100)/3.530
= 0.12173
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 110.03 / 3.530
= 31.09 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.994 m²)
= 8.994 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.994/0.135) = 8.162 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3000.73/0.135
= 22227.66 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3000.73 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 2994404.250 m²
= 2994404327424.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 286.70 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3287.43 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 8.57 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 288.46 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 286.70 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3287.43 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.02 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 274.39 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.925 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1262.500 mm
In Y direction= (3.075 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1262.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.925 x 3.075 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 38 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG44
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2152.66 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1435.11 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 143.51 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1578.62 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2367.93 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.05 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 16.52 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.07 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 24.78 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1578.62 / 250.00 = 6.314 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0000 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0115 m
= 0.012 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.589 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.439 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1578.62/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0000/2.589 )
= 6.315 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1578.62/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0115/2.439 )
= 6.493 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.475 x 2.625 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.497 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 242.98 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.0176 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.1649 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.16 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 236.80 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.16 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.75355.20249.16236.80

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 364.47 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.0263 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 9.2473 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.75 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 355.20 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.475 - 0.300)/2
= 1.087 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 355.20 + (2.475 - 1.087) x ((373.75 - 355.20)/2.475)
= 365.60 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.087 x (365.60+ 373.75)/2
= 402.02 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.087 x (365.60 + 2 x 373.75)
               / (3 x (365.60 + 373.75))
= 0.546 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 402.02 x 0.546 x 2.625
= 565.78 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.625 - 0.450)/2
= 1.087 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 355.20 + (2.625 - 1.087) x ((373.75 - 355.20)/2.625)
= 366.06 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.087 x (366.06+ 373.75)/2
= 402.27 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.087 x (366.06 + 2 x 373.75) / (3 x (366.06 + 373.75))
= 0.546 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 402.27 x 0.546 x 2.475
= 543.21 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2152.66 / 6.497) x (6.497 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1720.89 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1720.89 / 3.519
= 489.04 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.625 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4294.42 kN-m > 565.78 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.475 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3944.54 kN-m > 543.21 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.625 x 0.769
= 2.019 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002083 m²
= 2083 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10321 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.019/100
= 0.002422 m²
= 2422 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.625 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.120 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.475 x 0.757
= 1.874 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002034 m²
= 2034 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10858 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.874/100
= 0.002248 m²
= 2248 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.475 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.124 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.475 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.318 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 355.20 + (2.475 - 0.318) x ((373.75 - 355.20)/2.475)
= 371.36 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.318 x 2.625) x 372.55
= 310.48 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.625
= 2.019 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/2.019
= 0.12326
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 310.48 / 2.019
= 153.61 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.625 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.331 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 355.20 + (2.625 - 0.331) x ((373.75 - 355.20)/2.625)
= 371.41 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.331 x 2.475) x 372.58
= 295.45 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.475
= 1.874 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.874
= 0.12073
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 295.45 / 1.874
= 157.07 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.497 m²)
= 6.497 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.497/0.135) = 6.937 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2152.66/0.135
= 15945.64 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 134.00 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2286.66 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 18.98 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 185.65 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 134.00 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2286.66 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.19 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 175.04 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.475 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1037.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.625 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1037.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.475 x 2.625 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG45
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2222.12 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1481.42 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 148.14 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1629.56 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2444.33 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.02 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 16.73 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 3.03 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 25.09 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1629.56 / 250.00 = 6.518 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0014 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0113 m
= 0.011 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.629 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.479 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1629.56/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0014/2.629 )
= 6.539 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1629.56/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0113/2.479 )
= 6.696 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.525 x 2.675 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.754 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 241.26 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.6711 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 5.8852 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.82 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 234.70 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.83 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.75352.08247.83234.72

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 361.89 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.0066 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 8.8277 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.72 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 352.05 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.525 - 0.300)/2
= 1.113 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.08 + (2.525 - 1.113) x ((371.75 - 352.08)/2.525)
= 363.08 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.113 x (363.08+ 371.75)/2
= 408.75 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.113 x (363.08 + 2 x 371.75)
               / (3 x (363.08 + 371.75))
= 0.558 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 408.75 x 0.558 x 2.675
= 600.24 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.675 - 0.450)/2
= 1.112 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 352.08 + (2.675 - 1.112) x ((371.75 - 352.08)/2.675)
= 363.57 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.112 x (363.57+ 371.75)/2
= 409.02 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.112 x (363.57 + 2 x 371.75) / (3 x (363.57 + 371.75))
= 0.558 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 409.02 x 0.558 x 2.525
= 575.44 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2222.12 / 6.754) x (6.754 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1793.41 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1793.41 / 3.519
= 509.64 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.675 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4376.22 kN-m > 600.24 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.525 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 4024.23 kN-m > 575.44 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.675 x 0.769
= 2.057 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002212 m²
= 2212 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10755 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.057/100
= 0.002468 m²
= 2468 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.675 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.525 x 0.757
= 1.911 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002157 m²
= 2157 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11285 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.911/100
= 0.002294 m²
= 2294 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.525 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.525 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.344 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.08 + (2.525 - 0.344) x ((371.75 - 352.08)/2.525)
= 369.07 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.344 x 2.675) x 370.41
= 338.55 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.675
= 2.057 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/2.057
= 0.12096
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 338.55 / 2.057
= 164.36 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.675 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.356 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.08 + (2.675 - 0.356) x ((371.75 - 352.08)/2.675)
= 369.13 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.356 x 2.525) x 370.44
= 322.88 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.525
= 1.911 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.911
= 0.12426
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 322.88 / 1.911
= 168.26 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.754 m²)
= 6.754 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.754/0.135) = 7.073 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2222.12/0.135
= 16460.17 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 139.31 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2361.43 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 19.64 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 189.18 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 139.31 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2361.43 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.56 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 178.58 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.525 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1062.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.675 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1062.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.525 x 2.675 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG46
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3011.29 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2007.52 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 200.75 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2208.28 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3312.41 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.22 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 9.57 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 1.83 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 14.35 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2208.28 / 250.00 = 8.833 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0006 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0048 m
= 0.005 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.048 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.898 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2208.28/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0006/3.048 )
= 8.844 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2208.28/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0048/2.898 )
= 8.920 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.925 x 3.075 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.994 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 245.52 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.2646 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 2.1824 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.96 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 243.07 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.97 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.95364.61247.97243.07

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 368.28 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.3969 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 3.2736 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.95 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 364.61 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.925 - 0.300)/2
= 1.313 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.61 + (2.925 - 1.313) x ((371.95 - 364.61)/2.925)
= 368.66 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.313 x (368.66+ 371.95)/2
= 486.02 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.313 x (368.66 + 2 x 371.95)
               / (3 x (368.66 + 371.95))
= 0.657 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 486.02 x 0.657 x 3.075
= 976.15 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.075 - 0.450)/2
= 1.313 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 364.61 + (3.075 - 1.313) x ((371.95 - 364.61)/3.075)
= 368.82 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.313 x (368.82+ 371.95)/2
= 486.13 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.313 x (368.82 + 2 x 371.95) / (3 x (368.82 + 371.95))
= 0.657 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 486.13 x 0.657 x 2.925
= 933.73 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3011.29 / 8.994) x (8.994 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2162.51 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2162.51 / 7.772
= 278.23 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.075 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12628.71 kN-m > 976.15 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.925 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11816.56 kN-m > 933.73 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.075 x 1.219
= 3.748 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002247 m²
= 2247 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05994 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.748/100
= 0.004498 m²
= 4498 mm²

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.075 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.925 x 1.207
= 3.530 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002171 m²
= 2171 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06150 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.530/100
= 0.004237 m²
= 4237 mm²

Provide #12 - 38 nos.(4298 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.925 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(38 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.925 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.093 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.61 + (2.925 - 0.093) x ((371.95 - 364.61)/2.925)
= 371.72 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.093 x 3.075) x 371.83
= 105.65 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.075
= 3.748 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.748
= 0.12069
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 105.65 / 3.748
= 28.16 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.075 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.106 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.61 + (3.075 - 0.106) x ((371.95 - 364.61)/3.075)
= 371.70 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.106 x 2.925) x 371.82
= 110.53 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.925
= 3.530 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004298 x 100)/3.530
= 0.12173
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 110.53 / 3.530
= 31.23 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.994 m²)
= 8.994 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.994/0.135) = 8.162 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3011.29/0.135
= 22305.82 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3011.29 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 3004956.750 m²
= 3004956672000.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 286.70 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3297.98 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 10.87 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 288.46 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 286.70 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3297.98 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.16 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 274.39 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.925 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1262.500 mm
In Y direction= (3.075 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1262.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.925 x 3.075 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 38 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG47
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2006.86 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1337.91 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 133.79 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1471.70 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2207.55 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.41 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.54 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 2.12 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 2.30 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1471.70 / 250.00 = 5.887 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0011 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0011 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.502 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.352 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1471.70/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0011/2.502 )
= 5.902 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1471.70/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0011/2.352 )
= 5.904 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.375 x 2.525 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.997 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 245.41 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.5600 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.6469 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.62 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 244.20 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.62 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.93366.31246.62244.21

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 368.12 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.8401 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.9704 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.93 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 366.31 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.31 + (2.375 - 1.038) x ((369.93 - 366.31)/2.375)
= 368.35 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (368.35+ 369.93)/2
= 382.98 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (368.35 + 2 x 369.93)
               / (3 x (368.35 + 369.93))
= 0.519 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 382.98 x 0.519 x 2.525
= 501.07 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 366.31 + (2.525 - 1.038) x ((369.93 - 366.31)/2.525)
= 368.44 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (368.44+ 369.93)/2
= 383.03 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (368.44 + 2 x 369.93) / (3 x (368.44 + 369.93))
= 0.519 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 383.03 x 0.519 x 2.375
= 471.44 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2006.86 / 5.997) x (5.997 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1570.78 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1570.78 / 3.519
= 446.38 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.525 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4130.83 kN-m > 501.07 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.375 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3785.17 kN-m > 471.44 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.525 x 0.769
= 1.942 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001842 m²
= 1842 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09486 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.942/100
= 0.002330 m²
= 2330 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.525 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.375 x 0.757
= 1.798 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001762 m²
= 1762 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09798 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.798/100
= 0.002157 m²
= 2157 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.375 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.269 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.31 + (2.375 - 0.269) x ((369.93 - 366.31)/2.375)
= 369.52 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.269 x 2.525) x 369.72
= 249.22 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.525
= 1.942 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.942
= 0.12232
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 249.22 / 1.942
= 128.18 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.31 + (2.525 - 0.281) x ((369.93 - 366.31)/2.525)
= 369.53 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.375) x 369.73
= 243.10 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.375
= 1.798 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.798
= 0.12581
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 243.10 / 1.798
= 134.68 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(5.997 m²)
= 5.997 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.997/0.135) = 6.665 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2006.86/0.135
= 14865.67 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2130.55 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.52 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 178.58 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2130.55 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.08 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 167.97 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.375 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.525 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.375 x 2.525 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG48
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2006.27 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1337.51 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 133.75 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1471.26 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2206.89 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.98 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.61 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 2.98 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.91 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1471.26 / 250.00 = 5.885 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0015 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0005 m
= 0.000 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.502 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.352 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1471.26/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0015/2.502 )
= 5.906 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1471.26/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0005/2.352 )
= 5.892 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.375 x 2.525 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.997 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 245.34 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.7859 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.2562 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.38 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 244.30 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.38 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.57366.45246.38244.30

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 368.01 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.1789 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.3843 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.57 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 366.44 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.45 + (2.375 - 1.038) x ((369.57 - 366.45)/2.375)
= 368.21 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (368.21+ 369.57)/2
= 382.72 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (368.21 + 2 x 369.57)
               / (3 x (368.21 + 369.57))
= 0.519 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 382.72 x 0.519 x 2.525
= 501.24 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 366.45 + (2.525 - 1.038) x ((369.57 - 366.45)/2.525)
= 368.29 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (368.29+ 369.57)/2
= 382.76 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (368.29 + 2 x 369.57) / (3 x (368.29 + 369.57))
= 0.519 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 382.76 x 0.519 x 2.375
= 470.76 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2006.27 / 5.997) x (5.997 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1570.31 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1570.31 / 3.519
= 446.24 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.525 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4130.83 kN-m > 501.24 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.375 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3785.17 kN-m > 470.76 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.525 x 0.769
= 1.942 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001843 m²
= 1843 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09489 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.942/100
= 0.002330 m²
= 2330 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.525 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.375 x 0.757
= 1.798 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001759 m²
= 1759 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09784 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.798/100
= 0.002157 m²
= 2157 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.375 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.269 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.45 + (2.375 - 0.269) x ((369.57 - 366.45)/2.375)
= 369.22 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.269 x 2.525) x 369.40
= 248.80 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.525
= 1.942 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.942
= 0.12232
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 248.80 / 1.942
= 127.97 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.45 + (2.525 - 0.281) x ((369.57 - 366.45)/2.525)
= 369.22 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.375) x 369.40
= 243.23 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.375
= 1.798 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.798
= 0.12581
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 243.23 / 1.798
= 134.75 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(5.997 m²)
= 5.997 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.997/0.135) = 6.665 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2006.27/0.135
= 14861.24 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2129.95 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.44 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 178.58 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2129.95 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.18 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 167.97 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.375 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.525 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.375 x 2.525 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG49
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2040.87 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1360.58 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 136.06 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1496.63 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2244.95 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.77 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.04 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 1.16 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.06 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1496.63 / 250.00 = 5.987 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0006 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0000 m
= 0.000 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.523 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.373 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1496.63/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0006/2.523 )
= 5.995 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1496.63/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0000/2.373 )
= 5.987 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.375 x 2.525 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.997 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 249.57 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.3058 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.0170 kN/m²
