Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.89 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 249.25 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.89 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.84373.87249.89249.25

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 374.35 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.4587 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.0256 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 374.84 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 373.87 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 373.87 + (2.375 - 1.038) x ((374.84 - 373.87)/2.375)
= 374.41 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (374.41+ 374.84)/2
= 388.67 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (374.41 + 2 x 374.84)
               / (3 x (374.41 + 374.84))
= 0.519 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 388.67 x 0.519 x 2.525
= 509.17 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 373.87 + (2.525 - 1.038) x ((374.84 - 373.87)/2.525)
= 374.44 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (374.44+ 374.84)/2
= 388.69 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (374.44 + 2 x 374.84) / (3 x (374.44 + 374.84))
= 0.519 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 388.69 x 0.519 x 2.375
= 478.53 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2040.87 / 5.997) x (5.997 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1597.39 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1597.39 / 3.519
= 453.94 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.525 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4130.83 kN-m > 509.17 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.375 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3785.17 kN-m > 478.53 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.525 x 0.769
= 1.942 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001872 m²
= 1872 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09642 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.942/100
= 0.002330 m²
= 2330 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.525 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.375 x 0.757
= 1.798 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001789 m²
= 1789 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09949 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.798/100
= 0.002157 m²
= 2157 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.375 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.269 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 373.87 + (2.375 - 0.269) x ((374.84 - 373.87)/2.375)
= 374.73 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.269 x 2.525) x 374.78
= 252.87 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.525
= 1.942 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.942
= 0.12232
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 252.87 / 1.942
= 130.06 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 373.87 + (2.525 - 0.281) x ((374.84 - 373.87)/2.525)
= 374.73 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.375) x 374.78
= 246.99 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.375
= 1.798 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.798
= 0.12581
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 246.99 / 1.798
= 136.84 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(5.997 m²)
= 5.997 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.997/0.135) = 6.665 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2040.87/0.135
= 15117.52 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2164.55 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.32 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 178.58 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2164.55 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.74 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 167.97 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.375 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.525 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.375 x 2.525 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG50
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2972.33 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1981.56 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 198.16 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2179.71 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3269.57 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.40 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 7.76 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.59 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 11.65 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2179.71 / 250.00 = 8.719 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0002 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0039 m
= 0.004 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.029 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.879 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2179.71/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0002/3.029 )
= 8.722 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2179.71/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0039/2.879 )
= 8.790 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.900 x 3.050 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.845 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 246.43 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.0881 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.8163 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.34 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 244.53 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.34 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL372.51366.80248.34244.53

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 369.65 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.1321 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 2.7244 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 372.51 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 366.79 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.900 - 0.300)/2
= 1.300 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.80 + (2.900 - 1.300) x ((372.51 - 366.80)/2.900)
= 369.95 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.300 x (369.95+ 372.51)/2
= 482.60 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.300 x (369.95 + 2 x 372.51)
               / (3 x (369.95 + 372.51))
= 0.651 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 482.60 x 0.651 x 3.050
= 952.92 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.050 - 0.450)/2
= 1.300 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 366.80 + (3.050 - 1.300) x ((372.51 - 366.80)/3.050)
= 370.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.300 x (370.07+ 372.51)/2
= 482.68 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.300 x (370.07 + 2 x 372.51) / (3 x (370.07 + 372.51))
= 0.651 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 482.68 x 0.651 x 2.900
= 910.61 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2972.33 / 8.845) x (8.845 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2120.38 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2120.38 / 7.772
= 272.81 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.050 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12526.04 kN-m > 952.92 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.900 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11715.56 kN-m > 910.61 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.050 x 1.219
= 3.718 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002193 m²
= 2193 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05899 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.718/100
= 0.004462 m²
= 4462 mm²

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.050 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.900 x 1.207
= 3.500 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002117 m²
= 2117 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06049 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.500/100
= 0.004200 m²
= 4200 mm²

Provide #12 - 38 nos.(4298 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.900 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(38 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.900 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.081 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.80 + (2.900 - 0.081) x ((372.51 - 366.80)/2.900)
= 372.35 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.081 x 3.050) x 372.43
= 90.84 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.050
= 3.718 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.718
= 0.12168
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 90.84 / 3.718
= 24.41 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.050 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.093 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.80 + (3.050 - 0.093) x ((372.51 - 366.80)/3.050)
= 372.33 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.093 x 2.900) x 372.42
= 96.51 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.900
= 3.500 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004298 x 100)/3.500
= 0.12278
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 96.51 / 3.500
= 27.50 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.845 m²)
= 8.845 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.845/0.135) = 8.094 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2972.33/0.135
= 22017.28 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2972.33 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 2966003.000 m²
= 2966003122176.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 281.93 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3254.27 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 9.31 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 286.11 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 281.93 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3254.27 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.39 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 272.04 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.900 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1250.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.050 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1250.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.900 x 3.050 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 38 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG51
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2192.18 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1461.46 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 146.15 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1607.60 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2411.40 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.52 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 17.26 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.78 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 25.89 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1607.60 / 250.00 = 6.430 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0004 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0118 m
= 0.012 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.612 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.462 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1607.60/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0004/2.612 )
= 6.436 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1607.60/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0118/2.462 )
= 6.616 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.500 x 2.650 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.625 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 242.66 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.1774 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.2535 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.09 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 236.23 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.09 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.64354.35249.09236.23

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 363.99 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.2662 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 9.3802 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.63 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 354.34 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.500 - 0.300)/2
= 1.100 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 354.35 + (2.500 - 1.100) x ((373.64 - 354.35)/2.500)
= 365.15 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.100 x (365.15+ 373.64)/2
= 406.33 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.100 x (365.15 + 2 x 373.64)
               / (3 x (365.15 + 373.64))
= 0.552 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 406.33 x 0.552 x 2.650
= 583.86 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.650 - 0.450)/2
= 1.100 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 354.35 + (2.650 - 1.100) x ((373.64 - 354.35)/2.650)
= 365.63 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.100 x (365.63+ 373.64)/2
= 406.60 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.100 x (365.63 + 2 x 373.64) / (3 x (365.63 + 373.64))
= 0.552 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 406.60 x 0.552 x 2.500
= 560.79 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2192.18 / 6.625) x (6.625 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1760.99 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1760.99 / 3.519
= 500.43 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.650 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4335.32 kN-m > 583.86 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.500 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3984.39 kN-m > 560.79 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.650 x 0.769
= 2.038 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002151 m²
= 2151 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10555 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.038/100
= 0.002445 m²
= 2445 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.650 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.500 x 0.757
= 1.892 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002101 m²
= 2101 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11103 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.892/100
= 0.002271 m²
= 2271 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.500 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.500 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.331 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 354.35 + (2.500 - 0.331) x ((373.64 - 354.35)/2.500)
= 371.08 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.331 x 2.650) x 372.36
= 325.43 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.650
= 2.038 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/2.038
= 0.12210
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 325.43 / 2.038
= 159.48 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.650 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.343 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 354.35 + (2.650 - 0.343) x ((373.64 - 354.35)/2.650)
= 371.14 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.343 x 2.500) x 372.39
= 309.58 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.500
= 1.892 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.892
= 0.12550
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 309.58 / 1.892
= 162.94 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.625 m²)
= 6.625 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.625/0.135) = 7.005 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2192.18/0.135
= 16238.40 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 136.64 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2328.82 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 19.73 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 187.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 136.64 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2328.82 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.44 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 176.81 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.500 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1050.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.650 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1050.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.500 x 2.650 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG52
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2127.99 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1418.66 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 141.87 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1560.53 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2340.79 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.71 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 16.06 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 4.06 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 24.09 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1560.53 / 250.00 = 6.242 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0019 m
= 0.002 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0113 m
= 0.011 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.575 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.425 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1560.53/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0019/2.575 )
= 6.270 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1560.53/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0113/2.425 )
= 6.417 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.475 x 2.625 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.497 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 240.20 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.9522 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 5.9914 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.14 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 233.25 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.16 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.75349.91247.16233.28

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 360.29 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.4283 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 8.9871 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.71 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 349.88 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.475 - 0.300)/2
= 1.087 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.91 + (2.475 - 1.087) x ((370.75 - 349.91)/2.475)
= 361.59 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.087 x (361.59+ 370.75)/2
= 398.21 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.087 x (361.59 + 2 x 370.75)
               / (3 x (361.59 + 370.75))
= 0.546 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 398.21 x 0.546 x 2.625
= 560.83 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.625 - 0.450)/2
= 1.087 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 349.91 + (2.625 - 1.087) x ((370.75 - 349.91)/2.625)
= 362.12 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.087 x (362.12+ 370.75)/2
= 398.49 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.087 x (362.12 + 2 x 370.75) / (3 x (362.12 + 370.75))
= 0.546 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 398.49 x 0.546 x 2.475
= 536.82 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2127.99 / 6.497) x (6.497 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1701.17 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1701.17 / 3.519
= 483.43 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.625 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4294.42 kN-m > 560.83 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.475 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3944.54 kN-m > 536.82 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.625 x 0.769
= 2.019 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002065 m²
= 2065 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10229 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.019/100
= 0.002422 m²
= 2422 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.625 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.120 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.475 x 0.757
= 1.874 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002010 m²
= 2010 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10727 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.874/100
= 0.002248 m²
= 2248 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.475 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.124 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.475 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.318 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.91 + (2.475 - 0.318) x ((370.75 - 349.91)/2.475)
= 368.06 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.318 x 2.625) x 369.41
= 306.81 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.625
= 2.019 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/2.019
= 0.12326
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 306.81 / 2.019
= 151.79 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.625 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.331 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.91 + (2.625 - 0.331) x ((370.75 - 349.91)/2.625)
= 368.12 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.331 x 2.475) x 369.43
= 293.05 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.475
= 1.874 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.874
= 0.12073
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 293.05 / 1.874
= 155.80 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.497 m²)
= 6.497 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.497/0.135) = 6.937 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2127.99/0.135
= 15762.89 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 134.00 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2261.99 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 18.96 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 185.65 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 134.00 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2261.99 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.34 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 175.04 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.475 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1037.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.625 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1037.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.475 x 2.625 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG53
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2933.45 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1955.64 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 195.56 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2151.20 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3226.80 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.96 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 9.44 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 1.43 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 14.16 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2151.20 / 250.00 = 8.605 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0005 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0048 m
= 0.005 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.009 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.859 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2151.20/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0005/3.009 )
= 8.613 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2151.20/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0048/2.859 )
= 8.692 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.875 x 3.025 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.697 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 247.35 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.2180 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 2.2647 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.84 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 244.87 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.84 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.76367.31249.84244.87

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 371.03 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.3270 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 3.3971 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 374.75 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 367.31 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.875 - 0.300)/2
= 1.288 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.31 + (2.875 - 1.288) x ((374.76 - 367.31)/2.875)
= 371.42 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.288 x (371.42+ 374.76)/2
= 480.35 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.288 x (371.42 + 2 x 374.76)
               / (3 x (371.42 + 374.76))
= 0.645 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 480.35 x 0.645 x 3.025
= 930.82 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.025 - 0.450)/2
= 1.288 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 367.31 + (3.025 - 1.288) x ((374.76 - 367.31)/3.025)
= 371.59 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.288 x (371.59+ 374.76)/2
= 480.46 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.288 x (371.59 + 2 x 374.76) / (3 x (371.59 + 374.76))
= 0.645 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 480.46 x 0.645 x 2.875
= 889.92 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2933.45 / 8.697) x (8.697 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2078.33 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2078.33 / 7.772
= 267.40 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.025 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12423.37 kN-m > 930.82 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.875 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11614.56 kN-m > 889.92 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.025 x 1.219
= 3.687 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002142 m²
= 2142 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05808 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.687/100
= 0.004425 m²
= 4425 mm²

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.025 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.875 x 1.207
= 3.470 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002069 m²
= 2069 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05961 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.470/100
= 0.004164 m²
= 4164 mm²

Provide #12 - 37 nos.(4185 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.875 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(37 - 1)
= 0.077 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.875 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.069 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.31 + (2.875 - 0.069) x ((374.76 - 367.31)/2.875)
= 374.58 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.069 x 3.025) x 374.67
= 76.44 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.025
= 3.687 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.687
= 0.12268
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 76.44 / 3.687
= 20.71 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.025 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.081 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.31 + (3.025 - 0.081) x ((374.76 - 367.31)/3.025)
= 374.56 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.081 x 2.875) x 374.66
= 82.74 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.875
= 3.470 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004185 x 100)/3.470
= 0.12059
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 82.74 / 3.470
= 23.78 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.697 m²)
= 8.697 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.697/0.135) = 8.026 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2933.45/0.135
= 21729.28 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2933.45 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 2927123.000 m²
= 2927122972672.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 277.21 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3210.67 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 10.61 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 283.77 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 277.21 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3210.67 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.82 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 269.70 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.875 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1237.500 mm
In Y direction= (3.025 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1237.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.875 x 3.025 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 37 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG54
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2014.72 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1343.15 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 134.31 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1477.46 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2216.19 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.15 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.52 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 1.73 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 2.28 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1477.46 / 250.00 = 5.910 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0009 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0011 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.507 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.357 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1477.46/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0009/2.507 )
= 5.922 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1477.46/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0011/2.357 )
= 5.927 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.375 x 2.525 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.997 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 246.37 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.4576 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.6391 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.47 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 245.27 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.47 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.20367.91247.47245.28

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 369.56 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.6865 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.9587 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.20 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 367.91 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.91 + (2.375 - 1.038) x ((371.20 - 367.91)/2.375)
= 369.77 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (369.77+ 371.20)/2
= 384.38 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (369.77 + 2 x 371.20)
               / (3 x (369.77 + 371.20))
= 0.519 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 384.38 x 0.519 x 2.525
= 502.88 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 367.91 + (2.525 - 1.038) x ((371.20 - 367.91)/2.525)
= 369.85 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (369.85+ 371.20)/2
= 384.42 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (369.85 + 2 x 371.20) / (3 x (369.85 + 371.20))
= 0.519 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 384.42 x 0.519 x 2.375
= 473.27 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2014.72 / 5.997) x (5.997 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1576.92 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1576.92 / 3.519
= 448.12 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.525 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4130.83 kN-m > 502.88 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.375 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3785.17 kN-m > 473.27 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.525 x 0.769
= 1.942 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001849 m²
= 1849 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09521 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.942/100
= 0.002330 m²
= 2330 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.525 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.375 x 0.757
= 1.798 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001769 m²
= 1769 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09837 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.798/100
= 0.002157 m²
= 2157 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.375 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.269 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.91 + (2.375 - 0.269) x ((371.20 - 367.91)/2.375)
= 370.83 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.269 x 2.525) x 371.02
= 250.19 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.525
= 1.942 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.942
= 0.12232
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 250.19 / 1.942
= 128.68 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.91 + (2.525 - 0.281) x ((371.20 - 367.91)/2.525)
= 370.84 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.375) x 371.02
= 243.96 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.375
= 1.798 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.798
= 0.12581
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 243.96 / 1.798
= 135.16 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(5.997 m²)
= 5.997 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.997/0.135) = 6.665 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2014.72/0.135
= 14923.84 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2138.40 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.40 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 178.58 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2138.40 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.78 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 167.97 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.375 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.525 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.375 x 2.525 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG55
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2098.95 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1399.30 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 139.93 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1539.23 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2308.84 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.32 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.92 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 3.48 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 1.37 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1539.23 / 250.00 = 6.157 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0017 m
= 0.002 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0007 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.557 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.407 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1539.23/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0017/2.557 )
= 6.181 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1539.23/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0007/2.407 )
= 6.167 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.425 x 2.575 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.244 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 246.50 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.8667 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.3627 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.73 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 245.27 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.73 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.59367.91247.73245.27

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 369.75 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.3000 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.5440 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.59 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 367.90 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.425 - 0.300)/2
= 1.063 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.91 + (2.425 - 1.063) x ((371.59 - 367.91)/2.425)
= 369.98 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.063 x (369.98+ 371.59)/2
= 393.96 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.063 x (369.98 + 2 x 371.59)
               / (3 x (369.98 + 371.59))
= 0.532 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 393.96 x 0.532 x 2.575
= 538.75 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.575 - 0.450)/2
= 1.063 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 367.91 + (2.575 - 1.063) x ((371.59 - 367.91)/2.575)
= 370.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.063 x (370.07+ 371.59)/2
= 394.01 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.063 x (370.07 + 2 x 371.59) / (3 x (370.07 + 371.59))
= 0.532 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 394.01 x 0.532 x 2.425
= 506.65 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2098.95 / 6.244) x (6.244 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1660.93 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1660.93 / 3.519
= 472.00 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.575 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4212.63 kN-m > 538.75 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.425 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3864.85 kN-m > 506.65 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.575 x 0.769
= 1.980 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001983 m²
= 1983 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10012 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.980/100
= 0.002376 m²
= 2376 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.575 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.117 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.425 x 0.757
= 1.836 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001895 m²
= 1895 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10324 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.836/100
= 0.002203 m²
= 2203 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.425 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.425 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.293 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.91 + (2.425 - 0.293) x ((371.59 - 367.91)/2.425)
= 371.15 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.293 x 2.575) x 371.37
= 278.85 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.575
= 1.980 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/1.980
= 0.12565
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 278.85 / 1.980
= 140.64 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.575 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.306 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.91 + (2.575 - 0.306) x ((371.59 - 367.91)/2.575)
= 371.16 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.306 x 2.425) x 371.37
= 272.07 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.425
= 1.836 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.836
= 0.12322
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 272.07 / 1.836
= 147.63 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.244 m²)
= 6.244 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.244/0.135) = 6.801 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2098.95/0.135
= 15547.77 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 128.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2227.74 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.69 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 182.11 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 128.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2227.74 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.61 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 171.50 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.425 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1012.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.575 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1012.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
