Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.425 x 2.575 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG56
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2004.99 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1336.66 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 133.67 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1470.33 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2205.49 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.40 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.48 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 0.61 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.71 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1470.33 / 250.00 = 5.881 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0003 m
= 0.000 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0004 m
= 0.000 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.501 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.351 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1470.33/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0003/2.501 )
= 5.886 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1470.33/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0004/2.351 )
= 5.887 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.375 x 2.525 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.997 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 245.18 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.1604 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.2008 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 245.54 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 244.82 kN/m²
UpMaxw(245.54 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL368.32367.23245.54244.82

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 367.77 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.2407 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.3012 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 368.32 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 367.23 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.23 + (2.375 - 1.038) x ((368.32 - 367.23)/2.375)
= 367.84 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (367.84+ 368.32)/2
= 381.88 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (367.84 + 2 x 368.32)
               / (3 x (367.84 + 368.32))
= 0.519 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 381.88 x 0.519 x 2.525
= 500.02 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 367.23 + (2.525 - 1.038) x ((368.32 - 367.23)/2.525)
= 367.87 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (367.87+ 368.32)/2
= 381.90 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (367.87 + 2 x 368.32) / (3 x (367.87 + 368.32))
= 0.519 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 381.90 x 0.519 x 2.375
= 470.38 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2004.99 / 5.997) x (5.997 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1569.31 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1569.31 / 3.519
= 445.96 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.525 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4130.83 kN-m > 500.02 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.375 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3785.17 kN-m > 470.38 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.525 x 0.769
= 1.942 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001838 m²
= 1838 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09465 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.942/100
= 0.002330 m²
= 2330 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.525 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.375 x 0.757
= 1.798 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001758 m²
= 1758 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09776 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.798/100
= 0.002157 m²
= 2157 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.375 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.269 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.23 + (2.375 - 0.269) x ((368.32 - 367.23)/2.375)
= 368.19 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.269 x 2.525) x 368.25
= 248.59 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.525
= 1.942 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.942
= 0.12232
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 248.59 / 1.942
= 127.86 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.23 + (2.525 - 0.281) x ((368.32 - 367.23)/2.525)
= 368.20 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.375) x 368.26
= 242.53 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.375
= 1.798 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.798
= 0.12581
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 242.53 / 1.798
= 134.36 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(5.997 m²)
= 5.997 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.997/0.135) = 6.665 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2004.99/0.135
= 14851.81 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2128.68 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.17 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 178.58 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2128.68 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.31 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 167.97 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.375 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.525 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.375 x 2.525 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG57
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2850.96 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1900.64 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 190.06 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2090.71 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3136.06 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.14 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 6.90 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 1.72 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 10.35 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2090.71 / 250.00 = 8.363 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0006 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0036 m
= 0.004 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.968 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.818 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2090.71/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0006/2.968 )
= 8.373 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2090.71/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0036/2.818 )
= 8.427 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.850 x 3.000 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.550 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 244.53 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.2676 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.6984 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.49 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 242.56 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.49 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.74363.84246.49242.56

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 366.79 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.4013 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 2.5477 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.74 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 363.84 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.850 - 0.300)/2
= 1.275 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.84 + (2.850 - 1.275) x ((369.74 - 363.84)/2.850)
= 367.10 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.275 x (367.10+ 369.74)/2
= 469.74 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.275 x (367.10 + 2 x 369.74)
               / (3 x (367.10 + 369.74))
= 0.638 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 469.74 x 0.638 x 3.000
= 895.08 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.000 - 0.450)/2
= 1.275 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 363.84 + (3.000 - 1.275) x ((369.74 - 363.84)/3.000)
= 367.24 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.275 x (367.24+ 369.74)/2
= 469.82 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.275 x (367.24 + 2 x 369.74) / (3 x (367.24 + 369.74))
= 0.638 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 469.82 x 0.638 x 2.850
= 853.91 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2850.96 / 8.550) x (8.550 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2005.61 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2005.61 / 7.772
= 258.04 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.000 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12320.69 kN-m > 895.08 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.850 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11513.57 kN-m > 853.91 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.000 x 1.219
= 3.657 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002059 m²
= 2059 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05630 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.657/100
= 0.004388 m²
= 4388 mm²

Provide #12 - 39 nos.(4411 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.000 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(39 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.850 x 1.207
= 3.440 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001984 m²
= 1984 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05768 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.440/100
= 0.004128 m²
= 4128 mm²

Provide #12 - 37 nos.(4185 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.850 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(37 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.850 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.056 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.84 + (2.850 - 0.056) x ((369.74 - 363.84)/2.850)
= 369.63 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.056 x 3.000) x 369.68
= 60.93 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.000
= 3.657 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004411 x 100)/3.657
= 0.12061
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 60.93 / 3.657
= 16.65 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.000 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.068 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.84 + (3.000 - 0.068) x ((369.74 - 363.84)/3.000)
= 369.61 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.068 x 2.850) x 369.68
= 68.02 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.850
= 3.440 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004185 x 100)/3.440
= 0.12165
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 68.02 / 3.440
= 19.72 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.550 m²)
= 8.550 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.550/0.135) = 7.958 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2850.96/0.135
= 21118.24 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2850.96 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 2844633.500 m²
= 2844633595904.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 272.53 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3123.49 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 8.40 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 281.42 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 272.53 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3123.49 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.24 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 267.35 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.850 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1225.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.000 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1225.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.850 x 3.000 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 39 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 37 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG58
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2054.89 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1369.93 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 136.99 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1506.92 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2260.38 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.64 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 16.51 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 2.46 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 24.76 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1506.92 / 250.00 = 6.028 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0012 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0120 m
= 0.012 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.531 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.381 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1506.92/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0012/2.531 )
= 6.045 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1506.92/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0120/2.381 )
= 6.211 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.425 x 2.575 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.244 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 241.32 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.6117 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.5400 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.48 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 234.17 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.49 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL372.74351.28248.49234.19

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 361.99 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.9175 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 9.8100 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 372.71 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 351.26 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.425 - 0.300)/2
= 1.063 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 351.28 + (2.425 - 1.063) x ((372.74 - 351.28)/2.425)
= 363.34 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.063 x (363.34+ 372.74)/2
= 391.04 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.063 x (363.34 + 2 x 372.74)
               / (3 x (363.34 + 372.74))
= 0.534 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 391.04 x 0.534 x 2.575
= 527.08 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.575 - 0.450)/2
= 1.063 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 351.28 + (2.575 - 1.063) x ((372.74 - 351.28)/2.575)
= 363.89 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.063 x (363.89+ 372.74)/2
= 391.33 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.063 x (363.89 + 2 x 372.74) / (3 x (363.89 + 372.74))
= 0.533 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 391.33 x 0.533 x 2.425
= 505.22 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2054.89 / 6.244) x (6.244 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1626.06 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1626.06 / 3.519
= 462.09 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.575 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4212.63 kN-m > 527.08 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.425 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3864.85 kN-m > 505.22 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.575 x 0.769
= 1.980 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001939 m²
= 1939 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09791 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.980/100
= 0.002376 m²
= 2376 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.575 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.117 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.425 x 0.757
= 1.836 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001890 m²
= 1890 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10294 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.836/100
= 0.002203 m²
= 2203 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.425 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.425 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.293 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 351.28 + (2.425 - 0.293) x ((372.74 - 351.28)/2.425)
= 370.14 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.293 x 2.575) x 371.44
= 279.14 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.575
= 1.980 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/1.980
= 0.12565
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 279.14 / 1.980
= 140.78 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.575 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.306 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 351.28 + (2.575 - 0.306) x ((372.74 - 351.28)/2.575)
= 370.19 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.306 x 2.425) x 371.47
= 266.13 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.425
= 1.836 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.836
= 0.12322
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 266.13 / 1.836
= 144.40 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.244 m²)
= 6.244 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.244/0.135) = 6.801 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2054.89/0.135
= 15221.41 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 128.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2183.68 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 18.74 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 182.11 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 128.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2183.68 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.72 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 171.50 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.425 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1012.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.575 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1012.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.425 x 2.575 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG59
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1994.69 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1329.79 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 132.98 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1462.77 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2194.16 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 1.56 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 13.65 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 2.34 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 20.48 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1462.77 / 250.00 = 5.851 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0012 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0103 m
= 0.010 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.495 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.345 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1462.77/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0012/2.495 )
= 5.868 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1462.77/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0103/2.345 )
= 6.005 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.400 x 2.550 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.120 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 239.02 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.5986 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 5.5771 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 245.19 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 232.84 kN/m²
UpMaxw(245.21 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL367.81349.28245.21232.85

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 358.52 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.8980 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 8.3657 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 367.79 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 349.26 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.400 - 0.300)/2
= 1.050 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.28 + (2.400 - 1.050) x ((367.81 - 349.28)/2.400)
= 359.70 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.050 x (359.70+ 367.81)/2
= 381.94 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.050 x (359.70 + 2 x 367.81)
               / (3 x (359.70 + 367.81))
= 0.527 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 381.94 x 0.527 x 2.550
= 504.87 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.550 - 0.450)/2
= 1.050 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 349.28 + (2.550 - 1.050) x ((367.81 - 349.28)/2.550)
= 360.18 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.050 x (360.18+ 367.81)/2
= 382.19 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.050 x (360.18 + 2 x 367.81) / (3 x (360.18 + 367.81))
= 0.527 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 382.19 x 0.527 x 2.400
= 482.36 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1994.69 / 6.120) x (6.120 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1569.97 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1569.97 / 3.519
= 446.15 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.550 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4171.73 kN-m > 504.87 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.400 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3825.01 kN-m > 482.36 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.550 x 0.769
= 1.961 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001856 m²
= 1856 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09463 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.961/100
= 0.002353 m²
= 2353 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.550 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.400 x 0.757
= 1.817 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001803 m²
= 1803 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09923 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.817/100
= 0.002180 m²
= 2180 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.400 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.120 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.400 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.28 + (2.400 - 0.281) x ((367.81 - 349.28)/2.400)
= 365.64 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.550) x 366.72
= 261.26 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.550
= 1.961 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.961
= 0.12112
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 261.26 / 1.961
= 133.06 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.550 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.293 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.28 + (2.550 - 0.293) x ((367.81 - 349.28)/2.550)
= 365.68 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.293 x 2.400) x 366.74
= 250.09 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.400
= 1.817 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.817
= 0.12450
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 250.09 / 1.817
= 137.11 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.120 m²)
= 6.120 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.120/0.135) = 6.733 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1994.69/0.135
= 14775.49 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 126.23 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2120.92 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 16.24 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 180.34 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 126.23 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2120.92 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.97 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 169.74 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.400 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1000.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.550 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1000.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.400 x 2.550 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG60
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2764.57 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1843.05 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 184.30 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2027.35 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3041.02 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.22 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 8.02 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 3.32 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 12.03 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2027.35 / 250.00 = 8.109 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0012 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0044 m
= 0.004 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.924 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.774 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2027.35/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0012/2.924 )
= 8.129 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2027.35/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0044/2.774 )
= 8.186 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.800 x 2.950 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.260 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 245.44 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.5458 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 2.0809 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 248.07 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 242.82 kN/m²
UpMaxw(248.07 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL372.11364.23248.07242.82

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 368.16 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.8186 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 3.1213 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 372.10 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 364.22 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.800 - 0.300)/2
= 1.250 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.23 + (2.800 - 1.250) x ((372.11 - 364.23)/2.800)
= 368.59 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.250 x (368.59+ 372.11)/2
= 462.94 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.250 x (368.59 + 2 x 372.11)
               / (3 x (368.59 + 372.11))
= 0.626 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 462.94 x 0.626 x 2.950
= 849.83 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.950 - 0.450)/2
= 1.250 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 364.23 + (2.950 - 1.250) x ((372.11 - 364.23)/2.950)
= 368.77 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.250 x (368.77+ 372.11)/2
= 463.05 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.250 x (368.77 + 2 x 372.11) / (3 x (368.77 + 372.11))
= 0.626 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 463.05 x 0.626 x 2.800
= 810.26 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.969)
= 2.750 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.209 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2764.57 / 8.260) x (8.260 - (1.269 x 1.419))
= 2161.88 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2161.88 / 5.209
= 415.00 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.950 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 7658.78 kN-m > 849.83 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.800 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 7120.24 kN-m > 810.26 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.950 x 0.969
= 2.859 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002475 m²
= 2475 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08657 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.859/100
= 0.003430 m²
= 3430 mm²

Provide #12 - 31 nos.(3506 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.950 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(31 - 1)
= 0.095 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.800 x 0.957
= 2.680 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002390 m²
= 2390 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08921 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.680/100
= 0.003216 m²
= 3216 mm²

Provide #12 - 29 nos.(3280 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.800 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(29 - 1)
= 0.096 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.800 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.23 + (2.800 - 0.281) x ((372.11 - 364.23)/2.800)
= 371.32 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.950) x 371.71
= 306.42 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 2.950
= 2.859 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003506 x 100)/2.859
= 0.12265
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 306.42 / 2.859
= 107.08 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.950 - 0.450)/2 - 0.957
= 0.293 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.23 + (2.950 - 0.293) x ((372.11 - 364.23)/2.950)
= 371.33 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.293 x 2.800) x 371.72
= 299.55 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 2.800
= 2.680 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003280 x 100)/2.680
= 0.12240
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 299.55 / 2.680
= 111.44 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.020 m² > footing area(8.260 m²)
= 8.260 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.260/0.135) = 7.822 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2764.57/0.135
= 20478.28 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.128 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2764.57 - 2306.30)/361050.00
= 2758180.000 m²
= 2758180077568.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 211.66 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2976.23 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 8.89 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 242.88 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 211.66 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2976.23 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.29 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 230.53 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.800 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1200.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.950 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1200.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.800 x 2.950 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 31 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 29 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG61
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2029.58 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1353.05 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 135.31 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1488.36 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2232.53 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.15 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.39 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 3.23 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 2.08 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1488.36 / 250.00 = 5.953 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0016 m
= 0.002 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0010 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.516 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.366 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1488.36/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0016/2.516 )
= 5.976 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1488.36/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0010/2.366 )
= 5.969 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.375 x 2.525 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.997 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 248.19 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.8534 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.5837 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.63 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 246.75 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.63 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.44370.13249.63246.75

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 372.28 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.2801 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.8755 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 374.44 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 370.13 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 370.13 + (2.375 - 1.038) x ((374.44 - 370.13)/2.375)
= 372.56 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (372.56+ 374.44)/2
= 387.51 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (372.56 + 2 x 374.44)
               / (3 x (372.56 + 374.44))
= 0.519 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 387.51 x 0.519 x 2.525
= 507.15 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2
= 1.038 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 370.13 + (2.525 - 1.038) x ((374.44 - 370.13)/2.525)
= 372.67 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.038 x (372.67+ 374.44)/2
= 387.56 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.038 x (372.67 + 2 x 374.44) / (3 x (372.67 + 374.44))
= 0.519 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 387.56 x 0.519 x 2.375
= 476.68 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2029.58 / 5.997) x (5.997 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1588.55 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1588.55 / 3.519
= 451.43 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.525 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4130.83 kN-m > 507.15 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.375 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3785.17 kN-m > 476.68 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.525 x 0.769
= 1.942 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001865 m²
= 1865 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09603 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.942/100
= 0.002330 m²
= 2330 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.525 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.121 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.375 x 0.757
= 1.798 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001782 m²
= 1782 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09909 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.798/100
= 0.002157 m²
= 2157 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.375 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.375 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.269 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 370.13 + (2.375 - 0.269) x ((374.44 - 370.13)/2.375)
= 373.95 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.269 x 2.525) x 374.20
= 251.98 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.525
= 1.942 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.942
= 0.12232
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 251.98 / 1.942
= 129.60 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.525 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.281 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 370.13 + (2.525 - 0.281) x ((374.44 - 370.13)/2.525)
= 373.96 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.281 x 2.375) x 374.20
= 246.11 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.375
= 1.798 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.798
= 0.12581
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 246.11 / 1.798
= 136.35 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(5.997 m²)
= 5.997 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.997/0.135) = 6.665 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2029.58/0.135
= 15033.90 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2153.26 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.17 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 178.58 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 123.69 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2153.26 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.95 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 167.97 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.375 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.525 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 987.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.375 x 2.525 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG62
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2121.14 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1414.09 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 141.41 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1555.50 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2333.25 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 3.85 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.26 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 5.77 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 1.90 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1555.50 / 250.00 = 6.222 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0027 m
= 0.003 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0009 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.571 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.421 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1555.50/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0027/2.571 )
= 6.262 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1555.50/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0009/2.421 )
= 6.236 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.450 x 2.600 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.370 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 244.19 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.3933 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.4859 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.07 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 242.31 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.07 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.11363.47246.07242.32

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 366.29 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.0899 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.7289 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.11 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 363.47 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.450 - 0.300)/2
= 1.075 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.47 + (2.450 - 1.075) x ((369.11 - 363.47)/2.450)
= 366.64 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.075 x (366.64+ 369.11)/2
= 395.46 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.075 x (366.64 + 2 x 369.11)
               / (3 x (366.64 + 369.11))
= 0.538 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 395.46 x 0.538 x 2.600
= 552.50 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.600 - 0.450)/2
= 1.075 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 363.47 + (2.600 - 1.075) x ((369.11 - 363.47)/2.600)
= 366.78 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.075 x (366.78+ 369.11)/2
= 395.54 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.075 x (366.78 + 2 x 369.11) / (3 x (366.78 + 369.11))
= 0.538 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 395.54 x 0.538 x 2.450
= 519.28 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2121.14 / 6.370) x (6.370 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1687.22 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1687.22 / 3.519
= 479.47 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.600 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4253.53 kN-m > 552.50 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.450 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3904.70 kN-m > 519.28 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.600 x 0.769
= 1.999 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002034 m²
= 2034 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10172 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.999/100
= 0.002399 m²
= 2399 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.600 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.118 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.450 x 0.757
= 1.855 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001943 m²
= 1943 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10477 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.855/100
= 0.002226 m²
= 2226 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.450 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.123 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.450 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.306 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.47 + (2.450 - 0.306) x ((369.11 - 363.47)/2.450)
= 368.41 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.306 x 2.600) x 368.76
= 290.97 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.600
= 1.999 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/1.999
= 0.12444
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 290.97 / 1.999
= 145.34 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.600 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.318 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 363.47 + (2.600 - 0.318) x ((369.11 - 363.47)/2.600)
= 368.42 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.318 x 2.450) x 368.77
= 284.10 kN
