Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.450
= 1.855 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.855
= 0.12196
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 284.10 / 1.855
= 152.58 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.370 m²)
= 6.370 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.370/0.135) = 6.869 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2121.14/0.135
= 15712.14 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 131.38 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2252.52 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.02 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 183.88 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 131.38 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2252.52 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 3.42 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 173.27 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.450 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1025.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.600 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1025.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.450 x 2.600 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG63
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2092.98 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1395.32 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 139.53 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1534.85 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2302.27 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 0.76 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 1.02 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 1.14 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 1.53 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1534.85 / 250.00 = 6.139 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0005 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0007 m
= 0.001 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.554 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.404 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1534.85/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0005/2.554 )
= 6.147 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1534.85/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0007/2.404 )
= 6.151 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.425 x 2.575 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 6.244 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 245.80 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.2832 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.4037 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.48 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 245.11 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.48 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.73367.67246.48245.11

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 368.70 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.4248 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.6055 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.73 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 367.67 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.425 - 0.300)/2
= 1.063 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.67 + (2.425 - 1.063) x ((369.73 - 367.67)/2.425)
= 368.82 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.063 x (368.82+ 369.73)/2
= 392.36 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.063 x (368.82 + 2 x 369.73)
               / (3 x (368.82 + 369.73))
= 0.531 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 392.36 x 0.531 x 2.575
= 536.32 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.575 - 0.450)/2
= 1.063 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 367.67 + (2.575 - 1.063) x ((369.73 - 367.67)/2.575)
= 368.88 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.063 x (368.88+ 369.73)/2
= 392.38 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.063 x (368.88 + 2 x 369.73) / (3 x (368.88 + 369.73))
= 0.531 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 392.38 x 0.531 x 2.425
= 505.27 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2092.98 / 6.244) x (6.244 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1656.20 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1656.20 / 3.519
= 470.65 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.575 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4212.63 kN-m > 536.32 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.425 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3864.85 kN-m > 505.27 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.575 x 0.769
= 1.980 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001973 m²
= 1973 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09966 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.980/100
= 0.002376 m²
= 2376 mm²

Provide #12 - 22 nos.(2488 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.575 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(22 - 1)
= 0.117 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.425 x 0.757
= 1.836 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001890 m²
= 1890 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.10296 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.836/100
= 0.002203 m²
= 2203 mm²

Provide #12 - 20 nos.(2262 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.425 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(20 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.425 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.293 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.67 + (2.425 - 0.293) x ((369.73 - 367.67)/2.425)
= 369.48 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.293 x 2.575) x 369.60
= 278.10 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.575
= 1.980 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002488 x 100)/1.980
= 0.12565
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 278.10 / 1.980
= 140.26 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.575 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.306 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 367.67 + (2.575 - 0.306) x ((369.73 - 367.67)/2.575)
= 369.48 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.306 x 2.425) x 369.60
= 270.74 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.425
= 1.836 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002262 x 100)/1.836
= 0.12322
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 270.74 / 1.836
= 146.90 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(6.244 m²)
= 6.244 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(6.244/0.135) = 6.801 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2092.98/0.135
= 15503.53 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 128.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2221.77 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.72 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 182.11 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 128.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2221.77 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 1.05 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 171.50 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.425 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1012.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.575 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1012.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.425 x 2.575 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 22 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 20 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG64
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2474.40 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1649.60 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 164.96 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1814.56 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2721.84 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.52 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 2.64 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 3.78 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 3.96 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1814.56 / 250.00 = 7.258 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0015 m
= 0.002 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0016 m
= 0.002 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.770 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.620 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1814.56/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0015/2.770 )
= 7.282 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1814.56/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0016/2.620 )
= 7.285 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.650 x 2.800 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 7.420 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 244.55 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.7285 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.8051 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.08 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 243.02 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.09 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.13364.53246.09243.02

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 366.82 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.0927 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.2077 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.13 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 364.52 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.650 - 0.300)/2
= 1.175 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.53 + (2.650 - 1.175) x ((369.13 - 364.53)/2.650)
= 367.09 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.175 x (367.09+ 369.13)/2
= 432.53 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.175 x (367.09 + 2 x 369.13)
               / (3 x (367.09 + 369.13))
= 0.588 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 432.53 x 0.588 x 2.800
= 710.51 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.800 - 0.450)/2
= 1.175 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 364.53 + (2.800 - 1.175) x ((369.13 - 364.53)/2.800)
= 367.20 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.175 x (367.20+ 369.13)/2
= 432.59 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.175 x (367.20 + 2 x 369.13) / (3 x (367.20 + 369.13))
= 0.588 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 432.59 x 0.588 x 2.650
= 672.63 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.969)
= 2.750 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.209 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2474.40 / 7.420) x (7.420 - (1.269 x 1.419))
= 1873.90 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1873.90 / 5.209
= 359.72 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.800 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 7269.35 kN-m > 710.51 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.650 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 6738.80 kN-m > 672.63 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.800 x 0.969
= 2.713 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002064 m²
= 2064 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07609 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.713/100
= 0.003256 m²
= 3256 mm²

Provide #12 - 29 nos.(3280 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.800 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(29 - 1)
= 0.096 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.650 x 0.957
= 2.536 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001980 m²
= 1980 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07806 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.536/100
= 0.003043 m²
= 3043 mm²

Provide #12 - 27 nos.(3054 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.650 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(27 - 1)
= 0.098 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.650 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.206 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.53 + (2.650 - 0.206) x ((369.13 - 364.53)/2.650)
= 368.77 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.206 x 2.800) x 368.95
= 211.20 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 2.800
= 2.713 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003280 x 100)/2.713
= 0.12088
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 211.20 / 2.713
= 77.76 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.800 - 0.450)/2 - 0.957
= 0.218 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 364.53 + (2.800 - 0.218) x ((369.13 - 364.53)/2.800)
= 368.77 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.218 x 2.650) x 368.95
= 209.57 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 2.650
= 2.536 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003054 x 100)/2.536
= 0.12041
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 209.57 / 2.536
= 82.38 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.020 m² > footing area(7.420 m²)
= 7.420 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(7.420/0.135) = 7.414 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2474.40/0.135
= 18328.89 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.129 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2474.40 - 2323.97)/361050.00
               < 0.5 % of A2 = (0.5/100) x 0.135
= 2467963.500 m²
= 2467963600896.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 190.14 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2664.54 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 3.53 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 230.53 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 190.14 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2664.54 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.83 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 218.18 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.650 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1125.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.800 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1125.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.650 x 2.800 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 29 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 27 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG65
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1669.92 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1113.28 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 111.33 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1224.61 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1836.91 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.16 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 11.23 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 3.25 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 16.85 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1224.61 / 250.00 = 4.898 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0019 m
= 0.002 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0101 m
= 0.010 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.290 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.140 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1224.61/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0019/2.290 )
= 4.923 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1224.61/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0101/2.140 )
= 5.037 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.175 x 2.325 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.057 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 242.17 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.1044 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.1274 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.40 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 234.93 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.43 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.14352.44249.43234.96

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 363.25 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.6566 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 9.1911 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 374.10 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 352.40 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.175 - 0.300)/2
= 0.938 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.44 + (2.175 - 0.938) x ((374.14 - 352.44)/2.175)
= 364.79 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.938 x (364.79+ 374.14)/2
= 346.37 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.938 x (364.79 + 2 x 374.14)
               / (3 x (364.79 + 374.14))
= 0.471 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 346.37 x 0.471 x 2.325
= 372.35 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.325 - 0.450)/2
= 0.938 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 352.44 + (2.325 - 0.938) x ((374.14 - 352.44)/2.325)
= 365.39 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.938 x (365.39+ 374.14)/2
= 346.65 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.938 x (365.39 + 2 x 374.14) / (3 x (365.39 + 374.14))
= 0.471 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 346.65 x 0.471 x 2.175
= 353.62 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.620 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.609 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.620 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.620 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.620 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.620)
= 1.141 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.620 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.620)
= 1.327 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.468 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1669.92 / 5.057) x (5.057 - (0.920 x 1.070))
= 1344.84 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1344.84 / 2.468
= 545.00 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.325 x 0.620 x 0.620
= 2466.04 kN-m > 372.35 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.175 x 0.609 x 0.609
= 2233.13 kN-m > 353.62 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.325 x 0.620
= 1.442 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001706 m²
= 1706 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11836 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.442/100
= 0.001730 m²
= 1730 mm²

Provide #10 - 23 nos.(1806 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.325 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(23 - 1)
= 0.101 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.175 x 0.609
= 1.325 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001652 m²
= 1652 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.12470 %

Provide #12 - 16 nos.(1810 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.175 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(16 - 1)
= 0.138 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.175 - 0.300)/2 - 0.620
= 0.317 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.44 + (2.175 - 0.317) x ((374.14 - 352.44)/2.175)
= 370.97 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.317 x 2.325) x 372.56
= 273.94 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.620 x 2.325
= 1.442 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001806 x 100)/1.442
= 0.12531
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 273.94 / 1.442
= 190.04 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.325 - 0.450)/2 - 0.609
= 0.329 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.44 + (2.325 - 0.329) x ((374.14 - 352.44)/2.325)
= 371.07 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.329 x 2.175) x 372.61
= 259.76 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.609 x 2.175
= 1.325 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001810 x 100)/1.325
= 0.13661
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 259.76 / 1.325
= 195.79 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(5.057 m²)
= 5.057 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.057/0.135) = 6.120 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1669.92/0.135
= 12369.75 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 85.33 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1755.25 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 12.55 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 140.89 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 85.33 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1755.25 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 2.31 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 131.80 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.175 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 887.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.325 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 887.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(620.000 / 609.000) + 300.000
= 909.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(620.000 / 609.000)
= 609 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.175 x 2.325 x 0.675 m
Provide #10 - 23 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 16 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG66
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2301.10 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1534.07 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 153.41 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1687.48 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2531.22 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 2.41 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 20.14 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 3.62 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 30.21 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1687.48 / 250.00 = 6.750 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0016 m
= 0.002 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0131 m
= 0.013 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.674 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.524 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1687.48/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0016/2.674 )
= 6.774 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1687.48/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0131/2.524 )
= 6.961 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.575 x 2.725 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 7.017 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 240.49 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.7564 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 6.6874 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.93 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 233.04 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.95 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.93349.60247.95233.07

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 360.73 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.1346 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 10.0311 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.90 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 349.57 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.575 - 0.300)/2
= 1.138 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.60 + (2.575 - 1.138) x ((371.93 - 349.60)/2.575)
= 362.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.138 x (362.07+ 371.93)/2
= 417.46 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.138 x (362.07 + 2 x 371.93)
               / (3 x (362.07 + 371.93))
= 0.571 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 417.46 x 0.571 x 2.725
= 637.36 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.725 - 0.450)/2
= 1.137 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 349.60 + (2.725 - 1.137) x ((371.93 - 349.60)/2.725)
= 362.61 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.137 x (362.61+ 371.93)/2
= 417.77 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.137 x (362.61 + 2 x 371.93) / (3 x (362.61 + 371.93))
= 0.571 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 417.77 x 0.571 x 2.575
= 613.01 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.969)
= 2.750 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.209 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2301.10 / 7.017) x (7.017 - (1.269 x 1.419))
= 1710.58 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1710.58 / 5.209
= 328.37 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.725 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 7074.64 kN-m > 637.36 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.575 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 6548.08 kN-m > 613.01 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.725 x 0.969
= 2.641 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001850 m²
= 1850 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07005 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.641/100
= 0.003169 m²
= 3169 mm²

Provide #12 - 29 nos.(3280 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.725 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(29 - 1)
= 0.093 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.575 x 0.957
= 2.464 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001802 m²
= 1802 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07314 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 2.464/100
= 0.002957 m²
= 2957 mm²

Provide #12 - 27 nos.(3054 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.575 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(27 - 1)
= 0.095 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.575 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.169 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.60 + (2.575 - 0.169) x ((371.93 - 349.60)/2.575)
= 370.47 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.169 x 2.725) x 371.20
= 168.93 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 2.725
= 2.641 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003280 x 100)/2.641
= 0.12421
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 168.93 / 2.641
= 63.91 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.725 - 0.450)/2 - 0.957
= 0.181 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 349.60 + (2.725 - 0.181) x ((371.93 - 349.60)/2.725)
= 370.45 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.181 x 2.575) x 371.19
= 165.36 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 2.575
= 2.464 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003054 x 100)/2.464
= 0.12392
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 165.36 / 2.464
= 66.89 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.020 m² > footing area(7.017 m²)
= 7.017 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(7.017/0.135) = 7.209 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2301.10/0.135
= 17045.22 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 179.81 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2480.91 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 23.77 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 224.36 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 179.81 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2480.91 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 3.69 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 212.01 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.575 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1087.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.725 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1087.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.575 x 2.725 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 29 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 27 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG67
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.600 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 4064.54 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2709.70 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 270.97 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2980.66 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 4471.00 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 15.52 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 7.08 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 23.28 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 10.62 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2980.66 / 250.00 = 11.923 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0057 m
= 0.006 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0026 m
= 0.003 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.606 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.306 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2980.66/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0057/3.606 )
= 12.036 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2980.66/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0026/3.306 )
= 11.979 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.350 x 3.650 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 12.228 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 243.77 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.0865 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.0375 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.89 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 240.64 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.90 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.35360.98246.90240.65

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 365.65 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.1298 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.5563 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.34 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 360.96 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.350 - 0.300)/2
= 1.525 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.98 + (3.350 - 1.525) x ((370.35 - 360.98)/3.350)
= 366.08 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.525 x (366.08+ 370.35)/2
= 561.53 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.525 x (366.08 + 2 x 370.35)
               / (3 x (366.08 + 370.35))
= 0.764 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 561.53 x 0.764 x 3.650
= 1561.17 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.650 - 0.600)/2
= 1.525 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 360.98 + (3.650 - 1.525) x ((370.35 - 360.98)/3.650)
= 366.43 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.525 x (366.43+ 370.35)/2
= 561.80 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.525 x (366.43 + 2 x 370.35) / (3 x (366.43 + 370.35))
= 0.764 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 561.80 x 0.764 x 3.350
= 1428.74 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.600 + 1.219)
= 4.435 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 8.138 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (4064.54 / 12.228) x (12.228 - (1.519 x 1.819))
= 3146.07 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 3146.07 / 8.138
= 386.59 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.600 = 0.500
ks = 0.5 + 0.500 = 1.000 = 1.000
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.650 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 14990.18 kN-m > 1561.17 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.350 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 13533.49 kN-m > 1428.74 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.650 x 1.219
= 4.449 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.003610 m²
= 3610 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08113 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 4.449/100
= 0.005339 m²
= 5339 mm²

Provide #12 - 48 nos.(5429 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.650 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(48 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.350 x 1.207
= 4.043 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.003337 m²
= 3337 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.08254 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 4.043/100
= 0.004852 m²
= 4852 mm²

Provide #12 - 44 nos.(4976 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.350 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(44 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.350 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.306 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.98 + (3.350 - 0.306) x ((370.35 - 360.98)/3.350)
= 369.49 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.306 x 3.650) x 369.92
= 408.64 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.650
= 4.449 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.005429 x 100)/4.449
= 0.12201
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 408.64 / 4.449
= 91.77 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.650 - 0.600)/2 - 1.207
= 0.318 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.98 + (3.650 - 0.318) x ((370.35 - 360.98)/3.650)
= 369.53 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.318 x 3.350) x 369.94
= 388.87 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 3.350
= 4.043 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004976 x 100)/4.043
= 0.12307
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 388.87 / 4.043
= 95.93 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.600 + (4 x 1.275))
= 30.780 m² > footing area(12.228 m²)
= 12.228 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.180 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(12.228/0.180) = 8.242 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 4064.54/0.180
= 22580.79 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.169 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (4064.54 - 3037.33)/361050.00
= 4056130.000 m²
= 4056129994752.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 389.75 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 4454.29 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 7.80 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 342.40 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 389.75 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 4454.29 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 18.60 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 314.26 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.350 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1475.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.650 - 0.600) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1475.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.350 x 3.650 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 48 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 44 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG68
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3513.33 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2342.22 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 234.22 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2576.44 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3864.66 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 11.06 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.52 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 16.59 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.78 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2576.44 / 250.00 = 10.306 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0047 m
= 0.005 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0002 m
= 0.000 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.286 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.136 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2576.44/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0047/3.286 )
= 10.395 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2576.44/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0002/3.136 )
= 10.310 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.150 x 3.300 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 10.395 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 247.85 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 1.9350 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.0950 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.88 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 245.82 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.88 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.83368.74249.88245.82

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 371.78 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.9026 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.1425 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 374.83 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 368.74 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.150 - 0.300)/2
= 1.425 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 368.74 + (3.150 - 1.425) x ((374.83 - 368.74)/3.150)
= 372.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.425 x (372.07+ 374.83)/2
= 532.17 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.425 x (372.07 + 2 x 374.83)
               / (3 x (372.07 + 374.83))
= 0.713 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 532.17 x 0.713 x 3.300
= 1252.46 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.300 - 0.450)/2
= 1.425 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 368.74 + (3.300 - 1.425) x ((374.83 - 368.74)/3.300)
= 372.20 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.425 x (372.20+ 374.83)/2
= 532.25 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.425 x (372.20 + 2 x 374.83) / (3 x (372.20 + 374.83))
= 0.713 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 532.25 x 0.713 x 3.150
= 1189.37 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.650 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.594 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.582 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.594 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.594 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.594 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.594 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.594)
= 6.038 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.594 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.594)
= 6.516 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 12.554 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3513.33 / 10.395) x (10.395 - (1.894 x 2.044))
= 2204.89 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2204.89 / 12.554
= 175.63 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.650 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.300 x 1.594 x 1.594
= 23164.85 kN-m > 1252.46 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.150 x 1.582 x 1.582
= 21835.51 kN-m > 1189.37 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.300 x 1.594
= 5.260 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002196 m²
= 2196 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.04175 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 5.260/100
= 0.006312 m²
= 6312 mm²

Provide #12 - 56 nos.(6333 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.300 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(56 - 1)
= 0.058 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.150 x 1.582
= 4.983 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002102 m²
= 2102 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.04218 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 4.983/100
= 0.005980 m²
= 5980 mm²

Provide #12 - 53 nos.(5994 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.150 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(53 - 1)
= 0.058 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.150 - 0.300)/2 - 1.594
= -0.169 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.300 - 0.450)/2 - 1.582
= -0.157 m

As the critical section for one way shear falls outside
the footing,oneway shear check is not required to be taken in this direction.

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.650)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.650))
= 48.645 m² > footing area(10.395 m²)
= 10.395 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(10.395/0.135) = 8.775 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3513.33/0.135
= 26024.66 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.125 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3513.33 - 2249.04)/361050.00
= 3507100.500 m²
= 3507100581888.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 428.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3942.12 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.13 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 345.49 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 428.79 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3942.12 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 13.53 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 329.78 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.150 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1375.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.300 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1375.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 40 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (40 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1880 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1594.000 / 1582.000) + 300.000
= 1882.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 40 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (40 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1504 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1594.000 / 1582.000)
= 1582 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.150 x 3.300 x 1.650 m
Provide #12 - 56 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 53 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG69
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.600 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3754.29 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2502.86 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 250.29 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2753.14 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 4129.72 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 3.26 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 4.06 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 4.90 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 6.09 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2753.14 / 250.00 = 11.013 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0013 m
= 0.001 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0016 m
= 0.002 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.472 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.172 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2753.14/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0013/3.472 )
= 11.037 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2753.14/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0016/3.172 )
= 11.046 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.200 x 3.500 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 11.200 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 245.82 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.4996 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.6802 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.00 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 244.64 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.00 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL370.50366.96247.00244.64

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 368.72 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 0.7494 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.0204 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 370.49 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 366.95 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.200 - 0.300)/2
= 1.450 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.96 + (3.200 - 1.450) x ((370.50 - 366.96)/3.200)
= 368.89 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.450 x (368.89+ 370.50)/2
= 536.06 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.450 x (368.89 + 2 x 370.50)
               / (3 x (368.89 + 370.50))
= 0.726 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 536.06 x 0.726 x 3.500
= 1358.60 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.500 - 0.600)/2
= 1.450 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 366.96 + (3.500 - 1.450) x ((370.50 - 366.96)/3.500)
= 369.03 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.450 x (369.03+ 370.50)/2
= 536.16 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.450 x (369.03 + 2 x 370.50) / (3 x (369.03 + 370.50))
= 0.725 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 536.16 x 0.725 x 3.200
= 1242.87 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.600 + 0.969)
= 3.041 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.500 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3754.29 / 11.200) x (11.200 - (1.269 x 1.569))
= 3086.87 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 3086.87 / 5.500
= 561.25 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.600 = 0.500
ks = 0.5 + 0.500 = 1.000 = 1.000
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.500 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 9086.69 kN-m > 1358.60 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.200 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 8137.42 kN-m > 1242.87 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.500 x 0.969
= 3.391 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.003982 m²
= 3982 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.11742 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
