= 0.120 x 3.391/100
= 0.004070 m²
= 4070 mm²

Provide #12 - 37 nos.(4185 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.500 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(37 - 1)
= 0.094 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.200 x 0.957
= 3.062 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.003691 m²
= 3691 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.12053 %

Provide #12 - 35 nos.(3958 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.200 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(35 - 1)
= 0.091 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.200 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.481 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.96 + (3.200 - 0.481) x ((370.50 - 366.96)/3.200)
= 369.96 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.481 x 3.500) x 370.23
= 620.91 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 3.500
= 3.391 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004185 x 100)/3.391
= 0.12338
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 620.91 / 3.391
= 182.89 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.500 - 0.600)/2 - 0.957
= 0.493 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 366.96 + (3.500 - 0.493) x ((370.50 - 366.96)/3.500)
= 370.00 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.493 x 3.200) x 370.25
= 579.17 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 3.200
= 3.062 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.003958 x 100)/3.062
= 0.12926
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 579.17 / 3.062
= 188.53 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.600 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.680 m² > footing area(11.200 m²)
= 11.200 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.180 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(11.200/0.180) = 7.888 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3754.29/0.180
= 20857.15 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.170 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3754.29 - 3063.29)/361050.00
= 3745802.250 m²
= 3745802354688.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 287.00 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 4041.29 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 4.22 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 288.17 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 287.00 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 4041.29 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 4.57 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 263.47 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.200 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1400.000 mm
In Y direction= (3.500 - 0.600) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1400.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.200 x 3.500 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 37 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 35 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG70
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1850.52 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1233.68 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 123.37 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1357.04 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2035.57 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 5.34 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 6.97 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 8.01 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 10.45 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1357.04 / 250.00 = 5.428 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0043 m
= 0.004 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0056 m
= 0.006 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.406 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.256 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1357.04/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0043/2.406 )
= 5.487 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1357.04/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0056/2.256 )
= 5.510 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.300 x 2.450 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.635 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 240.82 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.3200 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 3.2262 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 246.37 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 235.28 kN/m²
UpMaxw(246.40 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL369.60352.96246.40235.31

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 361.24 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.4800 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 4.8393 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 369.56 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 352.92 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.300 - 0.300)/2
= 1.000 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.96 + (2.300 - 1.000) x ((369.60 - 352.96)/2.300)
= 362.37 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.000 x (362.37+ 369.60)/2
= 365.99 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.000 x (362.37 + 2 x 369.60)
               / (3 x (362.37 + 369.60))
= 0.502 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 365.99 x 0.502 x 2.450
= 445.54 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.450 - 0.450)/2
= 1.000 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 352.96 + (2.450 - 1.000) x ((369.60 - 352.96)/2.450)
= 362.81 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.000 x (362.81+ 369.60)/2
= 366.21 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.000 x (362.81 + 2 x 369.60) / (3 x (362.81 + 369.60))
= 0.502 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 366.21 x 0.502 x 2.300
= 419.47 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.675 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.619 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.607 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.619 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.619 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.619 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.619)
= 1.138 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.619 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.619)
= 1.323 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 2.461 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1850.52 / 5.635) x (5.635 - (0.919 x 1.069))
= 1527.90 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1527.90 / 2.461
= 620.81 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.675 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.450 x 0.619 x 0.619
= 2598.63 kN-m > 445.54 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.300 x 0.607 x 0.607
= 2361.47 kN-m > 419.47 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.450 x 0.619
= 1.517 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002052 m²
= 2052 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.13532 %

Provide #12 - 19 nos.(2149 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.450 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(19 - 1)
= 0.130 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.300 x 0.607
= 1.396 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001973 m²
= 1973 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.14131 %

Provide #12 - 19 nos.(2149 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.300 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(19 - 1)
= 0.122 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.300 - 0.300)/2 - 0.619
= 0.381 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.96 + (2.300 - 0.381) x ((369.60 - 352.96)/2.300)
= 366.85 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.381 x 2.450) x 368.22
= 340.07 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.619 x 2.450
= 1.517 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002149 x 100)/1.517
= 0.14169
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 340.07 / 1.517
= 223.88 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.450 - 0.450)/2 - 0.607
= 0.393 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 352.96 + (2.450 - 0.393) x ((369.60 - 352.96)/2.450)
= 366.93 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.393 x 2.300) x 368.27
= 326.65 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.607 x 2.300
= 1.396 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002149 x 100)/1.396
= 0.15392
Permissible shear stress = 290.18 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 326.65 / 1.396
= 232.83 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(290.18 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.675)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.675))
= 9.450 m² > footing area(5.635 m²)
= 5.635 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.635/0.135) = 6.461 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1850.52/0.135
= 13707.52 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 95.09 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1945.61 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 7.57 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 148.47 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 95.09 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1945.61 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 6.50 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 139.38 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.300 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 950.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.450 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 950.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 752 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(619.000 / 607.000) + 300.000
= 907.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 16 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (16 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 602 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(619.000 / 607.000)
= 607 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.300 x 2.450 x 0.675 m
Provide #12 - 19 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 19 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG71
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1903.55 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1269.03 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 126.90 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 1395.94 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 2093.90 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 10.57 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 16.36 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 15.86 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 24.54 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 1395.94 / 250.00 = 5.584 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0083 m
= 0.008 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0129 m
= 0.013 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.439 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.289 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (1395.94/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0083/2.439 )
= 5.698 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (1395.94/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0129/2.289 )
= 5.772 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.350 x 2.500 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 5.875 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 237.61 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 4.3185 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 7.1112 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.04 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 226.18 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.17 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL373.75339.46249.17226.31

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 356.41 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 6.4778 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 10.6668 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 373.55 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 339.26 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.350 - 0.300)/2
= 1.025 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 339.46 + (2.350 - 1.025) x ((373.75 - 339.46)/2.350)
= 358.79 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.025 x (358.79+ 373.75)/2
= 375.43 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.025 x (358.79 + 2 x 373.75)
               / (3 x (358.79 + 373.75))
= 0.516 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 375.43 x 0.516 x 2.500
= 474.10 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.500 - 0.450)/2
= 1.025 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 339.46 + (2.500 - 1.025) x ((373.75 - 339.46)/2.500)
= 359.69 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.025 x (359.69+ 373.75)/2
= 375.89 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.025 x (359.69 + 2 x 373.75) / (3 x (359.69 + 373.75))
= 0.516 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 375.89 x 0.516 x 2.350
= 449.55 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.825 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.769 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.757 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.769 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.769 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.769 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.769)
= 1.644 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.769 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.769)
= 1.875 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 3.519 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1903.55 / 5.875) x (5.875 - (1.069 x 1.219))
= 1481.33 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1481.33 / 3.519
= 420.96 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.825 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.500 x 0.769 x 0.769
= 4089.93 kN-m > 474.10 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.350 x 0.757 x 0.757
= 3745.32 kN-m > 449.55 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.500 x 0.769
= 1.923 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001741 m²
= 1741 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09057 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.923/100
= 0.002307 m²
= 2307 mm²

Provide #12 - 21 nos.(2375 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.500 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(21 - 1)
= 0.119 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.350 x 0.757
= 1.779 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001678 m²
= 1678 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.09435 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 1.779/100
= 0.002135 m²
= 2135 mm²

Provide #12 - 19 nos.(2149 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.350 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(19 - 1)
= 0.124 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.350 - 0.300)/2 - 0.769
= 0.256 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 339.46 + (2.350 - 0.256) x ((373.75 - 339.46)/2.350)
= 370.01 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.256 x 2.500) x 371.88
= 233.27 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.769 x 2.500
= 1.923 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002375 x 100)/1.923
= 0.12354
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 233.27 / 1.923
= 121.18 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.500 - 0.450)/2 - 0.757
= 0.268 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 339.46 + (2.500 - 0.268) x ((373.75 - 339.46)/2.500)
= 370.07 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.268 x 2.350) x 371.91
= 225.56 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.757 x 2.350
= 1.779 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.002149 x 100)/1.779
= 0.12079
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 225.56 / 1.779
= 126.29 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.825)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.825))
= 13.500 m² > footing area(5.875 m²)
= 5.875 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(5.875/0.135) = 6.597 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1903.55/0.135
= 14100.37 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 121.17 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2024.72 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 19.48 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 176.81 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 121.17 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 2024.72 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 11.48 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 166.20 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.350 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 975.000 mm
In Y direction= (2.500 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 975.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 940 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(769.000 / 757.000) + 300.000
= 1057.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 20 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (20 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 752 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(769.000 / 757.000)
= 757 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.350 x 2.500 x 0.825 m
Provide #12 - 21 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 19 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG72
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.600 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3889.92 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2593.28 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 259.33 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2852.61 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 4278.91 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 21.46 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 6.19 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 32.19 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 9.29 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2852.61 / 250.00 = 11.410 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0083 m
= 0.008 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0024 m
= 0.002 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.531 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.231 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2852.61/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0083/3.531 )
= 11.571 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2852.61/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0024/3.231 )
= 11.461 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.275 x 3.575 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 11.708 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 243.64 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 3.0758 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.9689 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.69 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 239.60 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.70 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.55359.42247.70239.61

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 365.46 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 4.6136 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.4533 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.53 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 359.40 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.275 - 0.300)/2
= 1.488 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 359.42 + (3.275 - 1.488) x ((371.55 - 359.42)/3.275)
= 366.04 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.488 x (366.04+ 371.55)/2
= 548.58 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.488 x (366.04 + 2 x 371.55)
               / (3 x (366.04 + 371.55))
= 0.746 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 548.58 x 0.746 x 3.575
= 1458.18 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.575 - 0.600)/2
= 1.487 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 359.42 + (3.575 - 1.487) x ((371.55 - 359.42)/3.575)
= 366.50 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.487 x (366.50+ 371.55)/2
= 548.93 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.487 x (366.50 + 2 x 371.55) / (3 x (366.50 + 371.55))
= 0.745 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 548.93 x 0.745 x 3.275
= 1327.97 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.025 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.969 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.957 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.969 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.969 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.969 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.969)
= 2.459 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.969 x 2 x (0.600 + 0.969)
= 3.041 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 5.500 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3889.92 / 11.708) x (11.708 - (1.269 x 1.569))
= 3228.41 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 3228.41 / 5.500
= 586.98 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.600 = 0.500
ks = 0.5 + 0.500 = 1.000 = 1.000
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.025 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.575 x 0.969 x 0.969
= 9281.41 kN-m > 1458.18 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.275 x 0.957 x 0.957
= 8328.14 kN-m > 1327.97 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.575 x 0.969
= 3.464 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.004280 m²
= 4280 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.12354 %

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.575 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.089 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.275 x 0.957
= 3.134 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.003948 m²
= 3948 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.12598 %

Provide #12 - 37 nos.(4185 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.275 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(37 - 1)
= 0.088 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.275 - 0.300)/2 - 0.969
= 0.519 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 359.42 + (3.275 - 0.519) x ((371.55 - 359.42)/3.275)
= 369.63 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.519 x 3.575) x 370.59
= 678.40 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.969 x 3.575
= 3.464 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.464
= 0.13059
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 678.40 / 3.464
= 195.63 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.575 - 0.600)/2 - 0.957
= 0.531 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 359.42 + (3.575 - 0.531) x ((371.55 - 359.42)/3.575)
= 369.75 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.531 x 3.275) x 370.65
= 638.16 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.957 x 3.275
= 3.134 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004185 x 100)/3.134
= 0.13352
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 638.16 / 3.134
= 202.98 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.025)) x
               (0.600 + (4 x 1.025))
= 20.680 m² > footing area(11.708 m²)
= 11.708 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.180 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(11.708/0.180) = 8.065 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3889.92/0.180
= 21610.65 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.170 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3889.92 - 3063.29)/361050.00
= 3881432.500 m²
= 3881432514560.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 300.02 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 4189.94 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 6.67 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 294.34 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 300.02 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 4189.94 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 24.63 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 269.64 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.275 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1437.500 mm
In Y direction= (3.575 - 0.600) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1437.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1175 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(969.000 / 957.000) + 300.000
= 1257.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 25 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (25 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 940 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(969.000 / 957.000)
= 957 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.275 x 3.575 x 1.025 m
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 37 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG73
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 3499.16 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 2332.77 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 233.28 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2566.05 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3849.07 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 16.81 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 0.04 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 25.22 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 0.06 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2566.05 / 250.00 = 10.264 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0072 m
= 0.007 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0000 m
= 0.000 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.280 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 3.130 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2566.05/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0072/3.280 )
= 10.400 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2566.05/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0000/3.130 )
= 10.265 m²
Size,(L x B) = 3.175 x 3.325 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 10.557 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 243.07 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 2.8740 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 0.0072 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 245.95 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 240.19 kN/m²
UpMaxw(245.95 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL368.93360.28245.95240.19

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 364.60 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 4.3110 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 0.0109 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 368.93 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 360.28 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (3.175 - 0.300)/2
= 1.438 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.28 + (3.175 - 1.438) x ((368.93 - 360.28)/3.175)
= 365.01 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.438 x (365.01+ 368.93)/2
= 527.52 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.438 x (365.01 + 2 x 368.93)
               / (3 x (365.01 + 368.93))
= 0.720 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 527.52 x 0.720 x 3.325
= 1262.90 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.325 - 0.450)/2
= 1.438 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 360.28 + (3.325 - 1.438) x ((368.93 - 360.28)/3.325)
= 365.19 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.438 x (365.19+ 368.93)/2
= 527.64 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.438 x (365.19 + 2 x 368.93) / (3 x (365.19 + 368.93))
= 0.720 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 527.64 x 0.720 x 3.175
= 1196.08 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (3499.16 / 10.557) x (10.557 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2658.84 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2658.84 / 7.772
= 342.09 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.325 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 13655.44 kN-m > 1262.90 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 3.175 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 12826.52 kN-m > 1196.08 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.325 x 1.219
= 4.053 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002914 m²
= 2914 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07190 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 4.053/100
= 0.004864 m²
= 4864 mm²

Provide #12 - 44 nos.(4976 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.325 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(44 - 1)
= 0.075 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 3.175 x 1.207
= 3.832 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002788 m²
= 2788 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.07275 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.832/100
= 0.004599 m²
= 4599 mm²

Provide #12 - 41 nos.(4637 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.175 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(41 - 1)
= 0.077 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (3.175 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.218 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.28 + (3.175 - 0.218) x ((368.93 - 360.28)/3.175)
= 368.33 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.218 x 3.325) x 368.63
= 263.68 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.325
= 4.053 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004976 x 100)/4.053
= 0.12277
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 263.68 / 4.053
= 65.00 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.325 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.231 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 360.28 + (3.325 - 0.231) x ((368.93 - 360.28)/3.325)
= 368.33 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.231 x 3.175) x 368.63
= 266.26 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 3.175
= 3.832 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004637 x 100)/3.832
= 0.12100
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 266.26 / 3.832
= 69.31 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(10.557 m²)
= 10.557 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(10.557/0.135) = 8.843 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 3499.16/0.135
= 25919.67 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.125 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (3499.16 - 2256.28)/361050.00
= 3492905.750 m²
= 3492905746432.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 336.50 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3835.66 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 0.52 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 311.91 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 336.50 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3835.66 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 19.08 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 297.84 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (3.175 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1387.500 mm
In Y direction= (3.325 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1387.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
3.175 x 3.325 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 44 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 41 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG74
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 2964.67 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 1976.45 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 197.64 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 2174.09 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 3261.14 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 19.86 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 5.84 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 29.79 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 8.76 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 2174.09 / 250.00 = 8.696 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0100 m
= 0.010 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0030 m
= 0.003 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 3.025 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 2.875 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (2174.09/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0100/3.025 )
= 8.870 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (2174.09/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0030/2.875 )
= 8.750 m²
Size,(L x B) = 2.925 x 3.075 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 8.994 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 241.72 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 4.3084 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 1.3326 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 247.36 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 236.08 kN/m²
UpMaxw(247.38 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL371.07354.15247.38236.10

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 362.58 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 6.4626 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 1.9989 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 371.04 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 354.11 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (2.925 - 0.300)/2
= 1.313 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 354.15 + (2.925 - 1.313) x ((371.07 - 354.15)/2.925)
= 363.48 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.313 x (363.48+ 371.07)/2
= 482.05 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.313 x (363.48 + 2 x 371.07)
               / (3 x (363.48 + 371.07))
= 0.659 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 482.05 x 0.659 x 3.075
= 972.31 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (3.075 - 0.450)/2
= 1.313 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 354.15 + (3.075 - 1.313) x ((371.07 - 354.15)/3.075)
= 363.85 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 1.313 x (363.85+ 371.07)/2
= 482.29 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 1.313 x (363.85 + 2 x 371.07) / (3 x (363.85 + 371.07))
= 0.658 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 482.29 x 0.658 x 2.925
= 917.07 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 1.275 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 1.219 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 1.207 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 1.219 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 1.219 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 1.219 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.300 + 1.219)
= 3.703 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 1.219 x 2 x (0.450 + 1.219)
= 4.069 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 7.772 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (2964.67 / 8.994) x (8.994 - (1.519 x 1.669))
= 2129.03 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 2129.03 / 7.772
= 273.92 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 1.275 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 3.075 x 1.219 x 1.219
= 12628.71 kN-m > 972.31 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 2.925 x 1.207 x 1.207
= 11816.56 kN-m > 917.07 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 3.075 x 1.219
= 3.748 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002238 m²
= 2238 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.05971 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Astx) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.748/100
= 0.004498 m²
= 4498 mm²

Provide #12 - 40 nos.(4524 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (3.075 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(40 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 2.925 x 1.207
= 3.530 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.002132 m²
= 2132 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.06039 %
               < minimum steel pt.(min-pt = 0.120 %)
Required steel area,(Asty) = min-pt x C/Sarea/100
= 0.120 x 3.530/100
= 0.004237 m²
= 4237 mm²

Provide #12 - 38 nos.(4298 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.925 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(38 - 1)
= 0.076 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (2.925 - 0.300)/2 - 1.219
= 0.093 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 354.15 + (2.925 - 0.093) x ((371.07 - 354.15)/2.925)
= 370.53 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.093 x 3.075) x 370.80
= 103.68 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 1.219 x 3.075
= 3.748 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004524 x 100)/3.748
= 0.12069
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 103.68 / 3.748
= 27.64 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (3.075 - 0.450)/2 - 1.207
= 0.106 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 354.15 + (3.075 - 0.106) x ((371.07 - 354.15)/3.075)
= 370.49 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.106 x 2.925) x 370.78
= 110.58 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 1.207 x 2.925
= 3.530 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.004298 x 100)/3.530
= 0.12173
Permissible shear stress = 287.51 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 110.58 / 3.530
= 31.24 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(287.51 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 1.275)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 1.275))
= 29.970 m² > footing area(8.994 m²)
= 8.994 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(8.994/0.135) = 8.162 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 2964.67/0.135
= 21960.52 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress Permissible bearing strees.
               Provide extra steel.
Area of concrete,(Ac), = 0.127 m²
Extra steel for bearing(Astex) = P - (Ac x StressPer)/(0.87xfy)
= (2964.67 - 2285.24)/361050.00
= 2958341.000 m²
= 2958340915200.000 m²

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 286.70 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3251.37 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 6.19 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 288.46 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 286.70 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 3251.37 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 22.44 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 274.39 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (2.925 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1262.500 mm
In Y direction= (3.075 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 1262.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 1504 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000) + 300.000
= 1507.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 32 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (32 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 1204 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(1219.000 / 1207.000)
= 1207 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
2.925 x 3.075 x 1.275 m
Provide #12 - 40 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #12 - 38 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)

Design of FG75
Size of col./ ped,(b x l) = 0.300 x 0.450 m
SBC of soil = 250.00 kN/m²
fck = 20.00 N/mm²
fy = 415.00 N/mm²
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL

Loads On Footing
Factored axial load on column,(P) = 1284.26 kN
Working axial load on column,(Pw) = 856.17 kN (From analysis results)
Self Weight of footing assumed (Sw) = 10.00 % of Pw = 85.62 kN
Total Working load,(P1) = (Pw)+ (Sw) = 941.79 kN
Total Ultimate load,(Pu1) = (P)+ 1.5 x (Sw) = 1412.69 kN
BM @ x-x,(WMx) = 13.88 kN-m
BM @ y-y,(WMy) = 5.04 kN-m
Factored BM @ x-x,(Mx) = 20.82 kN-m
Factored BM @ y-y,(My) = 7.56 kN-m

In Loadcombination with DL load case :
If load factor for DL loadcase is less than 1.0,this factor will be retained while computing the working load.

Footing Area
Area for axial load,(Af) = P1/SBC = 941.79 / 250.00 = 3.767 m²
Eccentricity @ x-x,(ex) = WMx/Pw = 0.0162 m
= 0.016 m
Eccentricity @ y-y,(ey) = WMy/Pw = 0.0059 m
= 0.006 m
Footing sizeY,(B) = (0.5 x (b-l))
               + (Ö((((0.5 x (b-l)) x (0.5 x (b-l)))+Af)))
= 2.017 m
Footing sizeX,(L) = Af/B = 1.867 m
Modified area for Mx,(Afx) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ex/B)
= (941.79/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0162/2.017 )
= 3.949 m²
Modified area for My,(Afy) = (P1/SBC) x (1 + 6.ey/L)
= (941.79/250.00) x (1 + 6 x 0.0059/1.867 )
= 3.838 m²
Size,(L x B) = 1.925 x 2.075 m
Area provided ,(Ap) = 3.994 m² > Af.

SBC Check:
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1w) = P1 / (L x B) = 235.78 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2w) = WMx / (L x B x B/6) = 10.0464 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3w) = WMy / (B x L x L/6) = 3.9303 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMaxw) = Pr1w + Pr2w + Pr3w = 249.76 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMinw) = Pr1w - Pr2w - Pr3w = 221.80 kN/m²
UpMaxw(249.92 kN/m²) < SBC (250.00 kN/m²),Hence ,safe.

Pressures for Different Load Combinations :
Load Combination Design Pressures(kN/m²) Working Pressures(kN/m²)
Maximum Minimum Maximum Minimum
1.50 DL + 1.50 LL374.88332.96249.92221.97

Bending Moment Calculations :
              As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.2.3.2,critical section for checking bending moment
in the design of an isolated concrete footing which supports a column shall be
a section located at the face of the column or pedestal.
Upward pressure due to axial load,(Pr1) = Pu1/ (L x B) = 353.67 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to Mx,(Pr2) = Mx / (L x B x B/6) = 15.0695 kN/m²
Upward pressure due to My,(Pr3) = My / (B x L x L/6) = 5.8954 kN/m²
Maximum upward pressure,(UpMax) = Pr1 + Pr2 + Pr3 = 374.63 kN/m²
Minimum upward pressure,(UpMin) = Pr1 - Pr2 - Pr3 = 332.70 kN/m²
Projection-X,(Xproj) = (L - l)/2
= (1.925 - 0.300)/2
= 0.813 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - Xproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 332.96 + (1.925 - 0.813) x ((374.88 - 332.96)/1.925)
= 357.19 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Xproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.813 x (357.19+ 374.88)/2
= 297.40 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Xproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.813 x (357.19 + 2 x 374.88)
               / (3 x (357.19 + 374.88))
= 0.410 m
Design BMx,(Mux) = UpPrArea x CGDist x B
= 297.40 x 0.410 x 2.075
= 249.65 kN-m
Projection-Y,(Yproj) = (B - b)/2
= (2.075 - 0.450)/2
= 0.813 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (B - Yproj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/B)
= 332.96 + (2.075 - 0.813) x ((374.88 - 332.96)/2.075)
= 358.47 kN/m²
Upward pressure area,(UpPrArea) = Yproj x (UpCr + UpMax)/2
= 0.813 x (358.47+ 374.88)/2
= 297.92 kN/m
CG distance from column face,(CGDist) = Yproj x (UpCr + (2 x UpMax))
              /(3 x (UpCr + UpMax))
= 0.813 x (358.47 + 2 x 374.88) / (3 x (358.47 + 374.88))
= 0.409 m
Design BMy,(Muy) = UpPrArea x CGDist x L
= 297.92 x 0.409 x 1.925
= 227.49 kN-m

Depth Calculations :
Depth required for punching shear :
As per IS 456:2000 Clause 31.6.3.1,the calculated shear stress at the
critical section shall not exceed ks x tauc
               where,
               ks = 0.5 + bac, but not greater than 1,bac being the ratio of
                             short side to the long side of column, and
               tauc = 0.25 x Ö(fck )in limit state method of design.

Depth required for punching shear is calculated by equating the actual stress
to permissible stress and by solving the resulting quadratic equation.
Total depth assumed,(D) = 0.525 m
Bottom cover = 0.050 m
Effective Depth Calculation :
Effective depth,(deffx) = 0.469 m
Effective depth,(deffy) = 0.458 m
Effective depth,(deff) = 0.469 m
Depth || to X axis at critical section,(dpunch_x) = 0.469 m
Depth || to Y axis at critical section,(dpunch_y) = 0.469 m
Resisting area || to X axis,(Arx) = dpunch_x x 2 x (l + deff)
= 0.469 x 2 x (0.300 + 0.469)
= 0.721 m²
Resisting area || to Y axis,(Ary) = dpunch_y x 2 x (b + deff)
= 0.469 x 2 x (0.450 + 0.469)
= 0.862 m²
Resisting area,(Ar) = Arx + Ary
= 1.583 m²
Shear force,(V) = (P / Ap) x (Ap -((l + deff) x (b + deff)))
= (1284.26 / 3.994) x (3.994 - (0.769 x 0.919))
= 1057.04 kN
Actual shear stress = V / Ar
= 1057.04 / 1.583
= 667.60 kN/m²
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x Ö(fck) x ks
ks = 0.5 + betaC
betaC = short column side/ long column side
= 0.300 / 0.450 = 0.667
ks = 0.5 + 0.667 = 1.167 > 1    ,ks = 1
Permissible shear stress = 0.25 x 4.4721 x 1.000
= 1.118 N/mm²
= 1118.03 kN/m²

Actual shear stress < Permissible shear stress.
              Hence,Safe in punching shear.

Calculation Of Moment Of Resistance :
Total depth,(D) = 0.525 m
Minimum depth,(Dmin) = 0.000 m
For (Fe415),k = 0.479
R = 0.36 x fck x k x (1 - 0.42 x k)
= 0.36 x 20.000 x 0.479 x (1 - 0.42 x 0.479)
= 2.756
Moment of resistanceX = R x width at NA x deffx x deffx
= 2.756 x 2.075 x 0.469 x 0.469
= 1264.76 kN-m > 249.65 kN-m
Moment of resistance Y = R x width at NA x deffy x deffy
= 2.756 x 1.925 x 0.458 x 0.458
= 1123.93 kN-m > 227.49 kN-m

Steel Calculations :
For Mux :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffx
= 2.075 x 0.469
= 0.973 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Mux)/(fck x B x deffx²)]
Required steel area,(Astx) = [0.5(fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001525 m²
= 1525 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.15666 %

Provide #12 - 14 nos.(1583 mm²)
Spacing = (L - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (2.075 - 0.012 - (2 x 0.050))/(14 - 1)
= 0.151 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)
For Muy :
Cross sectional area,(C/Sarea) = width at NA x deffy
= 1.925 x 0.458
= 0.882 m²
val = 1 - [(4.6 x Muy)/(fck x B x deffy²)]
Required steel area,(Asty) = [0.5 (fck/fy) x (1 - Ö(val))] x C/Sarea
= 0.001424 m²
= 1424 mm²
Required steel pt. = 0.16153 %

Provide #10 - 19 nos.(1492 mm²)
Spacing = (B - dia. - (2 x end cover))/(no - 1)
= (1.925 - 0.010 - (2 x 0.050))/(19 - 1)
= 0.101 m < maximum spacing(0.200 m)

Check For One Way Shear :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 33.2.4.1,the critical section for this
condition shall be assumed as a vertical section located at a distance equal to the effective depth
of the footing from the face of the column or pedestal.
For X-axis :
Projection-X,(proj)= (L - l)/2 - deffx
= (1.925 - 0.300)/2 - 0.469
= 0.343 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 332.96 + (1.925 - 0.343) x ((374.88 - 332.96)/1.925)
= 367.40 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vx) = (proj x B) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.343 x 2.075) x 371.14
= 254.79 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffx x B
= 0.469 x 2.075
= 0.973 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001583 x 100)/0.973
= 0.16270
Permissible shear stress = 297.75 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vx / Ar= 254.79 / 0.973
= 261.26 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(297.75 kN/m²)
For Y-axis :
Projection-Y,(proj) = (B - b)/2 - deffy
= (2.075 - 0.450)/2 - 0.458
= 0.355 m
Critical upward pressure,(UpCr) = UpMin + (L - proj) x ((UpMax - UpMin)/L)
= 332.96 + (2.075 - 0.355) x ((374.88 - 332.96)/2.075)
= 367.72 kN/m²
Shear force,(Vy) = (proj x L) x (UpCr+UpMax)/2
= (0.355 x 1.925) x 371.30
= 248.47 kN
Resisting area,(Ar) = deffy x L
= 0.458 x 1.925
= 0.882 m²
Percentage of steel at critical section = (0.001492 x 100)/0.882
= 0.16926
Permissible shear stress = 302.69 kN/m²
Actual shear stress = Vy / Ar= 248.47 / 0.882
= 280.60 kN/m²
              < permissible shear stress(302.69 kN/m²)

Check For Bearing :
As per IS 456: 2000 Clause 34.4, the bearing pressure on the loaded area shall not exceed
the permissible bearing stress in direct compression multiplied by a value
equal to Ö(A1/A2), but not greater than 2.
Supporting area for bearing of footing,(A1) = (l + (4 x D)) x (b + (4 x D))
= (0.300 + (4 x 0.525)) x
               (0.450 + (4 x 0.525))
= 6.120 m² > footing area(3.994 m²)
= 3.994 m²
Loaded area at the column base,(A2) = 0.135 m²
Ö(A1/A2) = Ö(3.994/0.135) = 5.439 > 2
= 2.000
Actual bearing stress = P/A2
= 1284.26/0.135
= 9513.03 kN/m²
Permissible bearing stress = 0.45 x fck x Ö(A1/A2)
= 0.25 x 20.00 x 2.000
= 18.000 N/mm²
= 18000.00 kN/m²
Actual bearing stress < Permissible bearing strees.
               Hence,Safe in bearing.

Check For Sliding Along X axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 52.43 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1336.69 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 5.24 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 102.21 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.

Check For Sliding Along Y axis :
Load combination = 1.50DL + 1.50LL
Self wt. of footing = 52.43 kN
Stabilizing force,(W) = 1336.69 kN
Horizontal force,(H) = 15.95 kN
Soil resistance,(S) = 94.82 kN> H
Hence,check for sliding is not required.


Bond Check Calculations For Footing Bars
As Per IS 456 : 2000, Clause 26.2.1,The Required Development Length, Ld is given as
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where,
f = Nominal diameter of the footing bar in X or Y direction,
s = Stress in the bar at the section considered, at design load and
tbd = Design bond stress.
Hence, Ldx= (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564.141 mm
Ldy= (10 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 470.117 mm
Available Development Length= (Fd - Cd) / 2 - End Cover + End Anchorages(If required)
Where,
Fd= Footing size in X / Y direction
Cd= Column size in X / Y direction
End Anchorage= 4 x f, for a L hook
= 8 x f, for a 90 degrees bend
In X direction= (1.925 - 0.300) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 762.500 mm
In Y direction= (2.075 - 0.450) x 0.5 - 0.050
= 762.500 mm
Hence, the Bond check for footing bars is satisfied


Bond Check Calculations For Column Bars in Tension
Ld = (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Nominal diameter of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in Tension for column bars
Diameter of Column bar d1 = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 1.92)
= 564 mm
Available development length = Min(deffx/deffy) + Hproj
Where,
Hproj = Horizontal projection of columns bars in footing
= Min(469.000 / 458.000) + 300.000
= 758.000 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in tension is satisfied


Bond CheckCalculations For Column Bars in Compression
Required Development Length For Column Bars
Ld (f x s) / (4 x tbd)
where, other terms remaining same,
f= Dia of column bars
tbd = Design bond stress in compression for column bars
Here,
Diameter of Column bar 'd1' = 12 mm
Required Development Length for 'd1' = (12 x 0.87 x 415.00) / (4 x 2.40)
= 451 mm
Available Development length= Min(deffx/deffy)
= Min(469.000 / 458.000)
= 458 mm
Hence, the Bond check for column bars in compression is satisfied

Summary :
Provide isolated flat footing of size
1.925 x 2.075 x 0.525 m
Provide #12 - 14 nos along the length of footing.
Provide #10 - 19 nos along the width of footing.
(Bars should be bent and carried to top.)
